original: mthong phyir zhes bya ba ni dpe yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong phyir zhes bya ba ni dpe yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is seen‚Äù is the example.

original: yin na de ltar zhes bya ba ni dpe yin pas phyogs dang / dpe dag tha dad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yin na de ltar zhes bya ba ni dpe yin pas phyogs dang / dpe dag tha dad pa'i phyir te /
translated: ‚ÄúIf it were so‚Äù is the example. The position and the example are different.

original: de las gzhan pa khas len na zhes bya ba 'dod pa kho na yin pas gnod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa khas len na zhes bya ba 'dod pa kho na yin pas gnod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúIf you accept anything else‚Äù means that it is not a fault, because it is just what is asserted.

original: de las gzhan pa'i rtogs pa brdzun //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rtogs pa brdzun //
translated: ‚ÄúThe other cognition is false‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba yang thams cad brdzun pa yin pa'i phyir skyon med pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yang thams cad brdzun pa yin pa'i phyir skyon med pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: also shows that there is no fault, because everything is false.

original: de las gzhan pa'i rtogs pa yang //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rtogs pa yang //
translated: ‚ÄúThe other cognition‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba yang mi 'dod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rim pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yang mi 'dod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rim pa'o //
translated: also is not unacceptable. This is the order.

original: de ni log par grub na yang //
analyzed: de ni log par grub na yang //
translated: ‚ÄúIf that is established as false,

original: snga ma thams cad 'grub mi 'gyur //
analyzed: snga ma thams cad 'grub mi 'gyur //
translated: then all the previous is not established.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba de yang mi 'grub par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de yang mi 'grub par bstan pa ni /
translated: This also shows that it is not established.

original: des na log pa sngon 'gro can //
analyzed: des na log pa sngon 'gro can //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore, it is preceded by the false‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ste ngo bo gtso po'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste ngo bo gtso po'o //
translated: is the main point.

original: dpe'i don du yang de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba khyad par yin na thug pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: dpe'i don du yang de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba khyad par yin na thug pa med pa yin te /
translated: If the meaning of the example is also a qualifier, ‚Äúother than that,‚Äù then there is an infinite regress,

original: de dag tsam gyis thams cad brdzun pa nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag tsam gyis thams cad brdzun pa nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because by that alone all are established as false.

original: cung zad kyang dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: cung zad kyang dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement that nothing at all is associated with observation is

original: de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúother than that.‚Äù

original: de 'di gsal bar byed pa ni gang la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de 'di gsal bar byed pa ni gang la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This clarifies that, ‚Äúin regard to which‚Äù

original: gzhan la yang ni phyi rol gyi tshul la yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan la yang ni phyi rol gyi tshul la yang ngo //
translated: ‚Äúin other cases‚Äù means in the external mode.

original: des pa rnams kyi ma nges pa //
analyzed: des pa rnams kyi ma nges pa //
translated: The uncertain of the wise

original: de ni ji ltar de dag yul //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar de dag yul //
translated: how can that be their object?

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: That is,

original: de ma yin la de 'dzin phyir //
analyzed: de ma yin la de 'dzin phyir //
translated: because it is not that but apprehends it,

original: 'khrul yang 'brel phyir te mi slu ba'i phyir tshad ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'khrul yang 'brel phyir te mi slu ba'i phyir tshad ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: it is a valid cognition because it is related to it and nondeceptive.

original: rjes su dpag pas gnod pa na //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas gnod pa na //
translated: When it is undermined by inference,

original: 'gal ba mi 'khrul can du'ang 'gyur //
analyzed: 'gal ba mi 'khrul can du'ang 'gyur //
translated: it becomes contradictory and nonerroneous.

original: zhes bya ba'i phyi rol gyi mi dmigs pa ni mngon sum dang 'gal ba yin no zhes zer ba la sgrub byed bstan par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i phyi rol gyi mi dmigs pa ni mngon sum dang 'gal ba yin no zhes zer ba la sgrub byed bstan par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase the non-apprehension of external objects is a response to the statement that the non-apprehension of external objects contradicts direct perception.üîΩThe phrase because the existence of external objects is illogical indicates that the non-apprehension of the object of negation is not established.

original: phyi rol nyid mi rigs pa'i phyir de la gnod pa nyid mi 'grub par bstan pa ni /üîΩgnod pa dang bral zhes bya ba'o //üîΩbden pa nyid kyang rmi lam la sogs pa'i gnod byed kyi gnod par byed pa mi dmigs pa yin la /üîΩka ba la sogs pa'i shes pa ni phyi rol gyi gnod byed mi dmigs par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: phyi rol nyid mi rigs pa'i phyir de la gnod pa nyid mi 'grub par bstan pa ni / gnod pa dang bral zhes bya ba'o // bden pa nyid kyang rmi lam la sogs pa'i gnod byed kyi gnod par byed pa mi dmigs pa yin la / ka ba la sogs pa'i shes pa ni phyi rol gyi gnod byed mi dmigs par bstan pa ni /
translated: The phrase the non-apprehension of the object of negation indicates that the non-apprehension of the object of negation is not established.üîΩThe non-apprehension of the object of negation is the non-apprehension of the object of negation that contradicts the truth of the dream, etc.üîΩThe phrase the non-apprehension of the object of negation that contradicts the external object indicates the non-apprehension of the object of negation that contradicts the external object.

original: rmi sogs zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde skyed ces bya ba ni phyi rol @147b gyi gnod byed mi dmigs pa yin pa'o //
analyzed: rmi sogs zhes bya ba'o // de skyed ces bya ba ni phyi rol @147b gyi gnod byed mi dmigs pa yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase the non-apprehension of the object of negation that contradicts the external object indicates the non-apprehension of the object of negation that contradicts the external object.üîΩThe phrase the non-apprehension of the object of negation that contradicts the external object indicates the non-apprehension of the object of negation that contradicts the external object.

original: rnam shes yod dang zhes bya ba rjes su brjod pa ni skad cig sogs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam shes yod dang zhes bya ba rjes su brjod pa ni skad cig sogs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase the non-apprehension of the object of negation that contradicts the external object indicates the non-apprehension of the object of negation that contradicts the external object.üîΩThe phrase the non-apprehension of the object of negation that contradicts the external object indicates the non-apprehension of the object of negation that contradicts the external object.üîΩThe phrase the non-apprehension of the object of negation that contradicts the external object indicates the non-apprehension of the object of negation that contradicts the external object.

original: shes pa'i ngo bo dmigs pa yin yang de nyid dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin no snyam du sems pa la grub pa la sgrub pa yin par bstan pa ni rnam shes ngo bo zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: shes pa'i ngo bo dmigs pa yin yang de nyid dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin no snyam du sems pa la grub pa la sgrub pa yin par bstan pa ni rnam shes ngo bo zhes bya ba'o//
translated: Although the nature of consciousness is the object, if one thinks that it is itself endowed with an object, the reply is: ‚ÄúThe consciousness itself is not the object.‚Äù

original: dmigs med min pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid do //
analyzed: dmigs med min pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúNot without an object‚Äù means that it is endowed with an object.

original: gzhan nyid kyi phyi rol ma yin pa la dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: gzhan nyid kyi phyi rol ma yin pa la dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na /
translated: If it is not the case that it is not different from the object, then it is endowed with an object.

original: rmi sogs dag la gnod med pas //
analyzed: rmi sogs dag la gnod med pas //
translated: ‚ÄúIn dreams and so on, there is no error.‚Äù

original: da ni khyod kyi sgrub byed pa //
analyzed: da ni khyod kyi sgrub byed pa //
translated: Now, your proof

original: chos mthun can dpe med par 'gyur //
analyzed: chos mthun can dpe med par 'gyur //
translated: will be without a similar example.

original: zhes bya ba de la bstan pa ni des na rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de la bstan pa ni des na rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The reply is: ‚ÄúTherefore, the nature of consciousness is not the object.‚Äù

original: rig pa yin pa ni tshod ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: rig pa yin pa ni tshod ma yin pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúKnowledge‚Äù means that it is not a pot,

original: mngon sum gyi bdag nyid kyi rig pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi bdag nyid kyi rig pa'o //
translated: but is knowledge that has the nature of direct perception.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni bdag nyid ma yin pa la lhag par zhen pa can yin gyi zhen pa ji lta ba bzhin du thob pa ni 'dzin byed ma yin zhing dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni bdag nyid ma yin pa la lhag par zhen pa can yin gyi zhen pa ji lta ba bzhin du thob pa ni 'dzin byed ma yin zhing dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Inference is for one who is not himself attached, but it does not obtain in accordance with the attachment, nor is it the apprehension or the object.

original: phyi rol du smra ba po'i lta bu'o zhes bstan pa ni rjes su dpag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du smra ba po'i lta bu'o zhes bstan pa ni rjes su dpag ces bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that it is like the view of an externalist is the inference.

original: thob pa yang rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i shes pa gzhan skyed pa'i rjes su dpag pa la'o //
analyzed: thob pa yang rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i shes pa gzhan skyed pa'i rjes su dpag pa la'o //
translated: And the obtaining of the other knowledge that is in accordance with it is the inference.

original: mngon sum la ni ngo bo rig pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mngon sum la ni ngo bo rig pa yin gyi /
translated: Direct perception is the awareness of the nature of an object,

original: shes pa ni ma yin te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa ni ma yin te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but not the knowledge, because there is no distinction.

original: khyad phar yod na de yang rjes su dpag par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni mi slu ba can gang yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad phar yod na de yang rjes su dpag par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni mi slu ba can gang yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If there were a distinction, that would be an inference. The statement that it is that which is nondeceptive isüîΩthe direct perception.

original: de ltar na de'i bskyed bya'i shes pa gzhan skad cig pa nyid la sogs pa las tha dad par rig pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar na de'i bskyed bya'i shes pa gzhan skad cig pa nyid la sogs pa las tha dad par rig pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Thus, the statement that the other knowledge that is produced by it is the awareness of the difference from momentariness, etc.,

original: rkyen gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rkyen gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is the inference.

original: bzlog pa'i tshad ma rnams kyis rang la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bzlog pa'i tshad ma rnams kyis rang la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is contradictory for the valid cognitions that refute to operate on themselves.

original: mngon sum la sogs pa yi yul //
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa yi yul //
translated: The objects of direct perception and so on

original: phyi rol nyid du gnas pa yin //
analyzed: phyi rol nyid du gnas pa yin //
translated: are external objects.

original: de dgag byas pa de yi phyir /
analyzed: de dgag byas pa de yi phyir /
translated: Because of refuting that,

original: de dag gi phyogs la gnod 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag gi phyogs la gnod 'gyur //
translated: harm will come to their position.

original: gnod dang bral ba'i blo yin phyir //
analyzed: gnod dang bral ba'i blo yin phyir //
translated: Because of being a mind free from harm,

original: phyi rol don yod snyam pa yi //
analyzed: phyi rol don yod snyam pa yi //
translated: the thought that external objects exist

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rig pa'i bdag nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rig pa'i bdag nyid yin zhing /
translated: and so on.

original: gzhan gyi yul yang ma yin pa lkog tu gyur pa'i ngo bo ni rang nyid rig pa yin la de la 'gal bcud zad kyang med de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi yul yang ma yin pa lkog tu gyur pa'i ngo bo ni rang nyid rig pa yin la de la 'gal bcud zad kyang med de /
translated: The nature of awareness is that it is not the object of another, and the hidden entity is reflexive awareness. There is no contradiction in that.

original: de med pa la don gyis go bar mi 'byung pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de med pa la don gyis go bar mi 'byung pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Because if it did not exist, it would not be implied by the meaning.

original: de'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The nature of that is said.

original: rig pa na zhes bya ba ni rig pa'i bdag nyid yin na ste /
analyzed: rig pa na zhes bya ba ni rig pa'i bdag nyid yin na ste /
translated: If it is awareness, it is the nature of awareness.

original: gang la rig pa yod pa ma yin pa des rig bzhin pa ma yin @148a * //
analyzed: gang la rig pa yod pa ma yin pa des rig bzhin pa ma yin @148a * //
translated: That which does not have awareness does not have the nature of awareness.

original: pa'i don to //
analyzed: pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not being cognized.

original: thams cad kyis ni skyes bu rnams kyis so //
analyzed: thams cad kyis ni skyes bu rnams kyis so //
translated: All men.

original: rnam pa gzhan du'ang zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du'ang zhes bya ba ni //
translated: In another way, too,

original: gcig nyid kyis kyang ste /
analyzed: gcig nyid kyis kyang ste /
translated: by one alone,

original: gnyi ga la yang ngo bo las gzhan pa'i las nyid du rig pa med pa'i phyir mthong ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang ngo bo las gzhan pa'i las nyid du rig pa med pa'i phyir mthong ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: in both cases, there is no seeing, because there is no awareness of an action that is different from the entity.

original: ltos pa med pa'i rig pa ni rig par byed pa gzhan thob pa la gegs byed pa yin par bstan pa ni don gyis go ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ltos pa med pa'i rig pa ni rig par byed pa gzhan thob pa la gegs byed pa yin par bstan pa ni don gyis go ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning is that the awareness that does not depend on anything else is the obstruction to the attainment of the awareness that makes it known.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni yul gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyis de rig par byed pa gzhan du rtog pa nyid ni mthong ba dang 'gal ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni yul gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyis de rig par byed pa gzhan du rtog pa nyid ni mthong ba dang 'gal ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: How? The meaning is that the very conception of the awareness that makes it known as something else, because it is not a different object, is contrary to what is seen.

original: khyad med ces bya ba ni las nyid sngon po'i rig pa la khongs su gtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khyad med ces bya ba ni las nyid sngon po'i rig pa la khongs su gtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Without a difference, because the action itself is not included in the awareness of blue.

original: phyi rol gyi zhen pa ni 'di'i de nyid 'brel ba ma yin pa de'i phyir gang gi tshe gzung ba'i rnam pa sngon po la sogs pa rtogs pa de'i tshe 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam par rig pa ni gang du ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba las sogs
analyzed: phyi rol gyi zhen pa ni 'di'i de nyid 'brel ba ma yin pa de'i phyir gang gi tshe gzung ba'i rnam pa sngon po la sogs pa rtogs pa de'i tshe 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam par rig pa ni gang du ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba las sogs
translated: The attachment to external objects is not related to the suchness of consciousness. Therefore, when the aspect of the object, such as blue, is cognized, the cognizing consciousness is not seen.

original: pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag gcig gi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir rig pa gcig la rig pa gzhan du thal bar 'gyur ba ni byung ba'i tshul mi shes pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag gcig gi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir rig pa gcig la rig pa gzhan du thal bar 'gyur ba ni byung ba'i tshul mi shes pa nyid yin la /
translated: Thus, because the object and the apprehender are one entity, it follows that one consciousness is another consciousness. This is the way that the opponent‚Äôs position is refuted.

original: gnyi ga ma yin pa'i ngo bo rig pa can gyi rig pa smra ba po la gnyi ga rig par thal bar 'gyur ba'i gnas skabs gang yin /
analyzed: gnyi ga ma yin pa'i ngo bo rig pa can gyi rig pa smra ba po la gnyi ga rig par thal bar 'gyur ba'i gnas skabs gang yin /
translated: What situation is there for the proponent of awareness to say that the awareness that is neither of those two is aware of both?

original: rnam pa 'gas kyang dngos po'i ngo bo las tha dad pa nyid kyi shes pa de'i 'dzin byed du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: rnam pa 'gas kyang dngos po'i ngo bo las tha dad pa nyid kyi shes pa de'i 'dzin byed du 'gyur zhing /
translated: In no way is the consciousness that is different from the entity of the object the apprehender of that object.

original: de la gzung bya ni rdzas la sogs pa yin gyi rang nyid ni ma yin no zhes rjes su brjod nas bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de la gzung bya ni rdzas la sogs pa yin gyi rang nyid ni ma yin no zhes rjes su brjod nas bstan pa ni /
translated: Having stated that the object of apprehension is substance and so on, but not itself, he teaches:

original: bdag gi zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bdag gi zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúMy‚Äù means

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i yang gzung bar bya ba ni spyi yin la /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i yang gzung bar bya ba ni spyi yin la /
translated: that the object of apprehension of blue and so on is a universal.

original: 'dzin par byed pa ni rig par byed pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa ni rig par byed pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the apprehender is the very knower.

original: sngon po nyid rig pa rig pas zhes bya ba ni rig pa'i bdag nyid yin la de'i phyir /
analyzed: sngon po nyid rig pa rig pas zhes bya ba ni rig pa'i bdag nyid yin la de'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúBlue itself is the knower‚Äù means that it is the nature of the knower. Therefore:

original: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid cis ma yin //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid cis ma yin //
translated: Why is it not the nature of both?

original: bum pa shes pa po nyid dang // bum pa la shes pa po nyid dang shes pa po nyid yin na bdag gis bum pa shes so zhes rtogs ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bum pa shes pa po nyid dang // bum pa la shes pa po nyid dang shes pa po nyid yin na bdag gis bum pa shes so zhes rtogs ba'i phyir /
translated: If it is the knower of the pot and the knower of the pot is the knower, then because of the realization ‚ÄúI know the pot,‚Äù

original: kho bo cag gi sbyor bas 'brel pa'i bdag go zhes bya ba'i shes pa nyid kyang bum pa'i shes pa'i byed pa po nyid du shes pa po nyid yin na bum pa'i shes pa po nyid yin na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kho bo cag gi sbyor bas 'brel pa'i bdag go zhes bya ba'i shes pa nyid kyang bum pa'i shes pa'i byed pa po nyid du shes pa po nyid yin na bum pa'i shes pa po nyid yin na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The cognition ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is also the cognizer of the pot, that is, the agent of the cognition of the pot.

original: 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de la bdag nyid rig pa ni bdag nyid byed pa po la yang rigs pa yin zhes bya ba de la bstan @148b pa ni bdag gzhan du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de la bdag nyid rig pa ni bdag nyid byed pa po la yang rigs pa yin zhes bya ba de la bstan @148b pa ni bdag gzhan du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúit would be so‚Äù means that it is reasonable that the self is the agent of the cognition of itself.

original: gnyi ga'i rang bzhin nyid ni sngon po la sogs pa'i yin pa de'i phyir dag pa nyid kyi rnam pa med pa 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i rang bzhin nyid ni sngon po la sogs pa'i yin pa de'i phyir dag pa nyid kyi rnam pa med pa 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: The nature of both is that of blue, etc., and therefore it is the apprehension of the aspect of the pure self.

original: rig pa ni gzung ba las tha mi dad pa nyid yin na yang de rig pa yin par mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni gtam tsam mo //
analyzed: rig pa ni gzung ba las tha mi dad pa nyid yin na yang de rig pa yin par mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni gtam tsam mo //
translated: Even though cognition is not different from the object, it is unreasonable that it is the cognition of that. This is mere talk.

original: sngon po dang bde ba la sogs pa yang rang rig pa gcig gis byed pa'i khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin te lhan cig rig pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sngon po dang bde ba la sogs pa yang rang rig pa gcig gis byed pa'i khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin te lhan cig rig pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Blue and pleasure and so on are not different because they are included in the category of being made by the same self-awareness, because it would follow that they would not be cognized simultaneously.

original: rjes su 'gro ba ni rig pa'i don dang lhan cig gnyi ga'i ngo bor ma dres pa'i snang ba las grub par gcig pa nyid bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba ni rig pa'i don dang lhan cig gnyi ga'i ngo bor ma dres pa'i snang ba las grub par gcig pa nyid bsal ba yin te /
translated: The explanation of the refutation of sameness is that the object of cognition is established from the appearance of both natures without mixing.

original: gcig gi ngo bor gcig 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gcig gi ngo bor gcig 'gyur ba //
translated: One would become the nature of the other.

original: 'di ni dbang phyug gis bshad min //
analyzed: 'di ni dbang phyug gis bshad min //
translated: This is not explained by ƒ™≈õvara.

original: zhes bya ba bsal ba bshad pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba bsal ba bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the refutation of the statement

original: gcig gi rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gcig gi rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe nature of one‚Äù is

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni rnam par chad par snang ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni rnam par chad par snang ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúall‚Äù refers to the appearance of the disconnected.

original: tha dad nyams phyir rdzas re la //üîΩtha dad ngo bor dmigs pa min //
analyzed: tha dad nyams phyir rdzas re la // tha dad ngo bor dmigs pa min //
translated: Because of the loss of difference, each substanceüîΩis not observed to have a different nature.

original: mngon sum rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum rig pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not direct perception.

original: las kyi ngo bo yin zhes zer ba ni //
analyzed: las kyi ngo bo yin zhes zer ba ni //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIt is the nature of action‚Äù

original: rig bya rig byed ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rig bya rig byed ces bya ba'o //
translated: is ‚Äúthe object of cognition and the cognition.‚Äù

original: thams cad gcig tu zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni /
analyzed: thams cad gcig tu zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the statement ‚ÄúAll are one‚Äù is

original: tshe sngon po zhes bya ba'o //üîΩrang bzhin tha dad las zhes bya ba ni rig bya rig byed dag las so //
analyzed: tshe sngon po zhes bya ba'o // rang bzhin tha dad las zhes bya ba ni rig bya rig byed dag las so //
translated: It is called the ‚Äúprevious life.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúFrom a different nature‚Äù means from the object of knowledge and the means of knowledge.

original: rang bzhin tha dad pa'i rgyu nyid du yul tha dad pa yin zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin tha dad pa'i rgyu nyid du yul tha dad pa yin zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The reason for the difference in nature is the difference in objects.

original: yul tha dad pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul tha dad pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by ‚Äúfrom the difference in objects.‚Äù

original: rang bzhin la dbye ba med na yul tha dad pa yin yang tha dad par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir khyab pa ma yin par bstan pa ni de ltar zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin la dbye ba med na yul tha dad pa yin yang tha dad par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir khyab pa ma yin par bstan pa ni de ltar zhes pa'o //
translated: If there were no difference in nature, even if there were a difference in objects, there would be no difference. This is taught by ‚Äúin that case.‚Äù

original: dam pa'i don du zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa'i bdag chags las byung ba'i 'khrul pa yod pa nyid med pa tsam gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dam pa'i don du zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa'i bdag chags las byung ba'i 'khrul pa yod pa nyid med pa tsam gyi phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn reality‚Äù means that the error that arises from beginningless self-attachment is simply the nonexistence of existence.

original: thar pa la 'bad pa ni 'di dang 'di bya'o zhes zhen pa yin la /
analyzed: thar pa la 'bad pa ni 'di dang 'di bya'o zhes zhen pa yin la /
translated: The effort for liberation is the attachment to ‚Äúthis and that should be done.‚Äù

original: de'i rgyu mtshan gyi byed pa yang bsam pa dang sbyor ba dag ni rnam par rtog ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir mngon par 'dod pa tsam yin te /
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan gyi byed pa yang bsam pa dang sbyor ba dag ni rnam par rtog ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir mngon par 'dod pa tsam yin te /
translated: The reason for that is that the intention and the application are simply the desire for the nature of conceptualization.

original: rang rig ba ma yin pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni thar pa la sogs zhes bya ba la don med pa nyid sems pa ste /
analyzed: rang rig ba ma yin pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni thar pa la sogs zhes bya ba la don med pa nyid sems pa ste /
translated: If you assert that consciousness exists,

original: de'i phyir thar pa'i 'bad pa yang //üîΩkhyed la 'bras bu med par thal //
analyzed: de'i phyir thar pa'i 'bad pa yang // khyed la 'bras bu med par thal //
translated: then you must assert that it is different from form,

original: zhes bya ba dang / rnam shes yod dang tha dad dang // de bzhin skad cig nyid sogs blo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / rnam shes yod dang tha dad dang // de bzhin skad cig nyid sogs blo //
translated: and likewise, that it is momentary, and so on.

original: gal te bden par khas len na //
analyzed: gal te bden par khas len na //
translated: If you assert that it is real,üîΩthen you must assert that it is permanent,üîΩand you must assert that it is singular.

original: zhes bya ba de la chos dang chos can gyi 'brel pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de la chos dang chos can gyi 'brel pa ni /
translated: The connection between the predicate and the subject is as follows.

original: @149a * // rtog pa med pa'i sprul pa yin pa'i phyir la rtog pa yang brdzun pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: @149a * // rtog pa med pa'i sprul pa yin pa'i phyir la rtog pa yang brdzun pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is a nonconceptual emanation, and because conceptual consciousness is false,

original: rnam par rtog pa skye ba na zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa skye ba na zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: it should be said that ‚Äúwhen conceptual consciousness arises, it is false.‚Äù

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa pa'i lta ba la skad cig pa rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa pa'i lta ba la skad cig pa rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
translated: The YogƒÅcƒÅra view is that the object of refutation is established as being the consciousness that is momentary.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan btab pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan btab pa yin no //
translated: The response to that is as follows.

original: tha mi dad pa la ni rtog pa med pa'i kho na 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa la ni rtog pa med pa'i kho na 'jug pa yin te /
translated: But when they are not different, only non-conceptual cognition is applicable,

original: rang nyid rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is self-aware.

original: phyi rol la ni rigs pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: phyi rol la ni rigs pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The external is taught to be only logical.

original: gzhan yang rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Moreover, it is called conceptual.

original: shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid rtog pa med pa'i tshad ma gzhan yin la blo ni don gyis go ba'i rtogs bya yin pa'i phyir brtag bya yin te /
analyzed: shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid rtog pa med pa'i tshad ma gzhan yin la blo ni don gyis go ba'i rtogs bya yin pa'i phyir brtag bya yin te /
translated: The nature of cognition itself is non-conceptual valid cognition, but the mind is to be investigated because it is the object of understanding.

original: 'di skad cig pa nyid la sogs pa dang 'brel pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di skad cig pa nyid la sogs pa dang 'brel pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is related to momentariness and so on.

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa bshad pa ni rnam par rtog pa med pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa bshad pa ni rnam par rtog pa med pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of such a nature is non-conceptual.

original: gzhan med na ni rtog pa med pa med na'o //
analyzed: gzhan med na ni rtog pa med pa med na'o //
translated: If the other does not exist, non-conceptual cognition does not exist.

original: gal te ni khas len na'o //
analyzed: gal te ni khas len na'o //
translated: If it is accepted,

original: mthong ba med na 'di mthong ngo //üîΩzhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'ang med de /
analyzed: mthong ba med na 'di mthong ngo // zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'ang med de /
translated: if seeing does not exist, this seeingüîΩwould also be a conceptual thought.

original: rnam par rtog pa tsam ni tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa tsam ni tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: Mere conceptual thought is not valid cognition,

original: thal ches pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thal ches pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is too far-fetched.

original: rnam par rtog ces bya ba ste dran pa yin pa'i phyir dang / dngos po ma yin pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog ces bya ba ste dran pa yin pa'i phyir dang / dngos po ma yin pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is called ‚Äúconceptual‚Äù because it is memory, and because it has a non-existent object.

original: phyi rol la ni mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba can gyi rnam par rtog pa'am gzhan ma yin par bstan pa ni gang tshe zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol la ni mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba can gyi rnam par rtog pa'am gzhan ma yin par bstan pa ni gang tshe zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that external [objects] are not seen, but are only conceptual, is the line ‚Äúwhen there is no object.‚Äù

original: tha snyad med ces bya ba ni phyi rol la'o //üîΩdon dam par zhes bya ba ni bden pa'i phyi rol gyi yul mthong ba'i rjes su 'brangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tha snyad med ces bya ba ni phyi rol la'o // don dam par zhes bya ba ni bden pa'i phyi rol gyi yul mthong ba'i rjes su 'brangs pa'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúNo convention‚Äù refers to external [objects].üîΩ‚ÄúUltimately‚Äù means that the conceptual [mind] is deceptive because it follows after the seeing of real external objects.

original: slu ba can gyi rnam par rtog pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩshes pa'i rnam pa nyid rang nyid rig par byed pa la phyi rol gyi bag chags kyi phyi rol gyi rnam rtog yin gyi gzhan la ni ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: slu ba can gyi rnam par rtog pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // shes pa'i rnam pa nyid rang nyid rig par byed pa la phyi rol gyi bag chags kyi phyi rol gyi rnam rtog yin gyi gzhan la ni ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: mi mngon pa'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mi mngon pa'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The statement that the aspect of consciousness itself is self-aware, and that external objects are only conceptual imputations due to external latent propensities, and not anything else, is the line ‚Äúthe nature of which is not manifest.‚Äù

original: rang nyid rig bya yin gyi phyi rol ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang nyid rig bya yin gyi phyi rol ni ma yin no //
translated: It is the object of self-awareness, not of external awareness.

original: shes pa'i rnam nyid yin na thun mong ba nyid ji ltar yin zhes zer ba la mig ser can zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: shes pa'i rnam nyid yin na thun mong ba nyid ji ltar yin zhes zer ba la mig ser can zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If it is the form of consciousness itself, how can it be common to all?

original: phyi rol gyi bag chags thun mong ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi bag chags thun mong ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The answer is that it is common because it is the common latent impression of the external world.

original: 'khor ba pa'i shes pa thams cad gzung ba la sogs pa'i ngo bos brnyogs pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa dang brdzun pa yin te /üîΩ@149b phyi rol gyi don gyi stong pa'i phyir yang yod pa'i don dang cig shos nyid kyi nye ba dang cig shos med pa tshad ma dang cig shos kyi rnam par dbye ba med la 'u bu cag la sogs pa'i shes pa thams cad log pa yin te
analyzed: 'khor ba pa'i shes pa thams cad gzung ba la sogs pa'i ngo bos brnyogs pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa dang brdzun pa yin te / @149b phyi rol gyi don gyi stong pa'i phyir yang yod pa'i don dang cig shos nyid kyi nye ba dang cig shos med pa tshad ma dang cig shos kyi rnam par dbye ba med la 'u bu cag la sogs pa'i shes pa thams cad log pa yin te
translated: All consciousnesses of transmigrators are false and conceptual because they are disturbed by the nature of the grasped and so on.

original: / rnam par rtog la yin pa'i phyir /üîΩnye dang bskal pa nyid la ni //
analyzed: / rnam par rtog la yin pa'i phyir / nye dang bskal pa nyid la ni //
translated: Because external objects are empty, the existence of objects, the proximity of one, the nonexistence of another, the distinction of valid knowledge from invalid knowledge, and all consciousnesses such as ours are false because they are conceptual.üîΩProximity and distance

original: yod dang med pa rnyed dka' la //
analyzed: yod dang med pa rnyed dka' la //
translated: are difficult to find in existence and nonexistence.

original: zhes bya ba bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba bstan pa ni /
translated: This is taught by:

original: thams cad kyang zhes bya ba ste khas blang ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang zhes bya ba ste khas blang ba'o //
translated: All means that it is accepted.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis dgag par bya ba rjes su brjod pa ni 'di ni bcom ldan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis dgag par bya ba rjes su brjod pa ni 'di ni bcom ldan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The negation by another mode is stated in this Bhagavat, etc.

original: bzlog pa ni bskal pa ste med pa'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni bskal pa ste med pa'o //
translated: The opposite is the absence of the negation.

original: de 'di nye ba la sogs pa ste dge ba dang cig shos la sogs pa'i bag chags mang pa'i phyir dka' ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩyod min pa la 'byung yod min //
analyzed: de 'di nye ba la sogs pa ste dge ba dang cig shos la sogs pa'i bag chags mang pa'i phyir dka' ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // yod min pa la 'byung yod min //
translated: That is not difficult, because of the abundance of the residues of virtue and the residues of the opposite, etc.üîΩThe non-existent does not arise.

original: yod pa la ni med pa med //
analyzed: yod pa la ni med pa med //
translated: The existent does not cease.

original: ces bya ba dang / 'du byed thams cad skad cig pa //
analyzed: ces bya ba dang / 'du byed thams cad skad cig pa //
translated: All formations are momentary.

original: zhes bya ba yang brdzun pa nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yang brdzun pa nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since there is no difference in the falsity of these,

original: grangs can pa'i lta ba spangs nas sangs rgyas pa'i phyogs su lhung ba ni don med pa yin te /
analyzed: grangs can pa'i lta ba spangs nas sangs rgyas pa'i phyogs su lhung ba ni don med pa yin te /
translated: it is pointless to abandon the Samkhya view and fall into the Buddhist position.

original: log pa'i shes pa khyad par med bzhin du grangs can la sogs pa'i yongs su dor nas sangs rgyas kyi lta ba phyogs gcig tu ma lhung ba mi rigs so zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: log pa'i shes pa khyad par med bzhin du grangs can la sogs pa'i yongs su dor nas sangs rgyas kyi lta ba phyogs gcig tu ma lhung ba mi rigs so zhes zer ba la /
translated: But, having rejected the Samkhya and so on, it is not reasonable to fall to one side and adopt the Buddhist view, since there is no difference between the false cognitions.

original: sangs rgyas pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
translated: To this it is replied: The Buddhist...

original: mi slu ba dang cig shos dag gi tshad ma dang cig shos nyid yin pas phyogs su lhung ba dang cig shos dag yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi slu ba dang cig shos dag gi tshad ma dang cig shos nyid yin pas phyogs su lhung ba dang cig shos dag yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that since they are valid cognitions and otherwise, they are not biased and otherwise.

original: sad pa'i shes pa rnams brdzun pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: sad pa'i shes pa rnams brdzun pa nyid yin na /
translated: If the cognitions of the waking state are false,

original: yul sogs pa la gnod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: yul sogs pa la gnod par 'gyur la /
translated: then objects and so on are undermined.

original: mi gnod kyang rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa brdzun pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: mi gnod kyang rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa brdzun pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: But even if they are not undermined, the yogi's cognition is false, and therefore

original: ka ba la sogs pa'i shes pa las khyad par med do //
analyzed: ka ba la sogs pa'i shes pa las khyad par med do //
translated: there is no difference between the cognition of a pillar and so on.

original: gal te blo ni brdzun nyid na //
analyzed: gal te blo ni brdzun nyid na //
translated: If the mind is false,

original: gnod pa ji ltar dmigs ma yin //
analyzed: gnod pa ji ltar dmigs ma yin //
translated: how is it that harm is not observed?

original: gnod pa med kyang der 'gyur na //
analyzed: gnod pa med kyang der 'gyur na //
translated: If it were so even without harm,

original: rnam par gzhag pa 'thad pa min //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa 'thad pa min //
translated: the system would not be tenable.

original: zhes bya ba 'di la bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di la bstan pa ni /
translated: Here is the explanation:

original: blo rnams brdzun pa nyid la ni //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: blo rnams brdzun pa nyid la ni // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But the mind is false.üîΩThus, since we are harmed by the harm to you, and since the distinction between valid cognition and non-valid cognition is made on the basis of existence and non-existence, this distinction is not undermined in our system.

original: de ltar gnod pa nyid kyis kho bo cag gi phyogs la yang gnod par byed pa yod pa dang med pa nyid kyis byas pa tshad ma dang cig shos su rnam par gzhag pa 'di ni mi mthun pa'i sad pa'i shes pa mthong na kho bo cag gi
analyzed: de ltar gnod pa nyid kyis kho bo cag gi phyogs la yang gnod par byed pa yod pa dang med pa nyid kyis byas pa tshad ma dang cig shos su rnam par gzhag pa 'di ni mi mthun pa'i sad pa'i shes pa mthong na kho bo cag gi
translated: But when a non-erroneous cognition is seen, the distinction between valid and non-valid cognition is undermined.üîΩIf the distinction between valid and non-valid cognition is undermined, then the distinction between valid and non-valid cognition in dreams and so on is also undermined.

original: rmi lam la sogs pa'i shes pa brdzun par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la bstan pa ni gnod byed ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa'i shes pa brdzun par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la bstan pa ni gnod byed ces bya ba'o //
translated: If the distinction between valid and non-valid cognition is undermined, then the distinction between the valid and non-valid cognition of pillars and so on is also undermined.üîΩIf the distinction between valid and non-valid cognition is undermined, then the distinction between the valid and non-valid cognition of yogis is also undermined.üîΩIf the distinction between valid and non-valid cognition is undermined, then the distinction between valid and non-valid cognition of the world is also undermined.

original: @150a * // gnod par byed pa med yang ka ba la sogs pa'i shes pa tshad ma ma yin pa dang / rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye ba med pa yin na /üîΩkhyod kyis dbye ba su yis byas //
analyzed: @150a * // gnod par byed pa med yang ka ba la sogs pa'i shes pa tshad ma ma yin pa dang / rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye ba med pa yin na / khyod kyis dbye ba su yis byas //
translated: If the distinction between valid and non-valid cognition is undermined, then the distinction between valid and non-valid cognition of the scriptures is also undermined.üîΩIf the distinction between valid and non-valid cognition is undermined, then the distinction between valid and non-valid cognition of the world is also undermined.üîΩIf the distinction between valid and non-valid cognition is undermined, then the distinction between valid and non-valid cognition of the scriptures is also undermined.üîΩIf the distinction between valid and non-valid cognition is undermined, then the distinction between valid and non-valid cognition of the world is also undermined.üîΩIf the distinction between valid and non-valid cognition is undermined, then the distinction between valid and non-valid cognition of the scriptures is also undermined.

original: zhes bya ba 'di la bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di la bstan pa ni /
translated: If the distinction between valid and non-valid cognition is undermined, then the distinction between valid and non-valid cognition of the world is also undermined.üîΩIf the distinction between valid and non-valid cognition is undermined, then the distinction between valid and non-valid cognition of the scriptures is also undermined.üîΩIf the distinction between valid and non-valid cognition is undermined, then the distinction between valid and non-valid cognition of the world is also undermined.üîΩIf the distinction between valid and non-valid cognition is undermined, then the distinction between valid and non-valid cognition of the scriptures is also undermined.

original: 'khrul par zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'khrul par zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If the distinction between valid and non-valid cognition is undermined, then the distinction between valid and non-valid cognition of

original: ka ba la sogs par rang gi rig bya nyid yin pas phyi rol mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ka ba la sogs par rang gi rig bya nyid yin pas phyi rol mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because the pillar, etc. are not perceived as external objects, since they are the very objects of one‚Äôs own cognition.

original: ka ba la sogs pa'i shes pa log pa'i shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i rjes su dpag pa gnod par byed pa nyid yod pa yin na ji ltar gnod pa ji ltar dmigs pa yin zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: ka ba la sogs pa'i shes pa log pa'i shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i rjes su dpag pa gnod par byed pa nyid yod pa yin na ji ltar gnod pa ji ltar dmigs pa yin zhes zer ba ni /
translated: If the inference ‚Äúbecause the cognition of the pillar, etc. is a false cognition‚Äù is indeed a refutation, then how is it a refutation? How is it a perception?

original: gzhan yod ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan yod ces bya ba ste /
translated: This is what is meant by ‚Äúthe existence of another.‚Äù

original: mngon sum dang 'gal ba 'di ni gnod byed ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum dang 'gal ba 'di ni gnod byed ma yin te /
translated: This contradiction with direct perception is not a refutation,

original: mngon sum la mngon sum gzhan gnod byed yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon sum la mngon sum gzhan gnod byed yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because one direct perception is not a refutation of another direct perception.

original: rmi lam gyi shes pa yang gnod byed nyid ma yin te /üîΩgnod par byed pa'i chos dang chos mi mthun pa nyid kyis gnod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi shes pa yang gnod byed nyid ma yin te / gnod par byed pa'i chos dang chos mi mthun pa nyid kyis gnod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: A cognition in a dream is also not a refutation,üîΩbecause it is to be refuted by the fact that it does not have the same properties as the refuting factor.

original: gnod byed kyi ni de'i chos dang chos mi mthun pa can nyid gnod par byed pa nyid yin no zhes zer ba ni mi sogs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnod byed kyi ni de'i chos dang chos mi mthun pa can nyid gnod par byed pa nyid yin no zhes zer ba ni mi sogs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The fact that the refuting factor has properties that are not the same as those of the object to be refuted is itself the refutation. This is what is meant by ‚Äúnot so.‚Äù

original: bag chags sad pa pa las zhes bya ba ni de'i bskyed bya de'i'o //
analyzed: bag chags sad pa pa las zhes bya ba ni de'i bskyed bya de'i'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the arousing of latent impressions‚Äù means from the production of that.

original: mi bden pa'i don nyid ni mi slu ba la yang ngo //
analyzed: mi bden pa'i don nyid ni mi slu ba la yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúThe meaning of unreality‚Äù is also nondeceptive.

original: med pa'i don nyid ni phyi rol gyi don nyid ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: med pa'i don nyid ni phyi rol gyi don nyid ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The meaning of nonexistence is taught as the nonexistence of external objects.

original: mi slu ba'i rnam pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi slu ba'i rnam pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe aspect of nondeceptiveness‚Äù is also the appearance of the object.

original: 'di ma yin no zhes bya ba yang bag chags dang 'brel pa'i shes pa nyid la brten pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ma yin no zhes bya ba yang bag chags dang 'brel pa'i shes pa nyid la brten pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not this‚Äù is taught as based on the cognition related to latent impressions.

original: mi slu bar snang ba yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mi slu bar snang ba yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe appearance of nondeceptiveness‚Äù is also the appearance of the object.

original: gnod par byed pa'i shes pa 'ba' zhig las de dang 'brel pas nges pa la bsgrub bya yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i shes pa 'ba' zhig las de dang 'brel pas nges pa la bsgrub bya yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The object to be established is based on the certainty of the relation with that, which is only the cognition that is harmed.

original: bag chags dang 'brel pa nyid kyang spyi la mi slu ba dang cig shos dag ni khyad par yin par bstan pa ni /üîΩbag chags dang ni 'brel yin yang //
analyzed: bag chags dang 'brel pa nyid kyang spyi la mi slu ba dang cig shos dag ni khyad par yin par bstan pa ni / bag chags dang ni 'brel yin yang //
translated: The relation with latent impressions is taught as the difference between nondeceptiveness in general and the other.

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúEven though there is a relation with latent impressions‚Äù is the verse.

original: thams cad du sngon po la sogs pa la ma yin zhing /
analyzed: thams cad du sngon po la sogs pa la ma yin zhing /
translated: It is not in all cases, such as with blue and so on.

original: gsal ba nyid la sogs pa la ni yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba nyid la sogs pa la ni yin no //
translated: but it is in the case of the clear and so on.

original: sngon po la sogs pa yang bag chags kho na las yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa yang bag chags kho na las yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: It is taught that blue and so on are also due to habitual tendencies alone.

original: don gyi bdag de zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don gyi bdag de zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚Äúthat is the self of the object‚Äù is this.

original: 'jig rten pa mi ni nyo tshong la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyi yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa mi ni nyo tshong la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyi yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The world is not the object of conventions such as buying and selling.

original: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid ni gnod bya dang cig shos dag gis yod pa dang med @150b par sbyor bas so //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid ni gnod bya dang cig shos dag gis yod pa dang med @150b par sbyor bas so //
translated: The nature of both is the application of existence and nonexistence by the object of refutation and the other.

original: dran pa nyams phyir ni 'dzin pa dang dran pa dag gi khyad par nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa nyams phyir ni 'dzin pa dang dran pa dag gi khyad par nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Due to the degeneration of memory, the difference between grasping and memory is possible.

original: phyin ci log tu snang ba ni de nyid gzhan du snang ba'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu snang ba ni de nyid gzhan du snang ba'o //
translated: The appearance of error is the appearance of that as other.

original: gnod pa dang bcas pa ni gnod byed yod pa ste de'i ngo bo'o //üîΩ'dis kyang don med pa nyid bstan pa yin te gzhan du na slu ba ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gnod pa dang bcas pa ni gnod byed yod pa ste de'i ngo bo'o // 'dis kyang don med pa nyid bstan pa yin te gzhan du na slu ba ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The presence of refutation is the existence of the object of refutation, which is its nature.üîΩThis also teaches the meaninglessness of the object of refutation.

original: de lta'i don yod min zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta'i don yod min zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching that it is not deceptive is ‚Äúthat object does not exist.‚Äù

original: rnam rtog gi 'khrul pa la rnam pa bag chags kyi 'brel pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rnam rtog gi 'khrul pa la rnam pa bag chags kyi 'brel pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching that the error of conceptualization is related to the aspect through latent impressions is:

original: sngon sprul mthong ba med par ni //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sngon sprul mthong ba med par ni // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Without seeing the former emanation,

original: bzlog pa'i snang ba yang sngar mthong ba las byung ba yin pas bag chags las byung ba kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bzlog pa'i snang ba yang sngar mthong ba las byung ba yin pas bag chags las byung ba kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching that the reversed appearance also arises from what was seen previously, and so is only arisen from latent impressions, is:

original: phyin co log la sogs pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: phyin co log la sogs pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The reversed and so on.

original: dung la ser po'i shes pa ni sngar mthong ba las byung ba ma yin na ji ltar bag chags las byung ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: dung la ser po'i shes pa ni sngar mthong ba las byung ba ma yin na ji ltar bag chags las byung ba yin zhe na /
translated: If the consciousness of yellow in a conch does not arise from seeing it previously, how is it arisen from latent impressions?

original: ma yin te de las yang gser la sogs pa mthong ba rgyu yin pa de'i phyir bag chags las byung ba nyid kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ma yin te de las yang gser la sogs pa mthong ba rgyu yin pa de'i phyir bag chags las byung ba nyid kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: No, because the cause of that is seeing gold and so on. Therefore the teaching that it is only arisen from latent impressions is:

original: rtogs pa gzhan dag kyang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rtogs pa gzhan dag kyang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Other realizations as well.

original: skye ba'i dang po nas mig ser can la yang skye ba gzhan gyi mthong ba rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skye ba'i dang po nas mig ser can la yang skye ba gzhan gyi mthong ba rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that even in the case of one who is jaundiced, the cause of the consciousness of yellow in a conch is seeing gold and so on in a previous life.

original: gnod par byed pa med na don gyi yul nyid la thob po snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa med na don gyi yul nyid la thob po snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: If there is no object of harm, the thought that one has attained the object is

original: gzhan la don thob ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan la don thob ces bya ba'o //
translated: the so-called attainment of the object for another.

original: thob pa yod min na ma dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: thob pa yod min na ma dmigs pa'o //
translated: If there is no attainment, there is no non-observation.üîΩThe teaching on the certainty and uncertainty of the object is for the sake of

original: don gyi nges pa ma nges pa yin par bstan pa ni nges pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don gyi nges pa ma nges pa yin par bstan pa ni nges pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: certainty.

original: don med par nges pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: don med par nges pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching on the non-certainty of the non-existence of the object is

original: don zhes nges pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don zhes nges pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the so-called certainty of the object.üîΩThe teaching on the reason for the harm is the so-called mere latent

original: gnod par byed par yang sad pa'i shes pa'i bag chags tsam rgyu mtshan yin pa nyid kyi shes pa ni /üîΩdon las skyes pa nyid kyi nges pa'i gnod byed yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gnod par byed par yang sad pa'i shes pa'i bag chags tsam rgyu mtshan yin pa nyid kyi shes pa ni / don las skyes pa nyid kyi nges pa'i gnod byed yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: impression of the waking consciousness.üîΩThe teaching on the harm to the certainty that the consciousness arises

original: bag chags gzhi can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bag chags gzhi can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: from the object is the so-called basis of the latent impression.

original: bag chags las skyes pa nyid ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: bag chags las skyes pa nyid ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that it arises from the latent impression?

original: shes pa sngon mthong zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa sngon mthong zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The so-called previous seeing of the consciousness.

original: bag chags tsam rgyu mtshan nyid yin pa'i shes pa gnod byed nyid yin na rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa'i gnod byed nyid kyi rtog pa sus kyang ma byas so zhes bstan pa ni des kyang 'di yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bag chags tsam rgyu mtshan nyid yin pa'i shes pa gnod byed nyid yin na rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa'i gnod byed nyid kyi rtog pa sus kyang ma byas so zhes bstan pa ni des kyang 'di yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If consciousness that has mere latent impressions as its cause is itself undermined, then no one has undermined the consciousness of a yogi. This is what is meant by ‚Äúthat also.‚Äù

original: bag chags kyi gzhi can nyid kyi shes pa las 'di nges pas mi srid pa ma yin par bstan pa ni goms pa'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bag chags kyi gzhi can nyid kyi shes pa las 'di nges pas mi srid pa ma yin par bstan pa ni goms pa'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Since this is ascertained from consciousness that has latent impressions as its basis, it is not impossible. This is indicated by ‚Äúthrough the power of habituation.‚Äù

original: 'dod pa dang mya ngan las sogs la rig pa nyid yin gyi tshad ma can ma yin pa kho na brtags @151a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mya ngan las sogs la rig pa nyid yin gyi tshad ma can ma yin pa kho na brtags @151a * //
translated: It is not that the consciousness of a yogi is not valid cognition, but it is not a valid cognition in regard to the object that is its object.

original: pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not a valid cognition in regard to the object that is its object.

original: de'i gnyen po 'di ma yin no zhes bya ba'i de las bzlog pa nya phyis kyi shes pa bzhin du dngul gyi shes pa yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po 'di ma yin no zhes bya ba'i de las bzlog pa nya phyis kyi shes pa bzhin du dngul gyi shes pa yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The consciousness of silver that is the opposite of that is like the consciousness of nacre.

original: grangs can la sogs pa'i 'dod pa la nged kyi ni bsgoms pa'i stobs las byung ba can gyi blo mya ngan las bslad pa'i blo gang yin pa de dag gi zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: grangs can la sogs pa'i 'dod pa la nged kyi ni bsgoms pa'i stobs las byung ba can gyi blo mya ngan las bslad pa'i blo gang yin pa de dag gi zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúour‚Äù should be supplied to the phrase ‚Äúthose who are the opposite of us.‚Äù

original: 'u bu cag las mtshan nyid mi mthun pa ni rnal 'byor pa rnams yin la de'i shes pa yang ka ba la sogs pa'i shes pa'i gnod byed yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rjes su dpag pa cung zad kyang med pa yin te dpe med pa'i phyir
analyzed: 'u bu cag las mtshan nyid mi mthun pa ni rnal 'byor pa rnams yin la de'i shes pa yang ka ba la sogs pa'i shes pa'i gnod byed yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rjes su dpag pa cung zad kyang med pa yin te dpe med pa'i phyir
translated: The yogis are the opposite of us, and their cognition is the refutation of the cognition of pillars and so on. There is not the slightest bit of inference in this, because there is no example.üîΩThe example of the cognition of such a yogi does not exist.

original: ro // de lta bu'i rnal 'byor can gyi blo'i dpe'i khyed la med do zhes bya ba de la bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ro // de lta bu'i rnal 'byor can gyi blo'i dpe'i khyed la med do zhes bya ba de la bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement of that is:

original: de 'dra'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de 'dra'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSuch a one‚Äù

original: khyod kyi rnal 'byor pa las bzlog pa'i blo can gyi rnal 'byor pa rnams ni lam po che'i mi'i dpe nyid kyis grub pa yin no //
analyzed: khyod kyi rnal 'byor pa las bzlog pa'i blo can gyi rnal 'byor pa rnams ni lam po che'i mi'i dpe nyid kyis grub pa yin no //
translated: The yogis who are the opposite of your yogis are established by the example of the people on the road.

original: khyed cag gi dpe gang yin pa //
analyzed: khyed cag gi dpe gang yin pa //
translated: What is your example?

original: gzung ba de ni yod pa yin //
analyzed: gzung ba de ni yod pa yin //
translated: That object that is apprehended exists.

original: zhes bya ba de la bstan pa ni khyed kyi la ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de la bstan pa ni khyed kyi la ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúBut in your case‚Äù is the teaching.

original: phyi rol mi dmigs pas gnod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyi rol mi dmigs pas gnod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is harmed by the non-apprehension of external things.

original: de bstan pa ni de nas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bstan pa ni de nas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The teaching of that is ‚ÄúThen, the cognition of a pillar, etc.‚Äù

original: phyi rol mi dmigs pas gnod pa'i ka ba la sogs pa'i blo ni de ltar mngon du byed pa po shes la go byed yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyi rol mi dmigs pas gnod pa'i ka ba la sogs pa'i blo ni de ltar mngon du byed pa po shes la go byed yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the cognition of a pillar, etc., which is harmed by the non-apprehension of external things, is the manifestor and the illuminator.

original: 'on te zhes smos pa bor nas des na zhes byas pas lan kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'on te zhes smos pa bor nas des na zhes byas pas lan kho na yin no //
translated: But if you omit the word ‚Äúbut‚Äù and say ‚Äútherefore,‚Äù then it is only a reply.

original: gnyen po dang ni bcas par 'gyur //
analyzed: gnyen po dang ni bcas par 'gyur //
translated: ‚ÄúIt would be accompanied by a counteragent‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni gnod byed dang bcas pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnod byed dang bcas pa nyid du'o //
translated: means that it would be accompanied by a harm-doer.

original: rgyal dpog pa'i la yang gnyen po nyid 'grub pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyal dpog pa'i la yang gnyen po nyid 'grub pa yin te /
translated: The reply is also established for the Vai≈õe·π£ika.

original: mngon sum la sogs pa smig rgyu la sogs pa'i blo dag dang / mi mthun pa nyid kyi phyir dang blo nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir de nyid de yin no zhes gnod bya nyid rol sogs pa la gzugs kyi blo brdzun pa nyid yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa smig rgyu la sogs pa'i blo dag dang / mi mthun pa nyid kyi phyir dang blo nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir de nyid de yin no zhes gnod bya nyid rol sogs pa la gzugs kyi blo brdzun pa nyid yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: Because it is incompatible with the awarenesses of a mirage and so forth, and because there is no difference in their being awarenesses, it is just that which is the object of the awareness of form.

original: gnyen po dang bcas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyen po dang bcas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The thought that it is false is ‚Äútogether with its antidote.‚Äù

original: gnod par byed pa ji lta ba nyid dam cig shos kyang gnas pa ni /üîΩsnga ma gnod pas bskyed pa ni ;
analyzed: gnod par byed pa ji lta ba nyid dam cig shos kyang gnas pa ni / snga ma gnod pas bskyed pa ni ;
translated: The way in which the object of the awareness of form is damaged is as follows.üîΩThe object of the awareness of form is not established by the latter awarenesses,

original: ; phyi ma dag gir 'grub pa min //
analyzed: ; phyi ma dag gir 'grub pa min //
translated: because it is produced by the former awarenesses, which are damaged.

original: de phyir rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kyis //
analyzed: de phyir rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kyis //
translated: Therefore, the awareness that has the nature of realization

original: blo yi tshad ma nyid 'thob po //
analyzed: blo yi tshad ma nyid 'thob po //
translated: obtains the status of valid cognition.

original: des na gzhan du rgyus bskyed pa'i //
analyzed: des na gzhan du rgyus bskyed pa'i //
translated: Therefore, the awareness that is produced by a faulty cause

original: skyon gyi shes pas dmigs bsal yin //
analyzed: skyon gyi shes pas dmigs bsal yin //
translated: is distinguished by the observation of the fault.

original: gang gi rgyu skyon can yin pa dang / brdzun pa yin no zhes kyang shes pa de nyid mi rigs pa yin @151b pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: gang gi rgyu skyon can yin pa dang / brdzun pa yin no zhes kyang shes pa de nyid mi rigs pa yin @151b pa'i phyir la /
translated: The awareness that knows that the object of the awareness of form has a faulty cause and is false is itself unreasonable.

original: 'di ni de lta bu ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ni de lta bu ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The demonstration that this is not so is as follows.

original: ltag chod smras pa yin zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgcod par byed pa'i phyi rol la //
analyzed: ltag chod smras pa yin zhes bya ba'o // gcod par byed pa'i phyi rol la //
translated: This is the ‚Äúfallacy of the reductio ad absurdum.‚ÄùüîΩThe opponent‚Äôs reply is that the reason is not established.üîΩThe reply to that is that the reason is not accepted by the other party.

original: kun gyis thams cad gnod byed yin pa ste sgrub byed ma yin pa'i skyon gzhan mi shes pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni /üîΩji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kun gyis thams cad gnod byed yin pa ste sgrub byed ma yin pa'i skyon gzhan mi shes pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni / ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply to that is that the reason is inconclusive.

original: gnyen po nyid ni mi mthun pa nyid do //üîΩgnod byed ma yin pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa la yang gnod byed kyi blo nyid 'byung na ma nges pa yin pa ni /
analyzed: gnyen po nyid ni mi mthun pa nyid do // gnod byed ma yin pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa la yang gnod byed kyi blo nyid 'byung na ma nges pa yin pa ni /
translated: The reply to that is that the reason is contradictory.

original: gnod byed kyis kyang ma nges dang // zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgnod par byed pa'i blo las gzhan nyid ni rgyu'i khyad par nyid yin te /
analyzed: gnod byed kyis kyang ma nges dang // zhes bya ba'o // gnod par byed pa'i blo las gzhan nyid ni rgyu'i khyad par nyid yin te /
translated: The reply to that is that the reason is not stated.üîΩThe reply to that is that the reason is stated but is superfluous.üîΩThe reply to that is that the reason is stated but is pointless.üîΩThe reply to that is that the reason is stated but is redundant.üîΩThe reply to that is that the reason is stated but is inconclusive.üîΩThe reply to that is that the reason is stated but is contradictory.üîΩThe reply to that is that the reason is stated but is not accepted by the other party.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i blo gzhan nyid bzhin du bsal bar bya ba yin pa ni /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i blo gzhan nyid bzhin du bsal bar bya ba yin pa ni /
translated: The reply to that is that the reason is stated but is superfluous.üîΩThe reply to that is that the reason is stated but is pointless.

original: de las gzhan pa'ang snga ma bzhin //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'ang snga ma bzhin // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply to that is that the reason is stated but is redundant.üîΩThe reply to that is that the reason is stated but is inconclusive.

original: snga ma bzhin zhes bstan pa'i bshad pa ni /üîΩsad sogs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin zhes bstan pa'i bshad pa ni /üîΩsad sogs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply to that is that the reason is stated but is contradictory.

original: ji ltar nges par brtags pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar nges par brtags pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it ascertained?

original: sad sogs shes pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sad sogs shes pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, ‚Äúby the cognition of waking, etc.‚Äù

original: tha snyad ces bya ba ni gnod bya gnod byed la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tha snyad ces bya ba ni gnod bya gnod byed la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúConvention‚Äù refers to the victim and the perpetrator.

original: de ni brjod par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bag chags brtan pa dang cig shos la sogs gnod par byed pa grub na yang rmi lam bzhin du brdzun pa'i blo nyid la 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni brjod par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bag chags brtan pa dang cig shos la sogs gnod par byed pa grub na yang rmi lam bzhin du brdzun pa'i blo nyid la 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThat is said‚Äù means that even if the victim and the perpetrator are established, the cognition is false, like a dream, if the imprints are firm or otherwise.

original: yang dag pa'i blo la ni de las bzlog pa chos kyi khyad par phyin ci log tu sgrub par byed par 'dod par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i blo la ni de las bzlog pa chos kyi khyad par phyin ci log tu sgrub par byed par 'dod par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: The following is stated to show that in the case of a correct cognition, the opposite is maintained, that the specific property is established without error.

original: log blo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: log blo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, ‚Äúa false cognition.‚Äù

original: snga ma bzhin du brjod pa bstan pa ni //üîΩblo kun log pa nyid yin yang //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du brjod pa bstan pa ni // blo kun log pa nyid yin yang //
translated: The following is stated to show that the same applies as before.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, ‚Äúeven if all cognitions are false.‚ÄùüîΩThe assertion of the Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsakas is that everything must have an object.

original: rgyal dpog pa'i 'dod pa la ci nas kyang thams cad dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyal dpog pa'i 'dod pa la ci nas kyang thams cad dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is shown:

original: ci las mi brdzun pa nyid yin //
analyzed: ci las mi brdzun pa nyid yin //
translated: How can it not be false?

original: zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: It is said,

original: phyi dang zhes bya pa'o //
analyzed: phyi dang zhes bya pa'o //
translated: ‚Äúexternal and internal.‚Äù

original: khyad par ma lus pas de ltar 'ding ltar zhes yul dang dus kyi ming can 'di sgrub byed ma yin pa dang de ltar khyab pa yang 'di la da ltar med par sgrub par byed pa yin gyi khyad par zhes bya ba 'dod chags la sogs pa zad
analyzed: khyad par ma lus pas de ltar 'ding ltar zhes yul dang dus kyi ming can 'di sgrub byed ma yin pa dang de ltar khyab pa yang 'di la da ltar med par sgrub par byed pa yin gyi khyad par zhes bya ba 'dod chags la sogs pa zad
translated: In particular, the one who is without all of these is the one who is without the object and time that are the basis of the proof. The one who is without the pervasion is the one who is without the proof of the present. The one who is without the special is the one who is without the extinction of attachment and so on.üîΩ

original: pa'i rgyu mtshan dang ldan pa nyid dang / rnal 'byor pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan dang ldan pa nyid kyang log par sgrub par byed pa dang bcas pa 'di gtan tshig yin no zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: pa'i rgyu mtshan dang ldan pa nyid dang / rnal 'byor pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan dang ldan pa nyid kyang log par sgrub par byed pa dang bcas pa 'di gtan tshig yin no zhes zer ba ni /
translated: In particular, the reason is not the name of the place and time, as in ‚Äúin this way, in this place, at this time.‚Äù The pervasion is also not established here. The reason is that this is established as not existing in the present, and the reason is not that it is endowed with the cause of the exhaustion of attachment and so forth,üîΩor that it is endowed with the cause of being a yogi.

original: skye bo mang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skye bo mang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is said.üîΩThe explanation of the impossibility of the reason that refutes the cognition of external objects is:

original: phyi rol lam dmigs pas ga nyen po dang bcas pa nyid kyis blo nyid du bzlog pa'i sgrub byed mi srid par nus par byed par bstan pa ni gal te 'brel pa @152a * //
analyzed: phyi rol lam dmigs pas ga nyen po dang bcas pa nyid kyis blo nyid du bzlog pa'i sgrub byed mi srid par nus par byed par bstan pa ni gal te 'brel pa @152a * //
translated: If the reason is related to the probandum,

original: zhes bya ba'o //üîΩma mthong ba tsam ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o // ma mthong ba tsam ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la'o //
translated: it is not established as a reason.üîΩIf it is not related, it is not a reason.üîΩThe mere non-seeing is in the discordant class.

original: mthong ba tsam ni mthun pa'i phyogs la'o //
analyzed: mthong ba tsam ni mthun pa'i phyogs la'o //
translated: The mere seeing is in the concordant class.

original: khyab pa nyid bstan pa ni /
analyzed: khyab pa nyid bstan pa ni /
translated: The pervasion is shown by

original: don dam par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don dam par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúultimately.‚Äù

original: ji ltar ba den pa dang cig shos yin zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: ji ltar ba den pa dang cig shos yin zhes zer ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúHow can it be true and false?‚Äù

original: kun rdzob tu ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúConventionally‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: ches che ba'i zhes bya ba ni bag chags kyi'o //
analyzed: ches che ba'i zhes bya ba ni bag chags kyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúGreater‚Äù refers to the habitual.üîΩThe fact that the greater and the greater-than are invalidated without

original: che ba dang ches che ba de la ltos pa med par gnod par byed pa nyid ni phyin ci log pa dmigs pa nying kho na yin par bstan pa ni sad pa'i blo ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: che ba dang ches che ba de la ltos pa med par gnod par byed pa nyid ni phyin ci log pa dmigs pa nying kho na yin par bstan pa ni sad pa'i blo ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: reference to each other is shown by ‚ÄúThe cognition of the waking state . . .üîΩ‚Äù ‚ÄúEven though it is not true‚Äù means that it is not dependent on external reality,

original: mi bden yang zhes bya ba ni phyi rol la ma ltos par rang nyid tsam rig pa na'o //
analyzed: mi bden yang zhes bya ba ni phyi rol la ma ltos par rang nyid tsam rig pa na'o //
translated: but is self-cognizant.

original: gzhal bya gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi tshul la'o //
analyzed: gzhal bya gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi tshul la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOther objects of knowledge‚Äù refers to the external mode.

original: gal te 'di yang zhes bya ba ni gnod pa'i blo'o //
analyzed: gal te 'di yang zhes bya ba ni gnod pa'i blo'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEven this‚Äù refers to the invalidating cognition.üîΩ‚ÄúThe object of proof‚Äù is the object of the proof, which is seen to have the

original: sgrub byed don ni zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa rtogs pa'i dus su gzung ba la sogs pa'i dbye ba mthong ba can no //
analyzed: sgrub byed don ni zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa rtogs pa'i dus su gzung ba la sogs pa'i dbye ba mthong ba can no //
translated: distinctions of the grasped, etc., at the time of the understanding of the proof.

original: bsgrub bya rtogs pa la de med ba la skyon cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub bya rtogs pa la de med ba la skyon cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is not the slightest fault in the absence of that in the realization of the probandum, because it is established.

original: gang gi phyir de'i snga ma'i sgrub byed ni dmigs pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i snga ma'i sgrub byed ni dmigs pa med pa yin te /
translated: Because the previous proof of that is nonapprehension,

original: shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is cognition.

original: de'i skyon ni 'dis rtogs par byed pa'i phyir rtogs pa yin pa'am de nyid kyang rung zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de'i skyon ni 'dis rtogs par byed pa'i phyir rtogs pa yin pa'am de nyid kyang rung zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The fault of that is understood by this, because it is the realization, or it is just that, and so on.

original: dran byas de blo nyid du'o //
analyzed: dran byas de blo nyid du'o //
translated: The remembered is just the cognition.

original: de bstan pa ni rtogs par byed pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bstan pa ni rtogs par byed pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching of that is the realization.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba bshad pa ni bsgrub bya dang tha dad med pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba bshad pa ni bsgrub bya dang tha dad med pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of this is the nondifference from the probandum.

original: tha dad pa ni gsal bya'i dbye ba mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa ni gsal bya'i dbye ba mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Difference is the manifestation of the difference of the object of manifestation.

original: tha mi dad pa ni brtags pa'i ngo bor mtshungs pa'i phyir tha mi dad par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa ni brtags pa'i ngo bor mtshungs pa'i phyir tha mi dad par bstan pa ni /
translated: Nondifference is the similarity in the nature of the imagined. The teaching of nondifference is

original: ldog pa mtshungs par zhes bya ste /üîΩbrtags par ro //
analyzed: ldog pa mtshungs par zhes bya ste / brtags par ro //
translated: the similarity of the negation.

original: dngos po ni byed pa po'o //
analyzed: dngos po ni byed pa po'o //
translated: The thing is the agent.

original: dngos po dang 'brel pa nyid bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dngos po dang 'brel pa nyid bstan pa ni /
translated: The connection with the entity is taught:

original: nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚Äúexperience‚Äù is the fifth case,

original: de bzhin du 'di ni ma grub pa'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di ni ma grub pa'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: and similarly, ‚Äúthis is not established‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: shes pa'i sgra las zhes lnga pa'i mtha' can las rang gi cha la dmigs pa'i shes pa 'byung ba ni rjes su 'gro ba dang phyogs chos nyid dag med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma yin par bstan pa ni don med pang ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa'i sgra las zhes lnga pa'i mtha' can las rang gi cha la dmigs pa'i shes pa 'byung ba ni rjes su 'gro ba dang phyogs chos nyid dag med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma yin par bstan pa ni don med pang ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúknowledge‚Äù is the fifth case, and the arising of the knowledge that observes its own part is not a reason, because of the absence of pervasion and the property of the subject. The statement that it is not a reason is ‚Äúpointless.‚Äù

original: de'i gtan tshigs nyid du 'dzin par byed pa'i blo'o //
analyzed: de'i gtan tshigs nyid du 'dzin par byed pa'i blo'o //
translated: The mind that apprehends it as a reason is

original: rang gi cha la dmigs pa'am de'i sgras bskyed pa ni de'i blo'o //
analyzed: rang gi cha la dmigs pa'am de'i sgras bskyed pa ni de'i blo'o //
