translated: the mind that is generated by the word ‚Äúits.‚Äù

original: gzhi ma grub pa ni khyad par du bya ba'i ma grub pa'i phyogs brjod pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gzhi ma grub pa ni khyad par du bya ba'i ma grub pa'i phyogs brjod pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The unestablished basis is the expression of the unestablished subject that is to be qualified. This is taught:

original: gzhi yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhi yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúthe basis‚Äù is the fifth case.

original: @152b dpe la bsgrub bya ma tshang ba nyid dang gtan tshigs 'gal ba nyid ni khyad par ma grub pa zhes bya ba nyid brjod pa yin par bstan pa ni de bzhin gtan tshigs zhas bya ba'o //
analyzed: @152b dpe la bsgrub bya ma tshang ba nyid dang gtan tshigs 'gal ba nyid ni khyad par ma grub pa zhes bya ba nyid brjod pa yin par bstan pa ni de bzhin gtan tshigs zhas bya ba'o //
translated: The incompleteness of the probandum in the example and the contradiction of the reason are shown to be just the nonestablishment of the qualifier by the words ‚Äúand likewise, the reason.‚Äù

original: sngar spangs zin to zhes bya ba ni khyad par la sogs pa ma grub pa'i lan gyis so //
analyzed: sngar spangs zin to zhes bya ba ni khyad par la sogs pa ma grub pa'i lan gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúAlready refuted‚Äù means by the response to the nonestablishment of the qualifier, etc.

original: sad pa'i shes pa bzhin rmi lam gyi shes pa'i yang phyi rol du dmigs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: sad pa'i shes pa bzhin rmi lam gyi shes pa'i yang phyi rol du dmigs pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the object of the dream consciousness, like the object of the waking consciousness, not external?

original: 'di sngon po'o zhes rang rig pa byed pa las tha dad par sngon po bzhin du gzung ba nyid snang ba'i phyir bdag sngon po'o zhes gzung ba nyid dang 'gal ba'i snang ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di sngon po'o zhes rang rig pa byed pa las tha dad par sngon po bzhin du gzung ba nyid snang ba'i phyir bdag sngon po'o zhes gzung ba nyid dang 'gal ba'i snang ba yin no //
translated: It is not like that, because, like the blue, the object appears as apprehended, separate from the self-awareness that thinks ‚Äúthis is blue.‚Äù Thus, the appearance contradicts the apprehension of the self as blue.

original: de ni 'di ltar phyi rol dmigs pa nyid yin na snang ba ni snang bas stong pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar phyi rol dmigs pa nyid yin na snang ba ni snang bas stong pa ma yin te /
translated: If the object were external, the appearance would not be empty of appearance,

original: de lta bur mi rig pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de lta bur mi rig pa nyid kyis so //
translated: because it would be cognized as such.

original: mi sogs shes pa la phyi rol kun du mi 'dod pa min te phyi rol la mi dmigs pa nyid du mtshungs pa yin yang /
analyzed: mi sogs shes pa la phyi rol kun du mi 'dod pa min te phyi rol la mi dmigs pa nyid du mtshungs pa yin yang /
translated: It is not that the cognition of a man, etc. is not accepted as external, but it is the same in not being observed as external.

original: gnod pa'i shes pa las kha cig tshad ma nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gnod pa'i shes pa las kha cig tshad ma nyid ma yin no //
translated: Some say that from a cognition that is impaired, there is no valid cognition.

original: tshad ma dang cig shos dag gi yul la lkog tu ma gyur pa dang rang nyid ma yin pa nyid du yang snang ba la khyad par 'ga' yang med la /
analyzed: tshad ma dang cig shos dag gi yul la lkog tu ma gyur pa dang rang nyid ma yin pa nyid du yang snang ba la khyad par 'ga' yang med la /
translated: There is no difference in the object of a valid cognition and its opposite appearing as not hidden and not itself.

original: yod pa dang med pa nyid kyis khyad par yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa nyid kyis khyad par yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the difference is due to existence and nonexistence.

original: de dag gi de nyid yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi de nyid yin no //
translated: That is their reality.

original: de smras pa ni yul dus gzhan du bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: de smras pa ni yul dus gzhan du bdag nyid can no //
translated: That is said to be the nature of another place and time.

original: gal te yang snang ba'i rgyu mtshan yod pa nyid yin na //
analyzed: gal te yang snang ba'i rgyu mtshan yod pa nyid yin na //
translated: If the reason for the appearance is existence,

original: de yang 'di ma yin no zhes bzlog par go ba'i phyir gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yin la /
analyzed: de yang 'di ma yin no zhes bzlog par go ba'i phyir gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yin la /
translated: then because it is understood that it is not this, it is the nature of both.

original: de lta na yang de tshad ma ma yin pa'i sgra'i sbyor ba las tshad ma ma yin no snyam du sems pa la rtog pa med pa la ni sngon po bzhin du bzung ba ma yin la /
analyzed: de lta na yang de tshad ma ma yin pa'i sgra'i sbyor ba las tshad ma ma yin no snyam du sems pa la rtog pa med pa la ni sngon po bzhin du bzung ba ma yin la /
translated: But the conceptual cognition does not apprehend the object in the same way that the nonconceptual cognition does.

original: rtog pa ni goms pa las byung ba yin gyi nyams su myong ba ji lta ba bzhin du ma yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa ni goms pa las byung ba yin gyi nyams su myong ba ji lta ba bzhin du ma yin te /
translated: And the conceptual cognition arises from habituation, not from experience.

original: bdag med pa'i lus la yang rnam pa 'gags kyang bdag go zhes pa 'byung ba'i phyir dang / sngon po'i tshogs pa la yang de lta bu yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i lus la yang rnam pa 'gags kyang bdag go zhes pa 'byung ba'i phyir dang / sngon po'i tshogs pa la yang de lta bu yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, even though the aspect of a body that is devoid of self is blocked, the thought ‚ÄúI‚Äù arises, and because such a thought exists even in regard to a collection of blue things.

original: de'i phyir de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de lta ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not so.

original: nyams su myong ba dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni des na 'di zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni des na 'di zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The statement ‚Äúbecause it contradicts experience‚Äù teaches that the example does not have the property to be proven.

original: dpe la bsgrub bya ma tshang ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dpe la bsgrub bya ma tshang ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the property of the example is not complete.

original: nga rgyal rnam par bsregs na //
analyzed: nga rgyal rnam par bsregs na //
translated: When pride is completely burned up,üîΩone becomes a conqueror,

original: rgyal ba can bzang 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: rgyal ba can bzang 'gyur zhing //
translated: and one quickly attains

original: shes rab shin tu chen po //üîΩmyur ba nyid du thob 'gyur //
analyzed: shes rab shin tu chen po //üîΩmyur ba nyid du thob 'gyur //
translated: very great wisdom.

original: des na gzhan rig ces bya ba ni phyi rol rig pa ste /
analyzed: des na gzhan rig ces bya ba ni phyi rol rig pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the so-called knowledge of other is the knowledge of external things.

original: phyi rol la ltos pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i shes pa de stong pa nyid ma @153a * //üîΩyin pa'i tshig ni rnam par rig pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa ni /
analyzed: phyi rol la ltos pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i shes pa de stong pa nyid ma @153a * // yin pa'i tshig ni rnam par rig pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa ni /
translated: The consciousness of form, etc., which is dependent on external things, is not emptiness.

original: phyi rol nyid la'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyi rol nyid la'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúconsciousness‚Äù means consciousness of external things.

original: lhag ma nyid ni ma rig pa yin pas sun dbyung ba ma yin par bstan pa ni rang rig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: lhag ma nyid ni ma rig pa yin pas sun dbyung ba ma yin par bstan pa ni rang rig ces bya ba'o //
translated: The remainder is ignorance, which is not refuted. This is shown by the word ‚Äúreflexive.‚Äù

original: phyi rol gyi rig pa ci'i phyir ma yin zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rig pa ci'i phyir ma yin zhes zer ba la /
translated: Why is it not the knowledge of external things?

original: rang rig pa nyid ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rang rig pa nyid ces bya ba smos so //
translated: The word ‚Äúreflexive‚Äù is used.

original: ci las she na rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ci las she na rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: What is it? It is consciousness.

original: bdag nyid ma yin pa la ni reg pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid ma yin pa la ni reg pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the non-self-nature.

original: reg na yang de'i bdag nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: reg na yang de'i bdag nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If it were contact, it would be its self-nature. This is the meaning.

original: rnam par rtog pa las bdag gis sngon po rig go zhes tha snyad yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa las bdag gis sngon po rig go zhes tha snyad yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the convention ‚ÄúI know blue‚Äù arises from discrimination,

original: gsum nyid kho na de nyid yin te ;
analyzed: gsum nyid kho na de nyid yin te ;
translated: it is just the three.

original: rtog pa med pa la tha snyad med pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: rtog pa med pa la tha snyad med pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: because there is no convention in the absence of conceptualization.

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what you think.

original: 'di'i rnam par rtog pa yang nyams su myong ba'i rjes su 'gro zhing gsum ka rnam par gzhag par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i rnam par rtog pa yang nyams su myong ba'i rjes su 'gro zhing gsum ka rnam par gzhag par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: But even your conceptualization does not accord with experience, for all three are posited by convention.

original: nyams su myong ba la nus pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni 'di nyid ces bya ba ste ;
analyzed: nyams su myong ba la nus pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni 'di nyid ces bya ba ste ;
translated: We have shown that experience is powerless.

original: nyams su myong ba'i 'thob pa de'i bdag nyid kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i 'thob pa de'i bdag nyid kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the attainment of experience is just the nature of that.

original: gal te zhes bya ba bshad pa ni /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of ‚Äúif‚Äù is

original: zhib mo zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhib mo zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚Äúsubtle.‚Äù

original: tha snyad la mi dgos pa 'di ci zhig bya zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha snyad la mi dgos pa 'di ci zhig bya zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What is the use of this uselessness with respect to convention?

original: khyod kyi yang rig byed la sogs pa skyes bus ma byas pa nyid la sogs pa zhib mor dpyad pa ni tha snyad kyi 'bras bu dang bcas pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: khyod kyi yang rig byed la sogs pa skyes bus ma byas pa nyid la sogs pa zhib mor dpyad pa ni tha snyad kyi 'bras bu dang bcas pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: You have also taught that the subtle analysis of the non-human authorship of the Vedas and so on is not useful for the result of convention.

original: gal te tha snyad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te tha snyad ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is ‚Äúif convention.‚Äù

original: khyad par can gyi tha snyad 'bras bu yin gyi de tsam ni ma yin no zhes zer ba ni ji ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par can gyi tha snyad 'bras bu yin gyi de tsam ni ma yin no zhes zer ba ni ji ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin particular‚Äù means that the result is a designation that is qualified by the object, but it is not the object itself.

original: rtog pa med pa'i yul rnam par dpyad pa la khyed la 'bras bu ci yod ces zer ba la gang tshe phyi rol zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa'i yul rnam par dpyad pa la khyed la 'bras bu ci yod ces zer ba la gang tshe phyi rol zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwhat purpose is there‚Äù means that what purpose is there in analyzing an object that is not conceptual?

original: nyams su myong ba'i rjes su 'jug pa mi srid pa'i phyir rjes su 'jug pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i rjes su 'jug pa mi srid pa'i phyir rjes su 'jug pa bstan pa ni /
translated: The following verse is presented to show that it is impossible for a cognition to conform to an object that is experienced.

original: gal te blo ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te blo ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúif the cognition‚Äù refers to the cognition that is the result.

original: rnam pa'i rjes su zhugs can ni rjes su 'jug pa'i rnam pa can no //
analyzed: rnam pa'i rjes su zhugs can ni rjes su 'jug pa'i rnam pa can no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúconforms to the form‚Äù means that it has the aspect of the form.

original: gzhan las zhes bya ba ni bag chags las so //
analyzed: gzhan las zhes bya ba ni bag chags las so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfrom another‚Äù means from a latent impression.

original: de'i rnam pa can gyi 'bras bu'i shes pa gzhan shes par bya ba'i don du de nyid ni skyed byed snga ma'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa can gyi 'bras bu'i shes pa gzhan shes par bya ba'i don du de nyid ni skyed byed snga ma'o //
translated: The cognition that is the result, which has the aspect of that object, is produced by the previous cognition that is to be known.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni rnam pa med pa nyid 'dzin par byed pa ma yin par mthong bar 'dod do //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni rnam pa med pa nyid 'dzin par byed pa ma yin par mthong bar 'dod do //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat very‚Äù means that it is seen to be the cause of the apprehension of the form that lacks an aspect.

original: gal te blo ni de rnam can //
analyzed: gal te blo ni de rnam can //
translated: If the cognition has that form,

original: zhes bya bas de 'di ltar rtogs pa yin no zhes zer ba ni ji ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bas de 'di ltar rtogs pa yin no zhes zer ba ni ji ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the way he understands it.  This is what he says.

original: gnyi ga yang zhes bya ba ni dkar po dang @153b bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang zhes bya ba ni dkar po dang @153b bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Both refers to the nature of white, pleasure, etc.

original: phan tshun zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa gcig gi khongs su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: phan tshun zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa gcig gi khongs su gtogs pa'o //
translated: Mutually refers to the inclusion of one's own awareness.

original: phan tshun rjes su 'jug pa med na rdul phra rab kyi bar du tha dad pa yin pas ma rig par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni 'ga' yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phan tshun rjes su 'jug pa med na rdul phra rab kyi bar du tha dad pa yin pas ma rig par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni 'ga' yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If there is no mutual engagement, it would be different up to the subtle particle, so it would be ignorance. This is shown by nothing.

original: gnyi ga yang rang rig pa gcig gis byed pa la 'jug pa'i phyir rnam pa dang bcas pa'i lta ba gzhan 'thob pa yin par bstan pa ni rang rig pa nyid do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang rang rig pa gcig gis byed pa la 'jug pa'i phyir rnam pa dang bcas pa'i lta ba gzhan 'thob pa yin par bstan pa ni rang rig pa nyid do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since both engage in the activity of one's own awareness, it is shown that another view with aspects is obtained. This is one's own awareness.

original: 'di nyid ces bya ba ni lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di nyid ces bya ba ni lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid do //
translated: This itself refers to not being hidden.

original: lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid ces bya ba gzhan du brtag par bya ba ma yin par bstan pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid ces bya ba gzhan du brtag par bya ba ma yin par bstan pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Not being hidden is shown to be not something to be imagined elsewhere. This is or else.

original: gzhan brtag par bya ba ma yin pa ni phyi rol lo //
analyzed: gzhan brtag par bya ba ma yin pa ni phyi rol lo //
translated: The other, which is not to be examined, is the external.

original: sngon po'i ni blo bzhin du lkog tu ma gyur pa'i khongs su gtogs pa yin na gzhan gyis ci zhig bya ba zhes bstan pa ni mthong ba'i khyad par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sngon po'i ni blo bzhin du lkog tu ma gyur pa'i khongs su gtogs pa yin na gzhan gyis ci zhig bya ba zhes bstan pa ni mthong ba'i khyad par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is included in the category of the non-hidden, like the cognition of blue, what is the use of the other? This is what is shown by the words ‚Äúthe difference in the seeing.‚Äù

original: bral ba ni mi snang ba'o //
analyzed: bral ba ni mi snang ba'o //
translated: The absence is the non-appearance.

original: de 'dzin na ni de'i bdag nyid du 'dzin pas so //
analyzed: de 'dzin na ni de'i bdag nyid du 'dzin pas so //
translated: If it is apprehended, it is apprehended as identical with it.

original: sngon po ni gnyi ga'i rjes su 'jug pa rang rig pa gcig po'i khongs su gnyi ga gtogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sngon po ni gnyi ga'i rjes su 'jug pa rang rig pa gcig po'i khongs su gnyi ga gtogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that blue is included in the category of the single self-awareness that is concomitant with both.

original: yan gar zhes bya ba ni rig pa yin pa las mthong ba las phyi rol yin no //
analyzed: yan gar zhes bya ba ni rig pa yin pa las mthong ba las phyi rol yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúalone‚Äù means that it is awareness, and it is external to the seeing.

original: zhen pa ji ltar mthong ba ma yin pa ni thog ma med pa'i bag chags las byung bas log par 'dzin pa yin par bstan pa ni mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhen pa ji ltar mthong ba ma yin pa ni thog ma med pa'i bag chags las byung bas log par 'dzin pa yin par bstan pa ni mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The attachment is not as it is seen, because it arises from beginningless predispositions. The meaning of the words ‚Äúthe seeing itself‚Äù is that it is a wrong apprehension.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni snang ba gnyis mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni snang ba gnyis mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Not otherwise, because the two appearances do not appear.

original: tha dad pa yin na zhes bya ba ni nang gi bde ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa yin na zhes bya ba ni nang gi bde ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: If they were different, the internal pleasure, etc.

original: de la ni phyi rol la ste snang bar zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la ni phyi rol la ste snang bar zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: There, the external, i.e., the appearance, is to be supplied.

original: gnyi ga de bzhin lkog tu ma gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: gnyi ga de bzhin lkog tu ma gyur pa yin te /
translated: Both are like that, not hidden.

original: de lta bu'i bag chags yod pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa ni gal te tha dad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i bag chags yod pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa ni gal te tha dad ces bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching of the existence of such a residual impression is: If they were different, etc.

original: snang ba'i sgo nas bstan nas tshogs pa tha mi dad par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: snang ba'i sgo nas bstan nas tshogs pa tha mi dad par bstan pa ni /
translated: Having taught by way of appearance, he teaches by way of the non-difference of the collection:

original: dper na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: For example, etc.

original: de dang dus mtshungs pa can ni gsal bar dus mtshungs pa ste /
analyzed: de dang dus mtshungs pa can ni gsal bar dus mtshungs pa ste /
translated: Simultaneous with that means simultaneous with the manifestation.

original: de dang de min ngo bo'i zhes bya ba'i rigs pas so //
analyzed: de dang de min ngo bo'i zhes bya ba'i rigs pas so //
translated: By the reasoning of that and that non-difference, etc.

original: de bzhin nyid do zhes bya ba ni snga ma nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid do zhes bya ba ni snga ma nyid do //
translated: Suchness is just as before.

original: gang gis rtogs zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad pa'i snang ba las so //
analyzed: gang gis rtogs zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad pa'i snang ba las so //
translated: By what is it realized? By the non-different appearance.

original: lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid kyang zhes bya bar thal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du rgol ba yin no //
analyzed: lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid kyang zhes bya bar thal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du rgol ba yin no //
translated: because it would follow that it would not be hidden.

original: ma yin te lkog tu gyur par thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin te lkog tu gyur par thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: No, it does not follow that it would be hidden.

original: @154a * // skyes bu'i dbye bas zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: @154a * // skyes bu'i dbye bas zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the classification of persons is

original: gzhan gyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúanother.‚Äù

original: lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid yod kyang lkog tu ma gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid yod kyang lkog tu ma gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: Even though the existence of the non-hidden is,

original: gzhan gyi rgyu la yod pa'i phyir nga'i zhes bya ba ni rtogs par byed pa po'i'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyu la yod pa'i phyir nga'i zhes bya ba ni rtogs par byed pa po'i'o //
translated: ‚Äúmine‚Äù is the one who causes the understanding.

original: lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid bzhin du de'i bdag nyid kyi sngon po yang lkog tu gyur par brtags pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid bzhin du de'i bdag nyid kyi sngon po yang lkog tu gyur par brtags pa ma yin te /
translated: Just as the non-hidden is, the blue of its nature is not imagined to be hidden.

original: dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni des na lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni des na lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the absence of purpose is ‚Äútherefore, it is not hidden.‚Äù

original: 'gro ba'am ci ga zhes bya ba ni sngon po nyid do //
analyzed: 'gro ba'am ci ga zhes bya ba ni sngon po nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is it?‚Äù is blue.

original: gzhan la ni rdzas la ste skyes bu la'o //
analyzed: gzhan la ni rdzas la ste skyes bu la'o //
translated: The other is the substance, the person.

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i gnas skabs kyang zhes bya ba ni du ba las me rjes su dpag pa'i gnas skabs la ste /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i gnas skabs kyang zhes bya ba ni du ba las me rjes su dpag pa'i gnas skabs la ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúeven when it is hidden‚Äù refers to the situation in which fire is inferred from smoke.

original: mngon sum yin na ni du ba bzhin du rjes su dpag pa la don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum yin na ni du ba bzhin du rjes su dpag pa la don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were a direct perception, then the inference of fire would be pointless, just as the smoke is.

original: dran pa nyid ces bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa nyid ces bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe memory itself‚Äù refers to the inference.

original: 'di na zhes bya ba ni du ba'i yul la'o //
analyzed: 'di na zhes bya ba ni du ba'i yul la'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhere‚Äù refers to the place where the smoke is.

original: me gang gi yul gcig gang yin pa de ni yul gcig go //
analyzed: me gang gi yul gcig gang yin pa de ni yul gcig go //
translated: The place that is the same as the place of the fire is the same place.

original: du ba'i yul du ni rjes su dpag par bya ba'i yul du'o //üîΩsgro btags bzhin pa ni snang bzhin pa las gzhan yin te /
analyzed: du ba'i yul du ni rjes su dpag par bya ba'i yul du'o // sgro btags bzhin pa ni snang bzhin pa las gzhan yin te /
translated: The place of the smoke is the place of the object that is to be inferred.

original: lkog tu gyur pa yin no snyam du sems pa la //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa yin no snyam du sems pa la //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe superimposed object‚Äù refers to the object that is being superimposed, which is different from the object that is being perceived.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúeven when it is hidden‚Äù means that it is not directly perceived.

original: mthong ba las tha dad par zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: mthong ba las tha dad par zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúapart from what is seen‚Äù is stated in response to this.

original: sgro 'dogs pa'i dus su yang snang bzhin pa nyid ni nang gi bdag nyid kyi rjes su byed pa nyid yin par bstan pa ni /üîΩmthong ba nyid du rtogs pa med //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa'i dus su yang snang bzhin pa nyid ni nang gi bdag nyid kyi rjes su byed pa nyid yin par bstan pa ni / mthong ba nyid du rtogs pa med //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe appearance itself‚Äù indicates that the superimposed object is not different from the object that is being perceived.

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is not recognized as being seen‚Äù is stated in response to this.

original: yod pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni gang yin pa de yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: yod pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni gang yin pa de yang rung ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever exists‚Äù means whatever is suitable.

original: 'jug par byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'jug par byed pa'i mi'o //
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'jug par byed pa'i mi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe one who engages‚Äù is the person who engages.

original: de'i phyir sgro 'dogs pas sgro btags pa yin par bstan pa ni sgro 'dogs pa de lta bu zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgro 'dogs pas sgro btags pa yin par bstan pa ni sgro 'dogs pa de lta bu zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach that it is a superimposition, he says, ‚Äúsuch a superimposition.‚Äù

original: nyams su myong ba las sam sgro 'dogs pa las kyang 'jig rten 'jug par ma thong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba las sam sgro 'dogs pa las kyang 'jig rten 'jug par ma thong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he does not see that the world engages on the basis of experience or on the basis of superimposition.

original: sngon mthong ba yang de yin la smig rgyu'i chu'i yul yang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sngon mthong ba yang de yin la smig rgyu'i chu'i yul yang yin pa'o //
translated: It is what was seen before and it is the object of water in a mirage.

original: gang la ni me la'o //
analyzed: gang la ni me la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn regard to what?‚Äù In regard to fire.

original: yul med pa'i sgro 'dogs pa ni rigs pa'i phyir ma gtogs pa sgro 'dogs pa'i yul ma yin par bstan pa ni ma yin te de zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul med pa'i sgro 'dogs pa ni rigs pa'i phyir ma gtogs pa sgro 'dogs pa'i yul ma yin par bstan pa ni ma yin te de zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The superimposition of an unreal object is not taught to be an object of superimposition, except for the sake of reasoning.

original: sgo 'dogs par bya ba bzhin du yul yang sgro 'dogs par bya ba rtogs par bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: sgo 'dogs par bya ba bzhin du yul yang sgro 'dogs par bya ba rtogs par bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: The object is to be understood just as the superimposition is.

original: gzhan du na sgro 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba ni de nyid yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na sgro 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba ni de nyid yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be a superimposition.

original: lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid ces bya @154b ba ni sgro 'dogs pa'i yul mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid ces bya @154b ba ni sgro 'dogs pa'i yul mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnot hidden‚Äù means that the object of superimposition is seen.

original: gzhan gyis rtogs pas lkog tu gyur pa nyid yin gyi /üîΩbdag nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyis rtogs pas lkog tu gyur pa nyid yin gyi / bdag nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa ni /
translated: It is hidden to others, but not to oneself.

original: lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnot hidden‚Äù is applied to the realization of one‚Äôs own nature.

original: gzhan gyis sam rang nyid kyis rtogs pa'i lkog tu gyur pa la khyad par ci yod ces zer ba la /
analyzed: gzhan gyis sam rang nyid kyis rtogs pa'i lkog tu gyur pa la khyad par ci yod ces zer ba la /
translated: What is the difference between that which is hidden to others and that which is hidden to oneself?

original: de nyid ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba smos so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat very thing‚Äù is supplied.

original: de'i phyir sgro 'dogs pa brdzun pa ci las yin zhes zer ba la phyi rol zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgro 'dogs pa brdzun pa ci las yin zhes zer ba la phyi rol zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, the phrase ‚Äúfrom what‚Äù is supplied to the phrase ‚Äúsuperimposition, which is false.‚Äù

original: mi slu ba med pas gzhan gyis rtogs pa'i sgro 'dogs pa tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi slu ba med pas gzhan gyis rtogs pa'i sgro 'dogs pa tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúexternal object‚Äù means that the superimposition that is hidden to others is not a valid cognition because it is deceptive.

original: skra shad snang ba bzhin du zhes bya ba 'di la /
analyzed: skra shad snang ba bzhin du zhes bya ba 'di la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúlike the appearance of falling hair‚Äù is supplied to the phrase ‚Äúsuperimposition, which is false.‚Äù

original: skra shad la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs la ste /
analyzed: skra shad la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs la ste /
translated: ‚ÄúHair tufts, etc.‚Äù refers to the situation.

original: rang bzhin tha dad pa las so //
analyzed: rang bzhin tha dad pa las so //
translated: From a different nature.

original: rang bzhin gcig tu 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig tu 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúWould become of one nature‚Äù means

original: nyams pa'i rgyu tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams pa'i rgyu tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cause of the impairment is not different.

original: sgyur na skra shad la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sgyur na skra shad la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIf it were transformed, hair tufts, etc.‚Äù

original: 'gyur ram ci zhes bya ba ni ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ram ci zhes bya ba ni ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWould it?‚Äù means ‚Äúno.‚Äù

original: des na ni mig las so //
analyzed: des na ni mig las so //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore, from the eye‚Äù means

original: sngon po la sogs pa dang de'i lkog tu ma gyur pa dag la rnam pa 'gas kyang mngon par zhen pa yin yang rgyu tha dad pas gcig dang du ma yin pa'i phyogs snga ma'o //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa dang de'i lkog tu ma gyur pa dag la rnam pa 'gas kyang mngon par zhen pa yin yang rgyu tha dad pas gcig dang du ma yin pa'i phyogs snga ma'o //
translated: ‚Äúeven though blue, etc. and its non-obscuration are in some way manifest, because of the difference in causes, they are one and many.‚Äù

original: bag chags kyi dbye ba dang de sad par byed pa'i sems kyi khyad par mig ni lhan cig byed pa can yin te rmi lam gyi shes pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba'i grub mtha' bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bag chags kyi dbye ba dang de sad par byed pa'i sems kyi khyad par mig ni lhan cig byed pa can yin te rmi lam gyi shes pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba'i grub mtha' bstan pa ni /
translated: The previous position is that the eye, which is the cause of the differentiation of habitual tendencies and the special mind that awakens them, is the co-operating condition, like the consciousness in a dream.üîΩThe conclusion is stated:üîΩ‚ÄúHere, some say‚Äù means

original: 'dir 'ga' zhig ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'ga' zhig ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, some refers to the following.

original: sngon bo dang cig shos la sogs pa'i shes pa'i khyad par 'ga' zhig sad par byed pa yin gyi phyi rol ma yin par bstan pa ni nang gi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sngon bo dang cig shos la sogs pa'i shes pa'i khyad par 'ga' zhig sad par byed pa yin gyi phyi rol ma yin par bstan pa ni nang gi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúinternal‚Äù indicate that the difference is not external, but is produced by some difference in the consciousness, such as the prior or subsequent cognition.

original: tha dad pa'i bag chags kyang 'bras bus go bya yin la des na /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i bag chags kyang 'bras bus go bya yin la des na /
translated: The latent impressions are also to be understood as the result.

original: rgyu mtshan la ni nges pa nyid //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan la ni nges pa nyid //
translated: The reason is ascertained.

original: bag chags yin par gang brjod pa //
analyzed: bag chags yin par gang brjod pa //
translated: What is called latent impression

original: de mi srid pas 'di yin dang // gzhan don med phyir rnyed par dka' //
analyzed: de mi srid pas 'di yin dang // gzhan don med phyir rnyed par dka' //
translated: is impossible, and it is difficult to find, because it is not the cause.üîΩYou have no ascertainment

original: yul dang dus dang rgyu mtshan sogs //üîΩkhyod la nges par byed pa med //
analyzed: yul dang dus dang rgyu mtshan sogs // khyod la nges par byed pa med //
translated: of place, time, reason, etc.

original: ces bya ba bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba bsal ba yin no //

analyzed: gzhan don med phyir zhes bya ba rtsom par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: yul la sogs pa dang de'i shes pa la yang khyad par med do //
translated: There is no difference between the object, etc., and its cognition.

analyzed: de yang yin la khyad par gyi bag chags la sogs pa yang yin no zhes sbyar bar bya'o //

original: de yang mig la sogs pa'i khyad par bag chags kyi ngo bo'i rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de yang mig la sogs pa'i khyad par bag chags kyi ngo bo'i rtog pa'o //
translated: The difference in the eye, etc. is the concept in the nature of the latent impressions.

original: lus kyang zhes bya ba ni bdag la sogs pa'i nye @155a * //üîΩbar mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyang zhes bya ba ni bdag la sogs pa'i nye @155a * // bar mtshon pa'o //
translated: The body also, etc.

original: shes pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa ni rgyu ma yin pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: shes pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa ni rgyu ma yin pa nyid yin te /
translated: The non-existence of the nature of consciousness is the non-existence of the cause, because of the non-existence of the non-apprehension.

original: mi dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni ma yin te lus su snang ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni ma yin te lus su snang ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The appearance as the body, etc. is taught.

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi khyad par nyid kyi bag chags kyi khyad par gyi ngo bo las yul dang dus dang rnam pa la sogs pa nges pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi khyad par nyid kyi bag chags kyi khyad par gyi ngo bo las yul dang dus dang rnam pa la sogs pa nges pa yin gyi /
translated: The difference in the object, time, aspect, etc. is from the difference in the nature of the latent impressions, which is the difference in the condition of immediate antecedent.üîΩIt is not from the external.

original: phyi rol las ni ma yin pa ma mthong ba khyad par med na ji ltar yin zhes zer ba la ji ltar chags sogs zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: phyi rol las ni ma yin pa ma mthong ba khyad par med na ji ltar yin zhes zer ba la ji ltar chags sogs zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: When there is no difference in the non-seeing, how is it?

original: bag chags kyi nus pa mthong ba yin gyi phyi rol gyi ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o don to //
analyzed: bag chags kyi nus pa mthong ba yin gyi phyi rol gyi ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o don to //
translated: The latent impressions are seen to have the power, not the external.

original: med par yang zhes bya ba ni 'bad pa med na yang ngo //
analyzed: med par yang zhes bya ba ni 'bad pa med na yang ngo //
translated: Even without, means even without effort.

original: gzhan du yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan du yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúAlso in other cases‚Äù means

original: phyi rol med na yang ngo //
analyzed: phyi rol med na yang ngo //
translated: even when there is no external object.

original: ji ltar yin zhes zer ba la //
analyzed: ji ltar yin zhes zer ba la //
translated: How is that?

original: phyi rol nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: sems pa gzhan pa de las gzhan pa'i sad par byed par gang du yin zhes zer ba la dper na zhes bya ba smos so //

original: gar yang zhes bya ba ni phyi rol la'am mi bden pa la'o //
analyzed: gar yang zhes bya ba ni phyi rol la'am mi bden pa la'o //

analyzed: rmi lam shes pa'i spyod yul yin //

analyzed: yul de la sogs pa'i snang ba da ltar la sogs pa'i yul can gyis des de zhes bya ba ni don to //

analyzed: da ltar ni dus 'di dang 'brel pa can no //

translated: ‚ÄúThe childish,‚Äù etc. Because external childishness exists, blue, yellow, etc., which are objects of apprehension that are different from the aspect that apprehends external and internal and this and that, are taught by means of perception, etc.

original: zhes bya ba sel ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba sel ba yin te /
translated: is the exclusion.

analyzed: mthong ba las tha dad pa'i snang ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: de'i phyir mthong ba yang ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong ba yang ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the teaching that it is not even seeing is

original: de'i phyir gcig la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore, in one,‚Äù etc.

original: sngon po bzhin du 'di nyams su myong ba yang nyams su myong ba 'ba' zhig yul ma yin la /
analyzed: sngon po bzhin du 'di nyams su myong ba yang nyams su myong ba 'ba' zhig yul ma yin la /
translated: Just as blue, this experience is also not an object of mere experience.

original: rnam par rtog pa yang bdag gi don gang yang de'i tshe gzung ba mi dran no zhes dran par byed pa ste /üîΩ'dzin par @156a * //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yang bdag gi don gang yang de'i tshe gzung ba mi dran no zhes dran par byed pa ste / 'dzin par @156a * //
translated: And when it is memory that remembers the object, it is not the aspect that apprehends the object that is remembered.

original: byed pa'i rnam pa ni gzung bar bya ba'i ngo bo dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: byed pa'i rnam pa ni gzung bar bya ba'i ngo bo dang bral ba yin no //
translated: The aspect that apprehends the object is devoid of the nature of the object that is apprehended.

original: de bstan pa ni gcig la tshul gnyis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bstan pa ni gcig la tshul gnyis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is indicated by ‚Äútwo modes in one.‚Äù

original: nyams su myong bas gang las de ltar nyams su myong ba'o //üîΩyul nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i nyams su myong ba ni sems pa can gzhan ma yin na gang gi byed pa'i shes pa'i bya ba'am /
analyzed: nyams su myong bas gang las de ltar nyams su myong ba'o // yul nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i nyams su myong ba ni sems pa can gzhan ma yin na gang gi byed pa'i shes pa'i bya ba'am /
translated: The experience is of what is experienced.üîΩIf the experience that arises from the presence of an object is not of another experiencer, then the activity of the consciousness that is the agent or the object of the activity is not different from the external experience.

original: las kyang rung ba'i phyi rol gyi nyams su myong ba las tha dad pa'i gsum po ni nyams su myong bar ma grub na gang gis shes par 'gyur /
analyzed: las kyang rung ba'i phyi rol gyi nyams su myong ba las tha dad pa'i gsum po ni nyams su myong bar ma grub na gang gis shes par 'gyur /
translated: If the third is not established as an experience, then how could it be known?

original: 'on te bdag gis 'di mthong ngo zhes shes pa po'i dran pa ni skad cig pa ni nyams su myong ba la mi srid pas yul gzhan la rjes su dran pa dang bcas pa gzhan gyi sgrub byed ma yin pa'i sems pa can ni /
analyzed: 'on te bdag gis 'di mthong ngo zhes shes pa po'i dran pa ni skad cig pa ni nyams su myong ba la mi srid pas yul gzhan la rjes su dran pa dang bcas pa gzhan gyi sgrub byed ma yin pa'i sems pa can ni /
translated: But if it is the memory of the experiencer that thinks ‚ÄúI saw this,‚Äù since it is impossible for an instant to experience itself, the memory of another object is not established as the proof of the existence of a mind.

original: 'dir bdag yin no zhes tha snyad gdags par bya ba de'i byed pa ni bya ba yin la shes pa ni de'i 'bras bu nyams su myong ba las gzhan du mi 'thad pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir bdag yin no zhes tha snyad gdags par bya ba de'i byed pa ni bya ba yin la shes pa ni de'i 'bras bu nyams su myong ba las gzhan du mi 'thad pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the self is designated as the one who performs the action of seeing, and consciousness is the result of that action. It is not tenable for consciousness to be anything other than the experience of the result.

original: de la rnam pa gnyis nyid rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: de la rnam pa gnyis nyid rigs pa yin te /
translated: In this regard, it is logical for there to be two aspects.

original: mthong ba ni shin tu stobs dang ldan pa las byed pa po'i mchog yin par rang la rang gis shes pa yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba ni shin tu stobs dang ldan pa las byed pa po'i mchog yin par rang la rang gis shes pa yin te /
translated: Seeing is the supreme agent of the very powerful one, who knows himself.

original: gzhan gyis gsal bar bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gsal bar bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he is not clarified by another.

original: yid kyi rgyu mtshan yin pa'i go bya nyid 'di'i bde ba la sogs pa ni yul gyi rnyogs pas brnyogs pa'i 'khor ba la rtags dang dang sgra la sogs pa'i sel bas yid dang phrad pa'i rgyu can mngon sum yang 'di yin te /üîΩde nges pas bde ba la sogs pa la bzhin du brtags pa yin no zhes bya ba'i gzhan gyi 'dod pa nyid bstan pa ni dran pas zhes bya ba'o //üîΩrnam par rtog pa ni dran pa yin la nyams su myong ba'i rjod byed la sogs pa dang sbyor ba'i nyams su myong ba'i yul te /
analyzed: yid kyi rgyu mtshan yin pa'i go bya nyid 'di'i bde ba la sogs pa ni yul gyi rnyogs pas brnyogs pa'i 'khor ba la rtags dang dang sgra la sogs pa'i sel bas yid dang phrad pa'i rgyu can mngon sum yang 'di yin te / de nges pas bde ba la sogs pa la bzhin du brtags pa yin no zhes bya ba'i gzhan gyi 'dod pa nyid bstan pa ni dran pas zhes bya ba'o // rnam par rtog pa ni dran pa yin la nyams su myong ba'i rjod byed la sogs pa dang sbyor ba'i nyams su myong ba'i yul te /
translated: The object of this, such as pleasure, is also a direct perception that is caused by contact with the mind, because it is a cause of the mental sense faculty.üîΩIt is also a conceptual mental direct perception, because it is ascertained by memory.üîΩThe opponent‚Äôs assertion is stated in the line ‚ÄúMemory is a conceptual cognition.‚ÄùüîΩMemory is a conceptual cognition that is associated with the expression of an experience of an object.üîΩ
