original: bag chags dbang gis byung gyur na //
analyzed: bag chags dbang gis byung gyur na //
translated: If it arises due to the power of latent impressions,

original: shes pa po yi don gzhan la //
analyzed: shes pa po yi don gzhan la //
translated: it would be different from the object of cognition,

original: ngo shes par ni 'grub mi 'gyur //
analyzed: ngo shes par ni 'grub mi 'gyur //
translated: and it would not be established as the recognition of that.

original: zhes bya ba ma yin nam bag chags las dran pa ni phyi rol shes pa po'i bdag nyid las gzhan du 'gyur zhing 'dra ba las kyang bag chags sad pa las yin gyi shes pa po'i dran pa @156b gzhan nyid yin na mi 'byung ste gzhan shes paüîΩpo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ma yin nam bag chags las dran pa ni phyi rol shes pa po'i bdag nyid las gzhan du 'gyur zhing 'dra ba las kyang bag chags sad pa las yin gyi shes pa po'i dran pa @156b gzhan nyid yin na mi 'byung ste gzhan shes pa po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Isn‚Äôt it so? Memory from latent impressions is different from the cognizer of external objects. It arises from the activation of latent impressions, which are similar to the cognizer. If memory were different from the cognizer, it would not occur, because it would not be the cognizer.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i bdag nyid kyi rnam pa can gyi nyams su myong ba las tha dad par ma nges pa las byung ba'i bag chags ni tha mi dad pa nyid kyis mchog tu 'dzin pa skyed par byed la /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i bdag nyid kyi rnam pa can gyi nyams su myong ba las tha dad par ma nges pa las byung ba'i bag chags ni tha mi dad pa nyid kyis mchog tu 'dzin pa skyed par byed la /
translated: Here it is said: The latent impressions arising from indeterminate experience, which have the nature of what is to arise, produce the conception of self through non-difference.

original: tha dad par nges pa yin na ni de ltar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: tha dad par nges pa yin na ni de ltar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If they were determined as different, that would not be the case.

original: de ni rnal 'byor pa'i gnas skabs yin te /
analyzed: de ni rnal 'byor pa'i gnas skabs yin te /
translated: This is the stage of the yogi,

original: bdag med pa la sogs pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa la sogs pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they realize selflessness and so forth.

original: de la brten nas tshu rol mthong ba rnams mi rigs so zhes rgol bar byed pa mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la brten nas tshu rol mthong ba rnams mi rigs so zhes rgol bar byed pa mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to argue that the view of the present life is unreasonable.

original: nyams su myong ba ni las yin la //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba ni las yin la //
translated: Experience is karma.

original: sngon po ni nyams su myong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: sngon po ni nyams su myong ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt blue an experience?

original: 'di sngon po'o zhes bya ba'i shes pa la phyi rol du nges par rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di sngon po'o zhes bya ba'i shes pa la phyi rol du nges par rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: The cognition that thinks ‚ÄúThis is blue‚Äù is the ascertainment of an external object.

original: gzung ba dang cig shos kyi rnam pa dag gis gnyis nyid 'grub pa yin par bstan pa ni 'di'i zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzung ba dang cig shos kyi rnam pa dag gis gnyis nyid 'grub pa yin par bstan pa ni 'di'i zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The explanation that the two are established by the aspects of the apprehended and apprehender is ‚Äúthis.‚ÄùüîΩSince it is the opposite of non-blue, which is neither the apprehended nor the apprehender, and since it is the opposite of non-cognition, the two aspects are known as the apprehended and so on.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ma yin pa sngon po ma yin pa dang / rig pa yin pa las ldog pas rnam pa gnyis ni gzung ba la sogs pa nyid du rig pa ni lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ma yin pa sngon po ma yin pa dang / rig pa yin pa las ldog pas rnam pa gnyis ni gzung ba la sogs pa nyid du rig pa ni lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: Since they are not hidden,

original: gang du yang 'ga' zhig gis byed pa med pa yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang du yang 'ga' zhig gis byed pa med pa yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: since they are not made by anyone at all,

original: gzung bya nyid du khyod 'dod phyir //
analyzed: gzung bya nyid du khyod 'dod phyir //
translated: because you assert that they are the apprehended,

original: gcig nyid yod pa 'di min te //
analyzed: gcig nyid yod pa 'di min te //
translated: they are not the one existent.

original: de lta'i gcig gi bdag nyid la //
analyzed: de lta'i gcig gi bdag nyid la //
translated: In such a single nature,üîΩ

original: khyod la dpe 'ga' yod ma yin //
analyzed: khyod la dpe 'ga' yod ma yin //
translated: In that way, there is no example at all for you.

original: zhes bya ba'i pha rol po'i 'dod pa bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i pha rol po'i 'dod pa bsal ba yin te /
translated: This is the refutation of the opponent‚Äôs assertion.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ngag gcig ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ngag gcig ma yin gyi /
translated: The object of apprehension and the apprehender are not the same.

original: 'on ci zhe na gzung ba la sogs pa'i mngon par zhe na pa'i yul ni gcig ste mngon sum ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on ci zhe na gzung ba la sogs pa'i mngon par zhe na pa'i yul ni gcig ste mngon sum ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: What is it then? The object of manifest clinging to the apprehended, etc. is one, but it is not manifest. This is the meaning.

original: ra zhig sngon po nyid las nyid ni rnam par rtog pa la snang ba ma yin par bstan pa ni tha dad par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ra zhig sngon po nyid las nyid ni rnam par rtog pa la snang ba ma yin par bstan pa ni tha dad par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The demonstration that the blue itself is not manifest in the conceptual cognition is ‚Äúin the absence of difference.‚Äù

original: sngon po'o zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni brdzun pa yin te /
analyzed: sngon po'o zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni brdzun pa yin te /
translated: The conceptual cognition ‚Äúblue‚Äù is false,

original: ji lta ba bzhin du ma yin pa'i bag chags las byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni ldog pa de'i brtags pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du ma yin pa'i bag chags las byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni ldog pa de'i brtags pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because it arises from habitual tendencies that are not as they are. The demonstration of this is ‚Äúby the exclusion of that conceptualization.‚Äù

original: rnam pa gnyis las zhes bya ba ni 'di ni ldog pa'i don gyi'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis las zhes bya ba ni 'di ni ldog pa'i don gyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the two aspects‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúexclusion.‚Äù

original: sdug pa dang mi sdug pa dag len pa dang 'dor ba'i shes pa'i sgrub byed dag shes pa nyid du dbye ba med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: sdug pa dang mi sdug pa dag len pa dang 'dor ba'i shes pa'i sgrub byed dag shes pa nyid du dbye ba med pa ma yin nam /
translated: Are not the proofs of the cognition that accepts the pleasant and rejects the unpleasant not just different aspects of cognition itself?

original: 'bad pa chen pos bsgrub par bya ba'i phyi rol 'grub na /
analyzed: 'bad pa chen pos bsgrub par bya ba'i phyi rol 'grub na /
translated: If external things are established by great effort,

original: yid la 'dod pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur gyi //üîΩ@157a * // 'bad pa med par 'grub pa'i shes pa las 'byung ba ni ma yin no zhes zer ba la gang tshe zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: yid la 'dod pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur gyi // @157a * // 'bad pa med par 'grub pa'i shes pa las 'byung ba ni ma yin no zhes zer ba la gang tshe zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: then the desired result is established,üîΩbut not from a cognition that is established without effort.

original: ma grub pa ni ma rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma grub pa ni ma rdzogs pa'o //
translated: When there is no establishment, there is no completion.

original: de'i dngos por ni 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i ngo bo gang gi yin pa de gzhan ni phyi rol lo //
analyzed: de'i dngos por ni 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i ngo bo gang gi yin pa de gzhan ni phyi rol lo //
translated: The external is that which has the nature of the desired and the undesired.

original: rnam rig rgyu zhes bya ba ni rnam par rig pa dang dus mtshungs pa ma yin pa nyid rdzogs pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: rnam rig rgyu zhes bya ba ni rnam par rig pa dang dus mtshungs pa ma yin pa nyid rdzogs pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of cognition is the cause of completion that is not simultaneous with cognition.

original: dus mtshungs pa nyid yin yang tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa nyid kyis gzung bar bya ba ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dus mtshungs pa nyid yin yang tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa nyid kyis gzung bar bya ba ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Even if it is simultaneous, it is taught that it is not apprehended due to dependence on the same collection.

original: yul zhes bya ba ste dbyibs can nam /
analyzed: yul zhes bya ba ste dbyibs can nam /
translated: Or, the object is a shape.

original: gcig shos kyang dus mtshungs par phan tshun bya ba byed pa'i mngon sum ni bde ba dang sngon po dag gnyis sam gnyis med pa ni de dag rang gi rig pa gcig gis byed pa'i khongs su gtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gcig shos kyang dus mtshungs par phan tshun bya ba byed pa'i mngon sum ni bde ba dang sngon po dag gnyis sam gnyis med pa ni de dag rang gi rig pa gcig gis byed pa'i khongs su gtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Or, the other is simultaneous with the cognition. The direct perception of mutual activity is included in the activity of a single cognition of pleasure and blue, whether they are two or not two. This is the meaning.

original: de'i tshe 'di nyams su myong ba gang gi yin zhes zer ba la de ni zhes bya ba ste rnam par shes pa'i'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di nyams su myong ba gang gi yin zhes zer ba la de ni zhes bya ba ste rnam par shes pa'i'o //
translated: At that time, whose is this experience? It is of consciousness.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang cig shos nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang cig shos nyid kyis so //
translated: Thus means by the assertion and the other.

original: myong ba zhes bya ba ni phyi rol ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: myong ba zhes bya ba ni phyi rol ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: Experience means not external.

original: phyi rol nyid dang 'gal ba'i phyir shes pa nyid sdug pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba goms pa la sogs byung ba yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol nyid dang 'gal ba'i phyir shes pa nyid sdug pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba goms pa la sogs byung ba yin te /
translated: Because it is contradictory to externality, consciousness itself, arisen from the cultivation of the distinction of pleasure, etc.,

original: de ltar mthong ba yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: is seen thus. This is the meaning.

original: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba 'bangs pa ni de'i tshe'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba 'bangs pa ni de'i tshe'o //
translated: When means at that time.

original: rgyu ni rnam par rig pa'i'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni rnam par rig pa'i'o //
translated: The cause is the representation.

original: grub pa zhes bya ba ni tshad mas grub pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa zhes bya ba ni tshad mas grub pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEstablished‚Äù means established by a valid cognition.

original: nyams su myong yang zhes bya ba ni nges pa yin na ste /
analyzed: nyams su myong yang zhes bya ba ni nges pa yin na ste /
translated: ‚ÄúEven though experienced‚Äù means even though ascertained.

original: don nyams su myong ba dang 'gal ba'i rang nyid kyis nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don nyams su myong ba dang 'gal ba'i rang nyid kyis nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is in contradiction with the experience of an object, and it is experienced by oneself.

original: gnod pa med pa'i phyir 'gal ba med pa na yang phyi rol thob par 'gyur ba ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gnod pa med pa'i phyir 'gal ba med pa na yang phyi rol thob par 'gyur ba ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Even when there is no contradiction because there is no damage, it is not the case that external objects are obtained. This is taught in the line:

original: gang gi tshe shes cha zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes cha zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWhen there is a part of consciousness . . .‚Äù

original: nyams su myong ba ji lta bzhin du nges par khas len pa yin yang phyi rol ma yin te /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba ji lta bzhin du nges par khas len pa yin yang phyi rol ma yin te /
translated: Even though one accepts that it is ascertained just as it is experienced, it is not external.

original: shes pa cha kha cig nyid du don nyid du nges pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir bdag ni sngon po rig go zhes bya ba yang rang nyid rig pa'i las nyid rjes su brjod pa yin gyi las gzhan nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa cha kha cig nyid du don nyid du nges pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir bdag ni sngon po rig go zhes bya ba yang rang nyid rig pa'i las nyid rjes su brjod pa yin gyi las gzhan nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: Because it is ascertained as an object that is a part of consciousness, it is said that ‚ÄúI cognize blue,‚Äù and it is the activity of self-awareness that is referred to, not some other activity,

original: ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because it is not seen. This is the meaning.

original: gzung ba'i rnam pa ni sngon po'o zhes bya bar nges pa'i stobs kyis yin gyi snang ba las gzhal bya'o zhes bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam pa ni sngon po'o zhes bya bar nges pa'i stobs kyis yin gyi snang ba las gzhal bya'o zhes bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: The aspect of the object is ascertained by the power of the cognition of blue, not by the object of cognition, the appearance.

original: phyi rol dang sbyor ba 'dzin pa'i @157b rnam pa ni shes pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol dang sbyor ba 'dzin pa'i @157b rnam pa ni shes pa nyid yin no //
translated: The aspect of the apprehender is the cognition itself.

original: yang na zhes bya ba ni sbyor bzhin pa ma yin pa ste phyi rol yod kyang shes pa'i rig pa kho na de'i rig pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba ni sbyor bzhin pa ma yin pa ste phyi rol yod kyang shes pa'i rig pa kho na de'i rig pa yin no //
translated: Or, even when the external object exists, the cognition of it is the cognition of that object.

original: rig pa'i byed pa rtogs pa rang gi rig pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: rig pa'i byed pa rtogs pa rang gi rig pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the activity of cognition the self-awareness of the realization?

original: rang gi rig pa las gzhan gyi shes pa'i ngo bo'am /
analyzed: rang gi rig pa las gzhan gyi shes pa'i ngo bo'am /
translated: The nature or activity of cognition is not different from self-awareness.

original: byed pa ni ma yin zhes bstan na ni gal te 'dod pa myong bar 'gyur ba ni rang rig pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: byed pa ni ma yin zhes bstan na ni gal te 'dod pa myong bar 'gyur ba ni rang rig pa nyid yin te /
translated: If it is taught that the nature or activity of cognition is not different from self-awareness, then if the experience of desire is self-awareness,

original: rang rig pa las gzhan pa'i 'dod pa'i rnam pa'i don la rig pa rnam pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rig pa las gzhan pa'i 'dod pa'i rnam pa'i don la rig pa rnam pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the cognition of the object with the aspect of desire is not different from self-awareness, because there is no cognition with a different aspect from self-awareness.

original: 'dod pa'i bdag nyid rig pa dang don rig pa dag tha mi dad pa yin no nye bar btags pa'i khyad par yod na sgro btags pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i bdag nyid rig pa dang don rig pa dag tha mi dad pa yin no nye bar btags pa'i khyad par yod na sgro btags pa yin la /
translated: If there is a difference in designation, it is a superimposition.

original: de shes na rjes su dpag pa la shes so zhes bya bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: de shes na rjes su dpag pa la shes so zhes bya bar mi rigs te /
translated: If it is known, it is not reasonable to say that it is known through inference.

original: shes pa'i shes pa nyid don gyi shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes pa'i shes pa nyid don gyi shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the cognition of cognition is the cognition of the object.

original: des kyang zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i rnam pa nyams su myong bas so //
analyzed: des kyang zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i rnam pa nyams su myong bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that‚Äù means by the experience of the aspect of desire.

original: 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba ni gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba ni gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIt becomes‚Äù means that it is not tenable as anything else.

original: de bstan pa ni rig pa gzhan nyid la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bstan pa ni rig pa gzhan nyid la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is explained in ‚Äúif there is another awareness.‚Äù

original: nye bar btags pa las ni tha mi dad pa las te /
analyzed: nye bar btags pa las ni tha mi dad pa las te /
translated: From designation, it is not different.

original: gnyis su mi dmigs pa las phyi rol rig pa khas blangs pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i rnam pa sngon po la sogs pa'i nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
analyzed: gnyis su mi dmigs pa las phyi rol rig pa khas blangs pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i rnam pa sngon po la sogs pa'i nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
translated: From the non-apprehension of duality, external awareness is accepted. It is the illustration of the aspect of desire, such as blue.

original: rang rig pa nyid kyis gnyi ga grub par yongs su gzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rang rig pa nyid kyis gnyi ga grub par yongs su gzung ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is held that both are established by self-awareness.

original: tha dad pa'i rig pa las yang bde ba kho na'i rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i rig pa las yang bde ba kho na'i rig pa ma yin te /
translated: And it is not the awareness of pleasure alone, because of the difference in awareness.

original: sngon po gzhan nyid du yod pa'i phyir dbyibs dang bcas pa rig pa yin la /
analyzed: sngon po gzhan nyid du yod pa'i phyir dbyibs dang bcas pa rig pa yin la /
translated: Since blue exists as different, there is awareness of shape.

original: bde ba kho na yin no zhes bya ba yang thob par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir thams cad bde ba nyid yin pas ji ltar tha dad ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba kho na yin no zhes bya ba yang thob par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir thams cad bde ba nyid yin pas ji ltar tha dad ma yin pa'o //
translated: And it is not the case that it is pleasure alone, because it is not obtained. Since everything is pleasure, how is it not different?

original: ji ltar tha dad pa yin zhes bya ba'i tha dad pa'i phyogs sel ba'i tshigs su bcad pa la gnas pa bstan pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar tha dad pa yin zhes bya ba'i tha dad pa'i phyogs sel ba'i tshigs su bcad pa la gnas pa bstan pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to remove the position that it is different, he teaches the verse that shows the position: ‚ÄúIf it were pleasure, etc.‚Äù

original: rnam pa gzhan du ni mi 'dod pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du ni mi 'dod pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means ‚Äúin another way.‚Äù

original: myong bar 'gyur na ni zhes bya ba ni don no //
analyzed: myong bar 'gyur na ni zhes bya ba ni don no //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it were experienced‚Äù is the meaning.

original: 'dod pa'am mi 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni don gyi gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'am mi 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni don gyi gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúDesired or not desired‚Äù is the meaning of both natures.

original: rnam pa gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyis go rims bzhin du gnyi ga med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyis go rims bzhin du gnyi ga med par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the nature of both aspects, both are absent.

original: go rims ji bzhin ma yin par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: go rims ji bzhin ma yin par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: In order to show the nonsequential, he says,

original: 'dod pa'i rnam pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rnam pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the mode of desire‚Äù means that the object is experienced as desirable or undesirable.üîΩ‚ÄúBy the mode of the thing itself‚Äù means that the object is experienced as different from the self.

original: dngos kyi 'jug pas zhes bya ba ni tha dad pas nyams su myong bas yin gyi /üîΩbems po dang cig shos kyi @158a * //
analyzed: dngos kyi 'jug pas zhes bya ba ni tha dad pas nyams su myong bas yin gyi / bems po dang cig shos kyi @158a * //
translated: It is not experienced as an entity that is inert or otherwise.üîΩIf it were otherwise, the order of the three modes would not be as stated.üîΩThe designation of the object as desirable or undesirable is not different from the experience of the object as desirable or undesirable.üîΩThe experience of the object as desirable or undesirable is not different from the experience of the object as different from the self.

original: ngo bos ni ma yin zhing nyams su myong bar khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bos ni ma yin zhing nyams su myong bar khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The experience of the object as different from the self is not different from the experience of the object as inert or otherwise.üîΩIf this were not so, the order of the three modes would not be as stated.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni go rims ji lta ba bzhin bstan pa ma yin na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni go rims ji lta ba bzhin bstan pa ma yin na'o //
translated: The designation of the object as desirable or undesirable is not different from the experience of the object as desirable or undesirable.üîΩThe experience of the object as desirable or undesirable is not different from the experience of the object as different from the self.

original: nye bar btags pa nyid ni tha mi dad pa nyid ni bde ba dang bde ba ma yin pa gnyis gcig la gcig gi tshe 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: nye bar btags pa nyid ni tha mi dad pa nyid ni bde ba dang bde ba ma yin pa gnyis gcig la gcig gi tshe 'gal ba yin no //
translated: The experience of the object as different from the self is not different from the experience of the object as inert or otherwise.

original: phyi der bye brag med mod kyi //
analyzed: phyi der bye brag med mod kyi //
translated: If this were not so, the order of the three modes would not be as stated.üîΩ‚ÄúThe object is not experienced as pleasure, etc.,

original: goms pa shin tu phul byung las //
analyzed: goms pa shin tu phul byung las //
translated: because of the absence of a special quality,üîΩbecause of the absence of a difference,

original: blo la dga' dang yongs su gdung //
analyzed: blo la dga' dang yongs su gdung //
translated: and because of the absence of a distinction.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThe object is not experienced as pleasure, etc.,

original: bde sogs don gyi ngo bo min //
analyzed: bde sogs don gyi ngo bo min //
translated: because of the absence of a special quality,

original: zhes bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: because of the absence of a difference,üîΩand because of the absence of a distinction.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThe object is not experienced as pleasure, etc.,üîΩbecause of the absence of a special quality,üîΩbecause of the absence of a difference,

original: de ltar na 'dod pa dang cig shos kyi don rtogs pa ji ltar brjod pa yin /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dod pa dang cig shos kyi don rtogs pa ji ltar brjod pa yin /
translated: and because of the absence of a distinction.‚Äù

original: 'dod pa dang cig shos kyi rgyu lhan cig byed pa nyid kyi 'dod pa dag cig shos nyid yin gyi rang la ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang cig shos kyi rgyu lhan cig byed pa nyid kyi 'dod pa dag cig shos nyid yin gyi rang la ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the cause of desire and the cause of the other are the same, but the desire and the other are not the same,

original: ji lta de lta yin du chug kyang rnam pa thams cad du don de nyid kho na yin par go rims bzhin du ston pa ma yin na yang dbye ba med do //
analyzed: ji lta de lta yin du chug kyang rnam pa thams cad du don de nyid kho na yin par go rims bzhin du ston pa ma yin na yang dbye ba med do //
translated: we reply: even if it were so, the meaning would be the same in every way, and the order would not be different.

original: de'i phyir rang gi rig pa nyid don gyi byed pa dang 'bras bu yang yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi rig pa nyid don gyi byed pa dang 'bras bu yang yin te /
translated: Therefore, self-awareness is the activity and result of the object,

original: tha mi dad pa'i phyir dbang po la sogs pa la don nyid rig par ci'i phyir mi 'dod ces zer ba la /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i phyir dbang po la sogs pa la don nyid rig par ci'i phyir mi 'dod ces zer ba la /
translated: because they are not different. Why do you not accept that the object itself is awareness, like the sense faculties and so on?

original: phyi rdol don ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: phyi rdol don ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúThe object is not . . . ‚Äù

original: rang gi rig pa nyid yin na nyams su myong ba nyid 'di yin gyi don ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi rig pa nyid yin na nyams su myong ba nyid 'di yin gyi don ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If it were self-awareness, it would be experience, not the object.

original: skyes bu re re zhing dbang po'i dbye bas skyed pa'i rim pa rnams nyid tha dad pas don thun mong pa nyid du mi 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: skyes bu re re zhing dbang po'i dbye bas skyed pa'i rim pa rnams nyid tha dad pas don thun mong pa nyid du mi 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: The response to the objection that the object would not be common to all is ‚ÄúThe order of . . . ‚Äù

original: rang ngo bos zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang ngo bos zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe nature of itself‚Äù means the nature of the cognition itself.

original: du ma'i bdag nyid ces bya ba ni thun mong ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: du ma'i bdag nyid ces bya ba ni thun mong ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúThe nature of the many‚Äù means the nature of the individual cognitions.

original: don ni rdul phra rab kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don ni rdul phra rab kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The meaning is that because the object has the nature of atoms, it is known to be ultimately composed of atoms.

original: rdul phra rab kyi mthar thug par rig pa'i dbye ba las rig pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi mthar thug par rig pa'i dbye ba las rig pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it is not known to be composed of atoms, then it follows that it is not known at all.üîΩThe nature of smoke is distant from the nature of fire, because it is produced from its own cause.

original: rang gi rgyu'i bskyed bya nyid la du ba'i bdag nyid nyid du thag ring ba dang cig shos kyi dbye bas rig pa dang cig shos kyi bdag nyid de la skyon ni sun dbyung bas te /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu'i bskyed bya nyid la du ba'i bdag nyid nyid du thag ring ba dang cig shos kyi dbye bas rig pa dang cig shos kyi bdag nyid de la skyon ni sun dbyung bas te /
translated: The nature of the cognition is distant from the nature of the object, because it is produced from its own cause.

original: bsal ba'o zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
analyzed: bsal ba'o zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
translated: The fault is that the object is refuted,üîΩand the cognition is not refuted.üîΩOthers say that the object is the referent of the cognition, because it is accepted as the referent of the cognition.

original: gzhan dag na re rig pa gcig gi bdag nyid las bzlog pa ni don gnyis pa'i dmigs pa khas blangs pas don dang ldan pa'i nyams su myong ba'i 'bras bu la yang bya ba ni byed pa po'i bya ba yin la /üîΩbyed pa po yang de dang ldan pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rig pa gcig gi bdag nyid las bzlog pa ni don gnyis pa'i dmigs pa khas blangs pas don dang ldan pa'i nyams su myong ba'i 'bras bu la yang bya ba ni byed pa po'i bya ba yin la /üîΩbyed pa po yang de dang ldan pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The cognition is the agent of the action of referring to the object, and the object is the referent of the cognition.

original: rnam par rig par smra ba yang don bzhin du khas len pa tsam ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rig par smra ba yang don bzhin du khas len pa tsam ma yin te /
translated: The Vij√±ƒÅnavƒÅdins also do not accept things just as they are.

original: @158b tshad mas grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: @158b tshad mas grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The demonstration that they are not established by valid cognition is:

original: rnam par shes pa smra ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa smra ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe so-called Vij√±ƒÅnavƒÅdins.‚ÄùüîΩIf there is no valid cognition, then the demonstration that they do not accept things without distinction is:

original: tshad ma med na ni khyad par med par khas ma blangs pas nges 'gyur bar bstan pa ni rten med pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshad ma med na ni khyad par med par khas ma blangs pas nges 'gyur bar bstan pa ni rten med pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSince there is no basis.‚Äù

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni shes pa'i rig pa yin na ni zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni shes pa'i rig pa yin na ni zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The so-called ‚Äúown nature‚Äù is connected with ‚Äúif it is the awareness of consciousness.‚Äù

original: 'dod pa ni rig par ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni rig par ro //
translated: The assertion is that it is awareness.

original: sna tshogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi don yang bag chags kyi nges pa las skyes bu re re zhing nges par mthong ba yin gyi /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi don yang bag chags kyi nges pa las skyes bu re re zhing nges par mthong ba yin gyi /
translated: The various natures of objects are seen by each person as definite due to the certainty of latent propensities.

original: shes pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not the nature of consciousness.

original: las nyid du snang ba'i phyi rol la sogs pa'i blo nyid la de ltar 'dra ba'i ngo bo nyid du rnam par gnas pa la bag chags dang lhan cig byed pa nyid rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin gyi mthong ba la ma yin par zer ba ni
analyzed: las nyid du snang ba'i phyi rol la sogs pa'i blo nyid la de ltar 'dra ba'i ngo bo nyid du rnam par gnas pa la bag chags dang lhan cig byed pa nyid rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin gyi mthong ba la ma yin par zer ba ni
translated: The cognition of external objects such as form, etc., which appear as objects, is posited as the cause of the latent potentialities, but not as the cause of the perception of form, etc.

original: don du ma'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //üîΩbag chags kyi snga rol du yod pa la tshad ma med pa'i phyir dang / de ma thag nyid du dmigs pa'i phyir de'i bskyed bya nyid kyis shes pa nyid yin na las nyid bems po bzhin du 'gal bar byed pa nyid ma yin bstan pa ni khas blangs na yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: don du ma'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o // bag chags kyi snga rol du yod pa la tshad ma med pa'i phyir dang / de ma thag nyid du dmigs pa'i phyir de'i bskyed bya nyid kyis shes pa nyid yin na las nyid bems po bzhin du 'gal bar byed pa nyid ma yin bstan pa ni khas blangs na yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The meaning of the verse is that the object is not the cause of the latent potentialities.üîΩSince there is no valid cognition of the object prior to the latent potentialities, and since it is perceived immediately after the latent potentialities, the object is the effect of the latent potentialities, and cognition is the cause of the latent potentialities. If this is accepted, then the object is not the cause of the latent potentialities, and the latent potentialities are not the cause of the object.

original: du ma nyid du dbye bas rnam par gzhag pa ni skyes bu nyid kyi bag chags kyi nges pas snga na yod pa la tshad ma med pas tshad ma'i bdag nyid du thal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: du ma nyid du dbye bas rnam par gzhag pa ni skyes bu nyid kyi bag chags kyi nges pas snga na yod pa la tshad ma med pas tshad ma'i bdag nyid du thal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If the object is the cause of the latent potentialities, then the object must exist prior to the latent potentialities. Since there is no valid cognition of the object prior to the latent potentialities, it follows that the object is the nature of valid cognition.

original: rnam pa gzhan dang ldan pa la rnam pa gzhan du rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan dang ldan pa la rnam pa gzhan du rtogs pa ste /
translated: If it were the case that one thing were cognized in the aspect of something else,

original: khong du chud pa yin na rnam par gzhag pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba bstan pa ni rang gi rnam pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khong du chud pa yin na rnam par gzhag pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba bstan pa ni rang gi rnam pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then there would be no such thing as a conceptual distinguisher.

original: yang na zhes bya ba ni thabs khas len pa yin na'o //
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba ni thabs khas len pa yin na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOr‚Äù means ‚Äúif one accepts the method.‚Äù

original: tha dad par ni du ma'i bdag nyid du ste las su sgrub byed yin pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyis po dag las gcig nyams su myong na cig shos kyang nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha dad par ni du ma'i bdag nyid du ste las su sgrub byed yin pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyis po dag las gcig nyams su myong na cig shos kyang nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were the case that the two were different, then, since the object is established as the many, the nature of the many, then, since the object is established as the many, the nature of the many, when one of the two aspects is experienced, the other would also be experienced.

original: dngos po'i don to zhes bya ba ni bag chags kyi khyad par phyi rol du nges par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i don to zhes bya ba ni bag chags kyi khyad par phyi rol du nges par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe object‚Äù means the particular latent potentialities that are determined to be external.

original: rang gi shes pa'i rjes byed pa //
analyzed: rang gi shes pa'i rjes byed pa //
translated: It follows the form of its own cognition.

original: mang po'i rnam pa'i dngos rnams la //
analyzed: mang po'i rnam pa'i dngos rnams la //
translated: In the case of things with many aspects,

original: nges par bzung bas nus par 'gyur //
analyzed: nges par bzung bas nus par 'gyur //
translated: it is restricted and becomes capable.

original: sngar min rnam pa'i rtog pa min //
analyzed: sngar min rnam pa'i rtog pa min //
translated: It is not a conception of a form that did not exist before.

original: rang gi shes pa'i rjes su byed pa ni bag chags yin na /
analyzed: rang gi shes pa'i rjes su byed pa ni bag chags yin na /
translated: If latent potentialities follow the form of their own cognition,

original: phyi rol nyid ni bag chags kyi nges pa ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yang na zhes bya ba gzhan du sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol nyid ni bag chags kyi nges pa ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yang na zhes bya ba gzhan du sbyar ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúor‚Äù is connected to the other.

original: snga ma la ni gcig tu 'gyur bar ma bshad la /
analyzed: snga ma la ni gcig tu 'gyur bar ma bshad la /
translated: In the former, it is not said that there is a single cognition,

original: 'di la ni tha dad @159a * //üîΩpar mi 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di la ni tha dad @159a * // par mi 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: but here there is no difference.

original: 'on kyang tha mi dad pa ste nges pa med pas rnam pa thams cad kyi shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par dbye ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang tha mi dad pa ste nges pa med pas rnam pa thams cad kyi shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par dbye ba'o //
translated: However, there is no difference, no ascertainment, so all aspects would be cognized. This is the analysis.

original: yang gi sgras ni re zhig ji lta ba bzhin nyams su myong ba don rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni re zhig ji lta ba bzhin nyams su myong ba don rig pa ma yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that the object is not cognized as it is.

original: tha dad par khas blangs kyang ste don ni snga ba yin la shes pa ni 'phyi ba yin no //
analyzed: tha dad par khas blangs kyang ste don ni snga ba yin la shes pa ni 'phyi ba yin no //
translated: Even if difference is accepted, the object is earlier and the cognition is later.

original: gnyis po dag myong mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni don gyi rig pa gcig nyid kyis rdzogs pa'i phyir don gyis go ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
analyzed: gnyis po dag myong mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni don gyi rig pa gcig nyid kyis rdzogs pa'i phyir don gyis go ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe two are not experienced‚Äù means that since the cognition of the object is complete by itself, there is no understanding of the object by the object. This is the opponent‚Äôs view.

original: don rig pa'i dus na shes pa yod kyang ma mthong bas bsgribs pas sam tshad ma med pas rig pa ma yin pa yin gyi /
analyzed: don rig pa'i dus na shes pa yod kyang ma mthong bas bsgribs pas sam tshad ma med pas rig pa ma yin pa yin gyi /
translated: When there is awareness of the object, consciousness exists, but it is not seen, because it is obscured, or because there is no valid cognition.üîΩIt is not that it does not exist.

original: med pas ni ma yin no zhes zer ba ni ma mthong zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: med pas ni ma yin no zhes zer ba ni ma mthong zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is meant by ‚Äúnot seen.‚Äù

original: rig bzhin pa'i don gyis bsgribs pas rig par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni rtogs mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rig bzhin pa'i don gyis bsgribs pas rig par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni rtogs mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is taught that awareness is not possible because the object is obscured by awareness: ‚Äúit is not cognized.‚Äù

original: don gyi rig pa ni shes pa'i rig pa la tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: don gyi rig pa ni shes pa'i rig pa la tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: Awareness of the object is not a valid cognition in relation to awareness of consciousness,

original: de yod kyang 'dzin par 'dod pa ma yin na mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod kyang 'dzin par 'dod pa ma yin na mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even if it exists, it is not accepted as a grasper.

original: 'dod pa grub pa yang dngos su ba ma yin te /üîΩdu ba ni med na me 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir shes pa'i sgo nas rig par byed pa yin gyi don gyi shes pa ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa grub pa yang dngos su ba ma yin te / du ba ni med na me 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir shes pa'i sgo nas rig par byed pa yin gyi don gyi shes pa ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: The establishment of the thesis is not direct,üîΩbecause when there is no smoke, fire arises. Therefore, it is known by means of consciousness, but not by means of awareness of the object.

original: bsgrub bya mngon sum ma yin pa nyid kyis de med na mi 'byung bas mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub bya mngon sum ma yin pa nyid kyis de med na mi 'byung bas mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the object of consciousness is not directly perceived, and it is not known by the non-occurrence of the object when it does not exist.

original: de'i phyir ma shes pa'i don la su zhig gis kyang blo dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma shes pa'i don la su zhig gis kyang blo dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, no one can have a cognition of an object that is not known.

original: don shes na ni rjes su dpag pa las blo rtog pa yin no zhes shes pa'i don can ma yin no //
analyzed: don shes na ni rjes su dpag pa las blo rtog pa yin no zhes shes pa'i don can ma yin no //
translated: If the object is known, then the cognition is conceptual, as it is in the case of inference.

original: gang gi phyir tshad ma ni yod la gzhal bya rtogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rigs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshad ma ni yod la gzhal bya rtogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rigs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to say that there is a valid cognition but that the object is not cognized.

original: 'grel par ni don gyi rnam pa gcig shes pa na rnam pa gzhan bsgribs pa yin pa la brgal ba'i bsal bas de lta na don ji lta ba bzhin du rig par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni gcig tu ste don gyi'o //
analyzed: 'grel par ni don gyi rnam pa gcig shes pa na rnam pa gzhan bsgribs pa yin pa la brgal ba'i bsal bas de lta na don ji lta ba bzhin du rig par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni gcig tu ste don gyi'o //
translated: In the commentary, it is shown that when one aspect of an object is cognized, the other aspect is obscured. Thus, the object is not cognized as it is.

original: rnam pa gnyis dang ldan pa snga na yod pa la tshad ma med pa'i phyir ma mthong ba'i log par ston pa yin gyi bsgribs pa ma yin par bstan pa ni rab rib lta bur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis dang ldan pa snga na yod pa la tshad ma med pa'i phyir ma mthong ba'i log par ston pa yin gyi bsgribs pa ma yin par bstan pa ni rab rib lta bur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that the object is not obscured but is not seen because it is not present in the first place is shown to be a false explanation, since a valid cognition cannot exist without an object.üîΩThe statement that the object is obscured is shown to be false by the example of cataracts.

original: rab rib ni zla ba gcig la rnam pa gnyis su mthong bar byed pas brdzun pa yin pa de bzhin du ma mthong ba yang gcig nyid la gnyis kyi rnam par ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rab rib ni zla ba gcig la rnam pa gnyis su mthong bar byed pas brdzun pa yin pa de bzhin du ma mthong ba yang gcig nyid la gnyis kyi rnam par ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Just as the eye disease makes the one moon appear as two, and is thus false, so also the non-seeing makes the one appear as two.

original: zla ba gnyis nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by the words: ‚ÄúThe two moons are not real.‚Äù

original: don gyi dbang gis ma yin no zhes bya ba ni @159b brdzun pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyi dbang gis ma yin no zhes bya ba ni @159b brdzun pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúNot by the power of the object‚Äù means that it is false.

original: de bstan pa ni ma mthong ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bstan pa ni ma mthong ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by the words: ‚ÄúBy the non-seeing itself.‚Äù

original: med pa mthong bar mi nus pa ni yod pa bsgribs pa dang mtshungs pa yin par bstan pa ni rung ba'i yul na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: med pa mthong bar mi nus pa ni yod pa bsgribs pa dang mtshungs pa yin par bstan pa ni rung ba'i yul na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The inability to see what is not there is similar to the obscuration of what is there. This is taught by the words: ‚ÄúIn a suitable place.‚Äù

original: yod pa la dmigs pa'i bdag nyid kyis longs spyod pa gzhan du mi 'thad pas rtogs par bya ba'i ma mthong ba ni longs spyod pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa bsgribs pa'i 'bras bur mi 'thad pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yod pa la dmigs pa'i bdag nyid kyis longs spyod pa gzhan du mi 'thad pas rtogs par bya ba'i ma mthong ba ni longs spyod pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa bsgribs pa'i 'bras bur mi 'thad pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Since it is not tenable that there is another experience that has the nature of perceiving what is there, the non-seeing of what is to be cognized is not tenable as the result of the obscuration of what is not an experience. This is taught by the words:üîΩ‚ÄúThe non-seeing of what is there is not tenable.‚Äù

original: de la zhes bya ba ste ji ltar rig par byed pa yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ste ji ltar rig par byed pa yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù is to be connected with ‚Äúhow is it known?‚Äù

original: ches 'dod pa'i rig pa'i go bya las phyin ci log tu byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ches 'dod pa'i rig pa'i go bya las phyin ci log tu byed pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that it is the opposite of what is to be known by the desirous.

original: tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not a valid cognition.

original: bsdu ba ni gnas skabs kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: bsdu ba ni gnas skabs kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The summary is from the perspective of the occasion.

original: las ni las gzhan dang 'brel pas rang nyid kyis nyams su myong ba skyed par byed /
analyzed: las ni las gzhan dang 'brel pas rang nyid kyis nyams su myong ba skyed par byed /
translated: The function is that it produces its own experience in connection with another action.

original: 'ga' la ni sgrib par byed pa las kyi phyed myong nas las gzhan par du gcod par byed pa yin no snyam du sems pa la goms pa'i dbang gis 'byung bar mthong zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'ga' la ni sgrib par byed pa las kyi phyed myong nas las gzhan par du gcod par byed pa yin no snyam du sems pa la goms pa'i dbang gis 'byung bar mthong zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is seen that for some, the other half of the action that is experienced obscures the other action that is to be interrupted through the power of habituation.

original: goms pa'i bdag nyid kyi las rig par byed pa ni tshad ma can yin la /
analyzed: goms pa'i bdag nyid kyi las rig par byed pa ni tshad ma can yin la /
translated: The function of the self-knowing action that is habituated is valid cognition.

original: sna tshogs la sogs pa'i bstan bcos kyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sna tshogs la sogs pa'i bstan bcos kyi ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the treatises of the various schools.

original: 'bras bu de'i rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rjes su byed par nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu de'i rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rjes su byed par nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: because there is no experience of the result, etc., following the word, etc.

original: sgra nyid nyams su myong ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra nyid nyams su myong ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the word itself that is experienced,

original: mngon du byed pa dang 'brel pa dag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon du byed pa dang 'brel pa dag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no connection with the manifestation.

original: rnam par rtog pa tsam ni skyes bus ma byas pa nyid ma yin pa la yang don la the tshom za ba'i phyir rtogs par byed pa ma yin zhing sgra ni 'di tshad ma nyid ma yin pa las 'das pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa tsam ni skyes bus ma byas pa nyid ma yin pa la yang don la the tshom za ba'i phyir rtogs par byed pa ma yin zhing sgra ni 'di tshad ma nyid ma yin pa las 'das pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to
translated: The mere conceptualization is not a revealer even of what is not made by a person, because it is doubtful about the meaning. The word is not beyond being a valid cognition.

original: ; ; goms pa'i bdag nyid kyi las kyang de las gzhan pas bar chod pas rang gi 'bras bu rig pa skyed par byed pa ni sgrib pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba de nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ; ; goms pa'i bdag nyid kyi las kyang de las gzhan pas bar chod pas rang gi 'bras bu rig pa skyed par byed pa ni sgrib pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba de nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The action that has the nature of habituation is also an obscuration, because it generates the cognition of its own result, being interrupted by something else. This is what is meant by ‚Äúthat itself.‚Äù

original: de lta bu'i mthong ba ni rig pa'i bdag nyid kyis don gyi skyed byed nyid yin gyi rig pa ma yin pa rig par byed pa ma yin par bstan pa ni grub pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i mthong ba ni rig pa'i bdag nyid kyis don gyi skyed byed nyid yin gyi rig pa ma yin pa rig par byed pa ma yin par bstan pa ni grub pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: Such a seeing is the producer of the object by the nature of awareness, not by the nature of non-awareness. This is taught by ‚Äúestablished.‚Äù

original: de nyid bstan pa ni bag chags stobs las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa ni bag chags stobs las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by ‚Äúfrom the power of latent impressions.‚Äù

original: bag chags ni rtog pa'i skyed byed yin gyi /
analyzed: bag chags ni rtog pa'i skyed byed yin gyi /
translated: Latent impressions are the producers of concepts,

original: don gyi ni ma yin zhes zer ba ni gal te don ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don gyi ni ma yin zhes zer ba ni gal te don ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: but not of objects. This is said by ‚Äúif the object . . .‚Äù

original: de ltar ni 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa nyid kyis so //üîΩmtshams sbyor @160a * //
analyzed: de ltar ni 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa nyid kyis so // mtshams sbyor @160a * //
translated: This is so because of the desire and non-desire.üîΩThere is no connection.

original: med ces bya ba ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //üîΩsems kyang ni don gyi blo rnams kyang ngo zhes rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba'am /
analyzed: med ces bya ba ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro // sems kyang ni don gyi blo rnams kyang ngo zhes rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba'am /
translated: This is because of the variety.üîΩThe mind also, and the cognitions of objects, are to be connected in another order.

original: de la 'ang ste don la yang ngo //
analyzed: de la 'ang ste don la yang ngo //
translated: Or, there is also that, the object.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar nyams su myong ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar nyams su myong ba ste /
translated: Therefore, just as there is experience,

original: ji ltar rig pa'i ngo bor shes pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir rang nyid nyams su myong ste rig pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rig pa'i ngo bor shes pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir rang nyid nyams su myong ste rig pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: Because it is the nature of the cognition of the essence of cognition, it is self-experienced, the essence of cognition.

original: ji ltar nyams su myong ba yin zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar nyams su myong ba yin zhes zer ba la /
translated: How is it experienced?

original: nyams su myong ba mchog tu 'dzin pa ni gnag phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba mchog tu 'dzin pa ni gnag phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause it is the nature of the cognition of the essence of cognition‚Äù is the reason.

original: 'di'i ni nyams su myong ba'i'o //
analyzed: 'di'i ni nyams su myong ba'i'o //
translated: This is the experience of that.

original: phyi'i don la yang zhes bya ba yang zhes bya ba ni tha dad par khas len pa na'o//
analyzed: phyi'i don la yang zhes bya ba yang zhes bya ba ni tha dad par khas len pa na'o//
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the case of external objects‚Äù is a response to the opponent‚Äôs claim that the object and cognition are different.

original: de ste don rig pa la'o //
analyzed: de ste don rig pa la'o //
translated: If the object is cognized,

original: rang rig pa zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo'o //
translated: the cognition is self-cognition, the nature of experience.üîΩIf it is cognized as it is, it is cognition itself. How can it be the cognition of an object that is different from it?

original: ji ltar rig pas ni rig pa kho nar 'gyur na tha dad pa las don rig par ji ltar 'gyur zhes zer ba la 'di la yang nyams su myong ba'i rang rig pa la shes pa'i nyams su myong ba bor nas phyi rol nyid rtogs pa yin no
analyzed: ji ltar rig pas ni rig pa kho nar 'gyur na tha dad pa las don rig par ji ltar 'gyur zhes zer ba la 'di la yang nyams su myong ba'i rang rig pa la shes pa'i nyams su myong ba bor nas phyi rol nyid rtogs pa yin no
translated: In this case, the experience of the object is self-cognition. The experience of cognition is discarded, and only the external object is cognized.

original: zhes mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is not reasonable. This is the meaning.

original: slob dpon ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'o //
analyzed: slob dpon ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'o //
translated: The master is the master Dignaga.

original: shes pa ni shes pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: shes pa ni shes pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Knowledge is the nature of knowledge.

original: 'di'i ni rang gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: 'di'i ni rang gi ngo bo'o //
translated: This is its own nature.

original: kun du snang ba ni 'dra ba nyid do //
analyzed: kun du snang ba ni 'dra ba nyid do //
translated: Appearance is the same.

original: ci las she na gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ci las she na gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: From what? Because of what.

original: de'i phyir yul du snang ba'o zhes bya ba ni rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir yul du snang ba'o zhes bya ba ni rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the appearance as objects is the cause. This is the meaning of because of.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni rab tu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni rab tu bstan pa'o //
translated: How? This is the explanation.

original: sdug gu la sogs pa ni bde ba la sogs pa nyid kyis te /
analyzed: sdug gu la sogs pa ni bde ba la sogs pa nyid kyis te /
translated: Pleasant, etc. is the same as happiness, etc.

original: 'di ni nye bar mtshon pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ni nye bar mtshon pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: This is the illustration. The explanation is:

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore.

original: rnam pa tha dad pas zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa ste nye bar brtags pa'o//
analyzed: rnam pa tha dad pas zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa ste nye bar brtags pa'o//
translated: By different aspects is blue, etc. This is the imputation.

original: rnam pa tha dad pa med pa'i ngo bo yin pas 'dzin pa'i rnam pa ni rnag rig par rung ba'i ngo bor tha mi dad kyang nye bar btags pa nyid kyis rnam par gzhag par ci'i phyir mi byed ces bya ba la kun la zhes bya ba smosüîΩso // sngon po zhes don gyi khyad par gyi nges pa byung ba ni nyams su myong ba'i cha'i khyad par sngar nyams su myong ba la rag las pa yin gyi nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid kyi rang mtshan nyid kyis dbye ba la rig pa'am nges pa la khyad
analyzed: rnam pa tha dad pa med pa'i ngo bo yin pas 'dzin pa'i rnam pa ni rnag rig par rung ba'i ngo bor tha mi dad kyang nye bar btags pa nyid kyis rnam par gzhag par ci'i phyir mi byed ces bya ba la kun la zhes bya ba smos so // sngon po zhes don gyi khyad par gyi nges pa byung ba ni nyams su myong ba'i cha'i khyad par sngar nyams su myong ba la rag las pa yin gyi nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid kyi rang mtshan nyid kyis dbye ba la rig pa'am nges pa la khyad
translated: Therefore, why not posit the aspect of the apprehender as the aspect of the object, since it is not different from the entity that is suitable to be the aspect of pus?üîΩThe arising of the ascertainment of the particular object blue depends on the particular experience of blue that was previously experienced.

original: par du byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: par du byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The ascertainment or knowledge of the particular object blue is not due to the particular intrinsic identity of the experience itself,

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference.

original: tshogs pa gcig las rag las pa nyid kyi khyad par gyis de mi rigs pas rig par bya ba ma @160b yin zhing yod pa tsam gyis kyang khyad par med pa ma yin te ngo bo la dbye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa gcig las rag las pa nyid kyi khyad par gyis de mi rigs pas rig par bya ba ma @160b yin zhing yod pa tsam gyis kyang khyad par med pa ma yin te ngo bo la dbye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is not reasonable that it be the object of awareness, because it is distinguished by its dependence on a single collection. And it is not the case that it is not distinguished by mere existence, because there is no division in its nature.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i rgyu nyid kyang de las gzhan pa las ngo bo tha dad pa byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i rgyu nyid kyang de las gzhan pa las ngo bo tha dad pa byed pa ma yin te /
translated: And the cause of its distinct particular characteristic does not make it different from anything else.

original: de'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the object of that.

original: gal te yang khyad par med na rig par bya ba ma yin la /
analyzed: gal te yang khyad par med na rig par bya ba ma yin la /
translated: And if it is not distinguished, it is not the object of awareness.

original: rig na yang rnam pa'i khyad par thob par 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: rig na yang rnam pa'i khyad par thob par 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
translated: And if it is aware, it obtains the distinction of the aspect. Therefore,

original: rnam pa med pa'i kho bo cag gi blo zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa med pa'i kho bo cag gi blo zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: it is not the case that our so-called awareness is without aspect.

original: nye ba gang gis don nyid kyi rnam pa bdag gir byed pa de nyid kyis de rig par byed par 'gyur na rnam pas ci zhig bya ba 'di yang legs pa ma yin te gzung ba'i rnam pa rig pa ni 'dzin pa nyams su myong ba 'di las
analyzed: nye ba gang gis don nyid kyi rnam pa bdag gir byed pa de nyid kyis de rig par byed par 'gyur na rnam pas ci zhig bya ba 'di yang legs pa ma yin te gzung ba'i rnam pa rig pa ni 'dzin pa nyams su myong ba 'di las
translated: This is also not good. The cognition of the aspect of the object is not experienced by the cognition of the apprehender.

original: so zhes bya ba ni mi rigs pa kho na yin pa'i don to //
analyzed: so zhes bya ba ni mi rigs pa kho na yin pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of ‚Äúit is not reasonable.‚Äù

original: rnam pa yang shes pa la gnas gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa yang shes pa la gnas gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the aspect does not exist separately from consciousness.

original: 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba'i don ji ltar ma yin zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba'i don ji ltar ma yin zhes zer ba la /
translated: How is it not the meaning that the aspect is the effect?

original: gang phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gang phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: rnam pa ni rang las tha dad pa med pas don rig par sgro btags pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa ni rang las tha dad pa med pas don rig par sgro btags pa ma yin te /
translated: The aspect is not superimposed as the cognition of the object because it is not different from itself.

original: 'on kyang rang nyid kyi rjes su mthun pa nges pas tha dad par rnam par 'jog par byed kyi 'dzin pa'i rnam pa ni ma yin te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang nyid kyi rjes su mthun pa nges pas tha dad par rnam par 'jog par byed kyi 'dzin pa'i rnam pa ni ma yin te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: However, it is posited as different by the ascertainment of what is concordant with itself, but not by the aspect of the apprehender, because there is no difference.

original: don gyi bdag nyid ni rnam pa'o //
analyzed: don gyi bdag nyid ni rnam pa'o //
translated: The nature of the object is the aspect.

original: gnas pa ni nye ba'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni nye ba'o //
translated: Abiding is near.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba rnam pa ni tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba rnam pa ni tshad ma yin la /
translated: This is the definition of valid knowledge.üîΩThe object is the effect, not the self-awareness.

original: don des pa ni 'bras bu yin gyi rang nyid kyi rig pa ni ma yin pa yin nam zhes zer ba la bdag nyid rig pa yin zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid rig pa las te /
analyzed: don des pa ni 'bras bu yin gyi rang nyid kyi rig pa ni ma yin pa yin nam zhes zer ba la bdag nyid rig pa yin zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid rig pa las te /
translated: The response is, It is self-awareness. It is from self-awareness.

original: rig pa ma yin pa la nges pa'i mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rig pa ma yin pa la nges pa'i mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is unreasonable for non-awareness to be ascertained.

original: rnam pa'i bdag nyid rigs pa na don rig pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa'i bdag nyid rigs pa na don rig pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When the nature of the aspect is reasonable, there is no other awareness of the object.

original: 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is the effect.

original: de bstan pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bstan pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
translated: The explanation of that is for that reason.

original: don dang shes pa dang de dag dang 'brel pa can gyi blo ni ma yin te nyams su myong ba ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: don dang shes pa dang de dag dang 'brel pa can gyi blo ni ma yin te nyams su myong ba ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The cognition that is related to the object and consciousness is not the experience. To explain that, it says:

original: don bdag snang ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don bdag snang ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The object does not appear as itself.

original: phyi rol ni rjes su dpag pa las bzhin du mngon sum la yang snang bzhin pa ma yin pa nyid yul du 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhes zer ba la gang gi phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: phyi rol ni rjes su dpag pa las bzhin du mngon sum la yang snang bzhin pa ma yin pa nyid yul du 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhes zer ba la gang gi phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To respond to this, he says, ‚Äúbecause‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: mngon sum gyi yul nyid ni ngo bor snang ba yin gyi gzhan zhig gzhan du nges pa ni ma yin te de sngon du 'gro ba can nyid kyis de nyid gtso bo yin zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩrang gi ngo bo ni phyi @161a * //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi yul nyid ni ngo bor snang ba yin gyi gzhan zhig gzhan du nges pa ni ma yin te de sngon du 'gro ba can nyid kyis de nyid gtso bo yin zhes bya ba'i don to // rang gi ngo bo ni phyi @161a * //
translated: The object of perception is the appearance of an entity, not something else that is determined as something else. Since that is the basis, it is the primary factor.

original: rol ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rol ma yin pa'o //
translated: The nature of something is not external.

original: rang rig pa ni rang gi ngo bo rig pa ste /
analyzed: rang rig pa ni rang gi ngo bo rig pa ste /
translated: Self-awareness is the awareness of one‚Äôs own nature.

original: mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni thabs yin pa dang dang por rig par khas blangs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni thabs yin pa dang dang por rig par khas blangs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not accepted that the reason is that it is not direct perception.

original: rang rig pa ni don rnam par nges pas rnam par nges pa'i yang rgyu mtshan ni rnam pa yin la /
analyzed: rang rig pa ni don rnam par nges pas rnam par nges pa'i yang rgyu mtshan ni rnam pa yin la /
translated: Self-awareness is the cause of ascertainment because it ascertains the object. The aspect is the reason for ascertainment.

original: don rig pa'i yang nges par byed pa'i nges par byed pa gcig pa nyid du sgro btags pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: don rig pa'i yang nges par byed pa'i nges par byed pa gcig pa nyid du sgro btags pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement that the ascertainment of the object is also the same as the ascertainment of self-awareness is a superimposition.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa'i ste nges pa don du sgro btags pa'i'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa'i ste nges pa don du sgro btags pa'i'o //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to self-awareness, which is a superimposition on the definitive meaning.

original: blo la ni gnas don zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: blo la ni gnas don zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú The object that appears to the mind‚Äù is the aspect of self-awareness.

original: sgrub byed ni nges pa can gyi nges pa sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: sgrub byed ni nges pa can gyi nges pa sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: ‚Äú Proof‚Äù is because it establishes the ascertainment of the object.

original: ; de nyid kyi phyir bya ba nyid ni dbang po las 'das pa'i bya ba dang / de'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'i rtog pa ni tshad ma dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ; de nyid kyi phyir bya ba nyid ni dbang po las 'das pa'i bya ba dang / de'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'i rtog pa ni tshad ma dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the idea of the activity of the sense faculty, the result of that, and so on is valid cognition.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni de'i zhes bya ba'i bshad pa'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni de'i zhes bya ba'i bshad pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Thus‚Äù refers to the explanation of ‚Äúthat.‚Äù

original: rnam pas byas pa'i rig pas rnam pa gzhan mi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pas byas pa'i rig pas rnam pa gzhan mi gnas pa ste /
translated: The awareness produced by the aspect does not abide in another aspect.

original: nges par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhes zer ba la ji ltar don de ni gnas pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nges par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhes zer ba la ji ltar don de ni gnas pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it definite?

original: rang rig pa'i dus kyi rnam pa yin la de bzhin du don nye ba'i dus na yang gsal bas nges pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba de nyid bshad pa ni de'i rang bzhin du zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i dus kyi rnam pa yin la de bzhin du don nye ba'i dus na yang gsal bas nges pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba de nyid bshad pa ni de'i rang bzhin du zhes bya'o //
translated: The aspect at the time of self-cognition is also clear at the time of the object's proximity, so it is not ascertained. This is explained by its nature.

original: don nye ba'i dus na yang rnam pa yongs su 'dor na don ji ltar rig pa yin zhes zer ba la de'i bdag nyid phyir te /
analyzed: don nye ba'i dus na yang rnam pa yongs su 'dor na don ji ltar rig pa yin zhes zer ba la de'i bdag nyid phyir te /
translated: If the aspect is completely abandoned at the time of the object's proximity, how is the object cognized? It is said: because of its identity.

original: rnam pa'i ngo bos don gnas pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa'i ngo bos don gnas pa ste /
translated: The object abides by the nature of the aspect.

original: rnam par 'jog pa'am tha snyad las so zhes bya ba yang ngo //
analyzed: rnam par 'jog pa'am tha snyad las so zhes bya ba yang ngo //
translated: Or it is from the establishment or convention of the aspect.

original: de lta na 'o na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i 'brel pa yang yul gyi dbye ba dang de'i lan gyi sgo nas de lta bu yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o//
analyzed: de lta na 'o na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i 'brel pa yang yul gyi dbye ba dang de'i lan gyi sgo nas de lta bu yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o//
translated: If so, then... and so on is connected. The reply is: It is like that. This is the opponent's position.

original: rang rig yang zhes bya ba ni nye ba'i dus na yang rang gi rnam pa tsam yul yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang rig yang zhes bya ba ni nye ba'i dus na yang rang gi rnam pa tsam yul yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Self-cognition... and so on. At the time of proximity, the object is merely one's own aspect.

original: don rig pa yin te rnam pa'i rig pa ji lta ba bzhin du don khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don rig pa yin te rnam pa'i rig pa ji lta ba bzhin du don khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the awareness of the object, because the object is accepted in the same way as the form.

original: gnyi ga yang zhes bya ba ni tshad ma dang 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang zhes bya ba ni tshad ma dang 'bras bu'o //
translated: Both means both the valid cognition and the result.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni phyi rol dang don dam pa las yang de dag gi yul tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni phyi rol dang don dam pa las yang de dag gi yul tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The same means that their objects are not different, because the external and the ultimate are the same.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rig pa ji lta ba bzhin du phyi rol gnas pa'i phyir yul tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rig pa ji lta ba bzhin du phyi rol gnas pa'i phyir yul tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the objects are not different, because the external exists in the same way as the awareness.

original: de lta na phyi rol nyid du bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na phyi rol nyid du bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If it is so, then because it is the external itself,üîΩit is the awareness of the external. What is the use of the awareness of itself?

original: phyi rol rig pa nyid yin na rang rig pas ci zhig bya zhes zer ba la rang rig ces bya ba ste nye ba'i dus na'o //
analyzed: phyi rol rig pa nyid yin na rang rig pas ci zhig bya zhes zer ba la rang rig ces bya ba ste nye ba'i dus na'o //
translated: The awareness of itself is at the time of proximity.

original: gang las @161b she na de'i bdag nyid phyir te /
analyzed: gang las @161b she na de'i bdag nyid phyir te /
translated: Why? Because of its identity.

original: rnam pa ji lta ba bzhin du rang rig pa ni don rig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa ji lta ba bzhin du rang rig pa ni don rig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The awareness of the object is because of the awareness of itself in the same way as the form.

original: don rig pa de'i bdag nyid kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don rig pa de'i bdag nyid kyis ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not because of the identity of the awareness of the object.

original: rang rig pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir 'di ltar don bdag snang ba yin zhes bya ba 'gal ba'i phyir shes pa'i rig pa kho na don gyi rig pa ma yin te gzhan nyid yin na gzhan du mi 'thad pa yang de med na ni ji ltar yin
analyzed: rang rig pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir 'di ltar don bdag snang ba yin zhes bya ba 'gal ba'i phyir shes pa'i rig pa kho na don gyi rig pa ma yin te gzhan nyid yin na gzhan du mi 'thad pa yang de med na ni ji ltar yin
translated: If they were not different, how could they be different?

original: / yod na ni rtogs pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
analyzed: / yod na ni rtogs pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
translated: If they were different, it would be only a realization. This is the opponent‚Äôs argument.

original: don dam pa na zhes bya ba'i 'grel pa ni don rig pa de'i bdag nyid dang rang rig pa'i tshad ma nyid dang don gyi yul nyid med pa rnams bstan pa yin no //üîΩbdag nyid dang cig shos rig pa nyid kyis nges pa dang cig shos dag tu 'gal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa na zhes bya ba'i 'grel pa ni don rig pa de'i bdag nyid dang rang rig pa'i tshad ma nyid dang don gyi yul nyid med pa rnams bstan pa yin no // bdag nyid dang cig shos rig pa nyid kyis nges pa dang cig shos dag tu 'gal ba ma yin te /
translated: The commentary on the line ‚Äúultimately‚Äù explains that the self-awareness of the object, the valid knowledge of reflexive awareness, and the object-field are all nonexistent.üîΩIt is not contradictory that the self and other are known by the self and other because the distinction of consciousness and nonconsciousness is made in terms of otherness.

original: shes pa dang shes pa ma yin pa nyid gzhan du rnam par dbye ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni gal te na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa dang shes pa ma yin pa nyid gzhan du rnam par dbye ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni gal te na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught in the line ‚ÄúIf they were different.‚Äù

original: sngon po'i rnam pa'i shes pa'i gnyug ma nyid yin na ser po la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyid mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba ni rnam pa du ma can zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sngon po'i rnam pa'i shes pa'i gnyug ma nyid yin na ser po la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyid mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba ni rnam pa du ma can zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If it were the intrinsic reality of a consciousness with the aspect of blue, it would not become the aspect of yellow, etc.

original: bag chags sna tshogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag chags sna tshogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called ‚Äúhaving many aspects‚Äù because it has various latent impressions.

original: rnam pa'i bdag nyid rig pas don no zhes nges pa yin yang don gzhal bya nyid ji ltar yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa'i bdag nyid rig pas don no zhes nges pa yin yang don gzhal bya nyid ji ltar yin te /
translated: Even though it is ascertained that the object is known by the aspect, how can the object be the object of comprehension?

original: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'i dgos pa'i don no//
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'i dgos pa'i don no//
translated: Because there is no relation. This is the purpose of the opponent‚Äôs objection.

original: don no zhes nges par rig par byed pa'i shes pa ni don gyi 'bras bu yin par bstan pa ni de ltar snang ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: don no zhes nges par rig par byed pa'i shes pa ni don gyi 'bras bu yin par bstan pa ni de ltar snang ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The statement that the consciousness that ascertains the object is the effect of the object teaches that the object is the cause of the consciousness.

original: sngon po la sogs pa rnam pa nyid kyi don no zhes pa nyid kyi phyir 'dzin par byed pa nyid bzhin du 'bras bu nyid kyang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa rnam pa nyid kyi don no zhes pa nyid kyi phyir 'dzin par byed pa nyid bzhin du 'bras bu nyid kyang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that just as the aspect is the apprehender of the object, it is also the effect of the object, because it is the aspect of the object, such as blue.

original: don yang ngo zhes bya ba 'di yang rtsa ba nyid ma yin te ;
analyzed: don yang ngo zhes bya ba 'di yang rtsa ba nyid ma yin te ;
translated: The object is also the cause of the aspect.

original: nges par rnam par 'jog par mi byed pa'i phyir nges par gzung ba'i don ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: nges par rnam par 'jog par mi byed pa'i phyir nges par gzung ba'i don ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúnot ascertained‚Äù is taught because it does not definitely posit.

original: gal te yang zhes bya ba ste /üîΩdon tsam la nges pa yin gyi khyad par la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don te //
analyzed: gal te yang zhes bya ba ste / don tsam la nges pa yin gyi khyad par la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don te //
translated: ‚Äú Even though‚Äù is said.üîΩThe meaning is that there is ascertainment of mere object, but not of the particular.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äújust like the particular‚Äù is that ascertainment of mere object does not definitely posit.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äújust like the particular‚Äù is that ascertainment of mere object does not definitely posit.

analyzed: don rgyu yin no zhes bya bar mi 'dzin pa ni don 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äújust like the particular‚Äù is that ascertainment of mere object does not definitely posit.

translated: The meaning of ‚Äújust like

original: bden zhes bya ba ni bag chags tsam las byung ba nyid do /
analyzed: bden zhes bya ba ni bag chags tsam las byung ba nyid do /
translated: ‚ÄúTrue‚Äù means that it arises from mere latent impressions.

original: khas blangs ba sgrub par byed pa ni don nye bar gnas pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khas blangs ba sgrub par byed pa ni don nye bar gnas pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The proof of the assertion is ‚Äúbecause the object is present.‚Äù

original: de zhes bya ba ni nye ba'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni nye ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù means the object.

original: 'dzin pa ma yin pa ni 'dzin byed ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa ma yin pa ni 'dzin byed ma yin pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúNot apprehended‚Äù means not apprehended by the apprehender.
