analyzed: de'i yul nyid ma yin na der snang ba ni bag chags las byung ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If it is not the object of that, the appearance as that arises from latent impressions. This is the meaning.

original: yul zhes bya ba dngos po las gzhan med de /üîΩyul la yang yul gzhan du thal par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ba na yul gzhan du mthong ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul zhes bya ba dngos po las gzhan med de / yul la yang yul gzhan du thal par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ba na yul gzhan du mthong ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: There is no object that is different from the thing.üîΩBecause it would follow that the object would also be an object of another object.

original: de'i dus nyid ni med pa'i bag chags las byung ba yin par bstan pa ni yul gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i dus nyid ni med pa'i bag chags las byung ba yin par bstan pa ni yul gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When it is said that ‚Äúthe object is seen as different,‚Äù the time of that is taught to be the arising of latent impressions.

original: de'i dus nyid kyang dngos po las tha dad pa ma yin no zhes zer ba ni gang la yod pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i dus nyid kyang dngos po las tha dad pa ma yin no zhes zer ba ni gang la yod pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When it is said that ‚Äúthe time of that is not different from the thing,‚Äù it is said that ‚Äúwhere it exists.‚Äù

original: yul dang dus kyi nges pa med na dngos po zhes bya ba med par bstan pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul dang dus kyi nges pa med na dngos po zhes bya ba med par bstan pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If there is no determination of place and time, there is no entity. This is shown by ‚ÄúIf it were.

original: gang na yang ni yul la'am dus la'o //üîΩyul la sogs pa rnam par ma bcad pa'i dngos po yod pa yin te /
analyzed: gang na yang ni yul la'am dus la'o // yul la sogs pa rnam par ma bcad pa'i dngos po yod pa yin te /
translated: ‚Äù Anywhere means in place or time.üîΩAn entity is not delimited in place and so on, because it produces the effect of appearance.üîΩIf it is said that it is because of the production of the effect of appearance, then it is necessary to say that it is not seen, because it is not seen in a place or time.üîΩBut if it is said that it is not seen because it is not seen in a place or time, then it is necessary to say that it is not seen in a place or time, because it is not seen in a place or time.

original: rang nyid kyis mthong ba nyid du khyad par med pas thams cad la thams cad snang bar 'gyur bar bstan pa ni ma mthong bar yang zhes bya ba ste don thams cad ces bya bar sbyar ro //üîΩthams cad ni skyes bu ste /

original: yul la sogs pa shes pa'i lhan cig byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yul la sogs pa shes pa'i lhan cig byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the object, etc. are not the cooperating conditions of consciousness.

original: gnas skabs kyi khyad par yin zer ba ni rab rib la sogs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi khyad par yin zer ba ni rab rib la sogs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The one who says that it is a special state is the one who says that it is like the eye with cataracts, etc.

original: de nyid ni mthong ba nyid ces bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de nyid ni mthong ba nyid ces bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: That itself is connected with ‚Äúis seen.‚Äù

original: snang bas zhes bya ba ni mthong bas zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: snang bas zhes bya ba ni mthong bas zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the light‚Äù is connected with ‚Äúis seen.‚Äù

original: 'di nyid ces bya ba ni rab rib can gyis mthong bas so //
analyzed: 'di nyid ces bya ba ni rab rib can gyis mthong bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúThis itself‚Äù is connected with ‚Äúis seen by one with cataracts.‚Äù

original: gnyi ga la yang zhes bya ba ni rung ba'i yul na gnas pa ma gtogs par ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i rgol ba po dag ni nus pa ma gtogs par ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang zhes bya ba ni rung ba'i yul na gnas pa ma gtogs par ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i rgol ba po dag ni nus pa ma gtogs par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn both cases‚Äù is connected with ‚Äúis not seen except by one who is in the right place,‚Äù and ‚Äúis not seen except by one who is capable.‚Äù

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni snang bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni snang bzhin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat itself‚Äù is connected with ‚Äúis seen.‚Äù

original: don nyid ces bya ba ni don byed par nus pa nyid do //
analyzed: don nyid ces bya ba ni don byed par nus pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúThe object‚Äù is connected with ‚Äúis capable of effective action.‚Äù

original: de lta bur gyur pa ni don byed pas nus pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa ni don byed pas nus pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSuch‚Äù is connected with ‚Äúis capable of effective action.‚Äù

original: thams cad de ltar zhes bya ba ni nus par mngon par 'dod pa yang @162b ngo /
analyzed: thams cad de ltar zhes bya ba ni nus par mngon par 'dod pa yang @162b ngo /
translated: ‚ÄúAll‚Äù is connected with ‚Äúis capable of effective action.‚Äù

original: nus pas don nyid yin pa ni shes pa nyid la yang 'gal ba med la /
analyzed: nus pas don nyid yin pa ni shes pa nyid la yang 'gal ba med la /
translated: And it is not contradictory that the object itself is the cognition, because of the possibility of that.

original: gzung ba nyid kyi don nyid yin na rab rib las byung ba la yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzung ba nyid kyi don nyid yin na rab rib las byung ba la yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And if the object itself is the apprehended, then it would be so even in the case of the appearance of floaters.

original: de nyid du yod pa las gnod par bya ba nyid dam slu ba nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid du yod pa las gnod par bya ba nyid dam slu ba nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is not that it is not harmed or deceived by existing in reality,

original: de nyid kyi tshe mi slu ba'i phyir phyis de med pa ni de nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe mi slu ba'i phyir phyis de med pa ni de nyid ma yin no //
translated: because it is not deceptive at that time. Later, when it does not exist, it is not real.

original: des na thams cad mtshungs pa'am cig shos kyang rung ba yin te /
analyzed: des na thams cad mtshungs pa'am cig shos kyang rung ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, everything is the same, or the other is also.

original: skyes nas zhig pa ni rgyun gyi rgyu med pa yin gyi med pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes nas zhig pa ni rgyun gyi rgyu med pa yin gyi med pas ni ma yin te /
translated: The destruction of what has arisen is the absence of the cause of the continuum, not nonexistence,

original: yod pa ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because existence has the characteristic of being perceived.

original: 'di de lta bu ma yin zhes bya ba yang de'i rang gi ngo bor rtog pa tsam ni 'gal ba can ma yin te de ltar brjod kyang de las ma 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di de lta bu ma yin zhes bya ba yang de'i rang gi ngo bor rtog pa tsam ni 'gal ba can ma yin te de ltar brjod kyang de las ma 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is not like that. The mere conception of its own nature is not contradictory, because even though it is expressed in that way, it does not go beyond that.

original: 'jug pa med kyang de de lta bu kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'jug pa med kyang de de lta bu kho na yin te /
translated: Even without engagement, it is just like that.

original: de yang don du gnyer ba'i dgos pa las de'i ngo bo dang cig shos kyis byas pa'i tshad ma dang cig shos nyid ni shes pa nyid la yang yin no zhes bstan pa ni mthong ba pa ma gtogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang don du gnyer ba'i dgos pa las de'i ngo bo dang cig shos kyis byas pa'i tshad ma dang cig shos nyid ni shes pa nyid la yang yin no zhes bstan pa ni mthong ba pa ma gtogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Moreover, the necessity of the object of desire is taught by the other, which is the valid cognition produced by its own nature, and the other itself is also the cognition. This is taught by ‚Äúexcept for the seen.‚Äù

original: khyad par ni rab rib las gzhan pa las so //
analyzed: khyad par ni rab rib las gzhan pa las so //
translated: The distinction is from that which is other than the cataract.

original: gzhan gyis bya ba ni mi gzhan gyis te sogs pa zhes bya ba ni mi snang ba yang thun mong ba dang cig shos nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bya ba ni mi gzhan gyis te sogs pa zhes bya ba ni mi snang ba yang thun mong ba dang cig shos nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The other‚Äôs action is by another person. The ‚Äúetc.‚Äù means that the commonality and the other itself are also not seen.

original: dang po dang gzung ba la yod pa dang / med par the tshom za ba ni phrad pa'i shes pa la yang mtshungs te /
analyzed: dang po dang gzung ba la yod pa dang / med par the tshom za ba ni phrad pa'i shes pa la yang mtshungs te /
translated: The doubt about the first and the existence and nonexistence of the object is the same in the cognition of contact.

original: khyad par ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because the distinction is not seen, this is taught by ‚Äújust as.‚Äù

original: rang nyid las zhes bya ba ni mthong ba nyid the tshom za ba'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid las zhes bya ba ni mthong ba nyid the tshom za ba'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom itself‚Äù is the antidote to the doubt about the seeing itself.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni rab rib las byung ba la yang mthong ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni rab rib las byung ba la yang mthong ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúEverything‚Äù means that even in the case of an eye disease, there is seeing.üîΩBecause it is seen that even in the case of a cognition with a definite object, there is the cognition of a nonexistent object, the same consequence applies to the other case.

original: de ni 'di ltar nges pa'i yul can la yang med pa'i yul can nyid du mthong ba'i phyir cig shos la yang de nyid du thal bar byed pa dang / rgyu'i skyon shes pas brdzun pa nyid dang / skyon med pa'i shes pas kyang yang dag pa nyid dang /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar nges pa'i yul can la yang med pa'i yul can nyid du mthong ba'i phyir cig shos la yang de nyid du thal bar byed pa dang / rgyu'i skyon shes pas brdzun pa nyid dang / skyon med pa'i shes pas kyang yang dag pa nyid dang /
translated: Because of the knowledge of the fault in the cause, there is falsity; and because of the faultless cognition, there is truth.

original: de lta'i rgyu'i skyon rnams las //
analyzed: de lta'i rgyu'i skyon rnams las //
translated: From such faults in the cause,

original: gang zhig gang la the tshom 'gyur //
analyzed: gang zhig gang la the tshom 'gyur //
translated: what is the doubt about what?

original: de nyid yod dam med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de nyid yod dam med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of the existence or nonexistence of that,

original: de la yang dag dang brdzun blo //
analyzed: de la yang dag dang brdzun blo //
translated: there is the cognition of truth or falsity.

original: zhes bya ba ni mi rigs par bstan pa ni 'on te rgyu ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mi rigs par bstan pa ni 'on te rgyu ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The statement of the irrationality is ‚ÄúIf the cause is pure, etc.‚Äù

original: de'i shes pa ni rgyu dag pa nyid kyis shes pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de'i shes pa ni rgyu dag pa nyid kyis shes pa yang ngo //
translated: The cognition of that is also cognition because of the purity of the cause.

original: phyi rol las skyes pa nyid shes par dka'o zhes bya ba 'thad par byas nas bag chags las byung ba nyid shes par sla bar bstan pa ni bag @163a * //üîΩchags las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol las skyes pa nyid shes par dka'o zhes bya ba 'thad par byas nas bag chags las byung ba nyid shes par sla bar bstan pa ni bag @163a * // chags las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The latent impressions are the cause of the arising of consciousness.

original: rnam par gnas zhes bya ba ni chu ma mthong ba la chu'i nges pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par gnas zhes bya ba ni chu ma mthong ba la chu'i nges pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not possible for consciousness to arise without an object‚Äù means that consciousness does not arise without an object, because if water is not seen, the cognition of water does not occur.üîΩThe nondifferentiation of the object that is the effect of consciousness is not contradictory to the simultaneous apprehension of the object as determinate and indeterminate,üîΩbecause the apprehension of pleasure and pain, etc., is easy to establish as the apprehension of the differentiation of latent impressions.üîΩThe nondifferentiation of the object that is the effect of consciousness is not contradictory to the simultaneous apprehension of the object as determinate and indeterminate,üîΩbecause the apprehension of pleasure and pain, etc., is easy to establish as the apprehension of the differentiation of latent impressions.üîΩThe nondifferentiation of the object that is the effect of consciousness is not contradictory to the simultaneous apprehension of the object as determinate and indeterminate,üîΩbecause the apprehension of pleasure and pain, etc., is easy to establish as the apprehension of the differentiation of latent impressions.

original: shes pa can gyi bskyed bya nyid du nye bar len pa tha mi dad pa ni rnam par rtog pa dang cig shos dag nges pa med pa dang cig shos su 'dzin pa dag la cig car nye bar blang ba nyid du 'gal ba yang ma yin te
analyzed: shes pa can gyi bskyed bya nyid du nye bar len pa tha mi dad pa ni rnam par rtog pa dang cig shos dag nges pa med pa dang cig shos su 'dzin pa dag la cig car nye bar blang ba nyid du 'gal ba yang ma yin te
translated: The nondifferentiation of the object that is the effect of consciousness is not contradictory to the simultaneous apprehension of the object as determinate and indeterminate,üîΩbecause the apprehension of pleasure and pain, etc., is easy to establish as the apprehension of the differentiation of latent impressions.üîΩThe nondifferentiation of the object that is the effect of consciousness is not contradictory to the simultaneous apprehension of the object as determinate and indeterminate,

original: / bag chags kyi khyad par nye bar len pa'i phyir bde ba dang sdug bsngal lta bur len gdab par sla ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: / bag chags kyi khyad par nye bar len pa'i phyir bde ba dang sdug bsngal lta bur len gdab par sla ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: because the apprehension of pleasure and pain, etc., is easy to establish as the apprehension of the differentiation of latent impressions.

original: thog med 'brel pa yin par ni //
analyzed: thog med 'brel pa yin par ni //
translated: The nondifferentiation of the object that is the effect of consciousness is not contradictory to the simultaneous apprehension of the object as determinate and indeterminate,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because the apprehension of pleasure and pain, etc., is easy to establish as the apprehension of the differentiation of latent impressions.

original: bag chags dang 'brel pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bag chags dang 'brel pa ma yin te /
translated: The nondifferentiation of the object that is the effect of consciousness is not contradictory to the simultaneous apprehension of the object as determinate and indeterminate,üîΩbecause the apprehension of pleasure and pain, etc., is easy to establish as the apprehension of the differentiation of latent impressions.üîΩThe nondifferentiation of the object that is the effect of consciousness is not contradictory to the simultaneous apprehension of the object as determinate and indeterminate,üîΩbecause the apprehension of pleasure and pain, etc., is easy to establish as the apprehension of the differentiation of

original: rnam par rtog pa yang rang rig pa tsam nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yang rang rig pa tsam nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because conceptualization is just self-awareness.

original: rang bzhin las zhes bya ba ni gzhan yin na zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin las zhes bya ba ni gzhan yin na zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom its own nature‚Äù is connected with ‚Äúif it were different.‚Äù

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni bems po nyid kyis shes pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni bems po nyid kyis shes pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBy what‚Äù is connected with ‚Äúbecause it is insentient, it is not the object of consciousness.‚Äù

original: rang bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir 'brel pa med na des byas pa'i 'brel pa can med par bstan pa ni 'brel pa dang 'brel pa can dag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir 'brel pa med na des byas pa'i 'brel pa can med par bstan pa ni 'brel pa dang 'brel pa can dag ces bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom its own nature‚Äù is connected with ‚Äúbecause it is not different.‚Äù The connection is taught: ‚ÄúIf there is no connection, there is no connection that is produced by it.‚Äù

original: phyi rol gyi tshul la yang 'di las 'di skye'o zhes nges pa'i rten yod pa ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i khyad par dang bcas pa ni dus kyis byas pa yin yang rtog pa med na go ba ma yin par bstan pa ni bag chags dang 'brel pa
analyzed: phyi rol gyi tshul la yang 'di las 'di skye'o zhes nges pa'i rten yod pa ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i khyad par dang bcas pa ni dus kyis byas pa yin yang rtog pa med na go ba ma yin par bstan pa ni bag chags dang 'brel pa
translated: Even in the external mode, there is a basis for the ascertainment that ‚Äúthis arises from that.‚Äù Although time is made by the distinction between prior and posterior, if there is no conception, there is no understanding. The connection with latent impressions is taught:

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚Äúfrom the connection with latent impressions.‚Äù

original: sngar mthong ba'i bskyed bya nyid kho na bag chags kyi skyed byed nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sngar mthong ba'i bskyed bya nyid kho na bag chags kyi skyed byed nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the very thing that was seen previously is the producer of the latent impression.

original: dran pa med pa ni rnam par rtog pa med pa la rnam par rtog pa gzhan de nyid du rnam par 'jog pa yin par bstan pa ni de la yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dran pa med pa ni rnam par rtog pa med pa la rnam par rtog pa gzhan de nyid du rnam par 'jog pa yin par bstan pa ni de la yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The absence of memory is the absence of conceptualization. The other conceptualization is posited as that very thing. This is what is shown by ‚Äúin that case.‚Äù

original: de nyid 'dir zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'dir zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat very thing‚Äù here is a summary.

original: 'dzin pa ma yin na zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ma yin na zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is not apprehended‚Äù means if it is mere reflexive awareness.

original: phyi rol na yang 'bras bu la sogs pa de nyid de lta ma yin par bstan pa ni de lta yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol na yang 'bras bu la sogs pa de nyid de lta ma yin par bstan pa ni de lta yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is taught that external things such as effects are not like that. This is what is shown by ‚ÄúIf that were so.‚Äù

original: rnam par shes pa phyi rol gang gi 'bras bu yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa phyi rol gang gi 'bras bu yin pa'o //
translated: The consciousness is the effect of something external.

original: dngos po ni rnam par 'jog par byed pa rtog par byed pa yin yang rnam par rtog pa'i go bya yang 'bras bu'i dus las 'das pa bzhin du yun ring por 'das pa yang yin te rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po ni rnam par 'jog par byed pa rtog par byed pa yin yang rnam par rtog pa'i go bya yang 'bras bu'i dus las 'das pa bzhin du yun ring por 'das pa yang yin te rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Although a thing is a determiner and a conceiver, it is also a long time past, like the object of a past effect, because it is not a conceiver.

original: de'i nus pa yin yang dus 'das pas yod pa nyid yin yang de ma thag pa yang rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i nus pa yin yang dus 'das pas yod pa nyid yin yang de ma thag pa yang rgyu ma yin te /
translated: Although it is a potentiality, it is not an immediate condition, because it is past and exists,

original: 'bras @163b bu'i dus las 'das pa dang lhan cig yod pa dang ri bong gi rva lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'bras @163b bu'i dus las 'das pa dang lhan cig yod pa dang ri bong gi rva lta bu'o //
translated: like an effect that is past, like something that exists simultaneously, and like a rabbit‚Äôs horns.

original: yod kyang re zhig de'i tshe ma rtog pa de bzhin du de ma thag pa yang de nyid kho nas ma yin te /
analyzed: yod kyang re zhig de'i tshe ma rtog pa de bzhin du de ma thag pa yang de nyid kho nas ma yin te /
translated: Although it exists, it is not an immediate condition, because it is not conceived at that time, just as it is not conceived later.

original: 'o na ci zhe na de ltar rtogs pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na de ltar rtogs pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: What is it then? It is the cause of the conception of that.

original: de ni 'das nas yun ring ba la yang ngo //
analyzed: de ni 'das nas yun ring ba la yang ngo //
translated: It is also a long time past.

original: de la de ma thag pa de nyid gzhan gyi nus pa ma rtogs pa'i phyir de ma thag pa yang rgyud la gnas pas rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa'i go cha yin la 'das kyang rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de la de ma thag pa de nyid gzhan gyi nus pa ma rtogs pa'i phyir de ma thag pa yang rgyud la gnas pas rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa'i go cha yin la 'das kyang rgyu yin no //
translated: Because the immediately preceding condition itself does not realize the potency of another, it is the immediately preceding condition that exists in the continuum, and it is the cause even though past, because it is the basis for the subsequent connection.

original: rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa la gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa la gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: The statement ‚Äúbecause it is the cause‚Äù is not tenable, because

original: rtogs pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: realization is the same.

original: de la yang gal te nus na de'i tshe nyid byed par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la yang gal te nus na de'i tshe nyid byed par 'gyur la /
translated: If it is potent in that case, then it would be the agent.

original: mi nus pa nyid de lta na dus gzhan du yang byed par thal 'gyur mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: mi nus pa nyid de lta na dus gzhan du yang byed par thal 'gyur mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: If it is not potent, then it would follow that it is the agent at another time. The reason is the same.

original: gnas pa'i byed pa po nyid ma gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa'i byed pa po nyid ma gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not excluded that the agent is the state of endurance itself.

original: mtha'i skad cig la yang de'i ngo bo las ma 'das pa'i phyir skad cig gzhan dang gnas pa nyid kyi byed pa po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam mthar gnas pa ni dus de snyed ni snga ma la ltos pa na byed pa po nyid
analyzed: mtha'i skad cig la yang de'i ngo bo las ma 'das pa'i phyir skad cig gzhan dang gnas pa nyid kyi byed pa po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam mthar gnas pa ni dus de snyed ni snga ma la ltos pa na byed pa po nyid
translated: If it is not excluded that the state of endurance itself is the agent, then it would follow that the state of endurance itself is the agent in another moment, because it does not transcend its nature in the final moment.

original: ji ltar ma yin pa de las byung ba yang rtogs pa'i phyir rgyu med pa can nyid kyi skyon yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar ma yin pa de las byung ba yang rtogs pa'i phyir rgyu med pa can nyid kyi skyon yang ma yin no //
translated: and because it is understood that it arises from what is not so, there is no fault of causelessness.

original: de la yang de ma thag pa'i sngar byung ba dang / de nye bar byed pa zhes bya ba la yang rtogs pa ma yin pa dang / rigs pa yang mngon sum dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de la yang de ma thag pa'i sngar byung ba dang / de nye bar byed pa zhes bya ba la yang rtogs pa ma yin pa dang / rigs pa yang mngon sum dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: And there is no understanding of it as immediately preceding or as produced by that, and the reasoning contradicts perception.

original: phyi rol ni ma mthong ba nyid 'ba' zhig la rgyu ma yin pa ma yin gyi nges par byed pa ma yin pa las kyang ngo zhes bstan pa ni de bzhin du yul dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol ni ma mthong ba nyid 'ba' zhig la rgyu ma yin pa ma yin gyi nges par byed pa ma yin pa las kyang ngo zhes bstan pa ni de bzhin du yul dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not that external things are not causes just because they are not seen, but also because they are not determinative. This is shown by ‚ÄúIn the same way, with regard to the object . . .‚Äù

original: chu las chu dang chu ma yin pa chu shel gyi lhan cig pa'i zla ba'i 'od zer gyis phog pa'i rgyun las kyang ngo //
analyzed: chu las chu dang chu ma yin pa chu shel gyi lhan cig pa'i zla ba'i 'od zer gyis phog pa'i rgyun las kyang ngo //
translated: Also, from water, which is not water, by the rays of the moon shining on the water crystal.

original: chu nyid du chu de'i sa bon yin la /
analyzed: chu nyid du chu de'i sa bon yin la /
translated: Water is the seed of water.

original: ri dang nus pa la sogs pas tha dad pas rigs mi mthun pa nyid cig shos la yang yin te /
analyzed: ri dang nus pa la sogs pas tha dad pas rigs mi mthun pa nyid cig shos la yang yin te /
translated: But the other is of a different type, because of differences in place, capacity, etc.

original: yul re re zhing nang gi khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul re re zhing nang gi khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there are internal differences in each object.

original: de bzhin du ba las du ba dang du ba ma yin pa rdul lta bu shing gi cha las kyang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du ba las du ba dang du ba ma yin pa rdul lta bu shing gi cha las kyang ngo //
translated: Similarly, smoke arises from smoke and from what is not smoke, like dust from a piece of wood,üîΩand fire arises from fire and from what is not fire, like rubbing wood.

original: me las me dang me ma yin pa'i shing bsrubs pa las kyang ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa nges pa can ma yin pa'i rgyu nyid ni phyi rol gyi tshul la rgyu ma yin pa'i don to //
analyzed: me las me dang me ma yin pa'i shing bsrubs pa las kyang ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa nges pa can ma yin pa'i rgyu nyid ni phyi rol gyi tshul la rgyu ma yin pa'i don to //
translated: The external mode is that the cause is not the object.üîΩBut in the internal mode, smoke arises from smoke and from its latent impressions.

original: shes pa'i tshul las ni du ba ni du ba las dang de'i bag chags las kyang 'byung na du ba nyid las yin te /üîΩ'das pa'i dmigs pa can gyi du @164a * //
analyzed: shes pa'i tshul las ni du ba ni du ba las dang de'i bag chags las kyang 'byung na du ba nyid las yin te / 'das pa'i dmigs pa can gyi du @164a * //
translated: It arises from smoke itself,üîΩbecause the past object that possesses smoke is the latent impression that has the name.üîΩTherefore, it arises from smoke or from what is not smoke, like its latent impression.

original: ba nyid kho na bag chags kyi ming can yin pa'i phyir du ba las kyang 'byung ba'am du ba ma yin pa las bzhin du de'i bag chags nyid des sad pa las zhes bya ba nges pa yin par bstan pa ni rig pa'i phyogs la ni zhes bya
analyzed: ba nyid kho na bag chags kyi ming can yin pa'i phyir du ba las kyang 'byung ba'am du ba ma yin pa las bzhin du de'i bag chags nyid des sad pa las zhes bya ba nges pa yin par bstan pa ni rig pa'i phyogs la ni zhes bya
translated: The teaching that this is the ascertainment is ‚ÄúIn the position of awareness. . . . ‚Äù

original: ba'o // chur snang ba yang ni bden par mngon par 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: ba'o // chur snang ba yang ni bden par mngon par 'dod pa ste /
translated: The appearance of water is also held to be real.

original: sprang bu'i tshogs la du ba lta bur dang / smig rgyu la chu lta bur 'di dag sngar de'i dmigs pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sprang bu'i tshogs la du ba lta bur dang / smig rgyu la chu lta bur 'di dag sngar de'i dmigs pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Like a mass of smoke for a group of bees, and like water for a mirage, these arise from the object of that prior cognition.

original: phyi rol nyid ces bya ba ni phyi rol du zhen pa'i yul nyid du 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol nyid ces bya ba ni phyi rol du zhen pa'i yul nyid du 'dod pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúExternal‚Äù means that it is held to be an object that is clung to as external.

original: de bstan pa ni phyi rol 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bstan pa ni phyi rol 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is taught by ‚Äúthis external world.‚Äù

original: ming tsam zhes bya ba rig pa'i bdag nyid kyis shes pa yin pa'i phyir tshang bar du du ba me'i bskyed bya nyid yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ming tsam zhes bya ba rig pa'i bdag nyid kyis shes pa yin pa'i phyir tshang bar du du ba me'i bskyed bya nyid yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMere name‚Äù is known by the nature of cognition, like smoke is the effect of fire.

original: bag chags kyi 'bras bu nyid ni snang ba'o //
analyzed: bag chags kyi 'bras bu nyid ni snang ba'o //
translated: The effect of the latent impressions is the appearance.

original: shes pa nyid yin par bstan pa ni rgan pos zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa nyid yin par bstan pa ni rgan pos zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching of being mere cognition is ‚Äúthe old man.‚Äù

original: bag chags kyi stobs las kyang sngar nyams su myong ba'i phyir rol nyid nyams su myong bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: bag chags kyi stobs las kyang sngar nyams su myong ba'i phyir rol nyid nyams su myong bar byed pa yin te /
translated: Also, due to the power of the latent impressions, the external object that was previously experienced is experienced.

original: nyams su myong ba las gzhan ma gtogs pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa ni de'i phyir zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba las gzhan ma gtogs pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa ni de'i phyir zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Because it is nothing but an experience, it is taught that ‚Äúfor that reason.üîΩ‚Äù ‚Äú

original: phyi rol nyid ces bya ba ni bcos ma'i dpe ni lta bu'o //
analyzed: phyi rol nyid ces bya ba ni bcos ma'i dpe ni lta bu'o //
translated: External‚Äù means that the example is fabricated.

original: bag chags las byung ba'i rnam shes yul gcig nyid du rmi lam mthong ba rnams kyi thun mong ba mthong ba ni /
analyzed: bag chags las byung ba'i rnam shes yul gcig nyid du rmi lam mthong ba rnams kyi thun mong ba mthong ba ni /
translated: The consciousness that arises from latent impressions, which is the common experience of seeing the same object in a dream,

original: yul rung can gyis mi shes pas //
analyzed: yul rung can gyis mi shes pas //
translated: is not known by those who are not in the right place.

original: rang gis shes phyir de shes yin //
analyzed: rang gis shes phyir de shes yin //
translated: Because it is known by oneself, it is known by that.

original: zhes bya ba bstan pa ni thog med ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba bstan pa ni thog med ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by ‚Äúbeginningless.

original: 'bras bu nyid bag chags las byung ba nyid kyis khyab pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid bag chags las byung ba nyid kyis khyab pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: ‚Äù It is taught that the result itself is pervaded by arising from latent impressions.

original: 'bras bu yin phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu yin phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because it is a result.

original: rmi lam mthong ba yang de yin la 'bras bu yang de yin pa'o //
analyzed: rmi lam mthong ba yang de yin la 'bras bu yang de yin pa'o //
translated: It is a seeing of a dream and it is a result.

original: gtso bo dang dbang phyug la sogs pa ni bag chags ma gtogs par mthong ba'i yul med par bstan pa ni gtso bo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gtso bo dang dbang phyug la sogs pa ni bag chags ma gtogs par mthong ba'i yul med par bstan pa ni gtso bo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is taught that the principal, ƒ™≈õvara, and so on do not have an object of seeing that is separate from latent impressions.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni dus la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni dus la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAnd so on‚Äù refers to time and so on.

original: pha rol pa'i lhag ma ni tshad mas ma grub pa'i phyir rtog pa dang ldan pa la gsha' ma ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol pa'i lhag ma ni tshad mas ma grub pa'i phyir rtog pa dang ldan pa la gsha' ma ma yin pa ste /
translated: The remainder of the opponent‚Äôs argument is not correct because it is not established by valid cognition.

original: 'bras bu'i 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni de lta min na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni de lta min na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The demonstration of the contradiction with the effect is ‚ÄúIf that were not so. . . . ‚Äù

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod par bstan pa ni rang dbang du zhes bya ba'o //üîΩlung phogs pa las de yang rtogs pa yin par zer ba ni /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod par bstan pa ni rang dbang du zhes bya ba'o // lung phogs pa las de yang rtogs pa yin par zer ba ni /
translated: The demonstration of the harm to the discordant side is ‚ÄúIf it were autonomous. . . . ‚Äù

original: lung dpog byed pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lung dpog byed pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that it is also understood from the scriptures is ‚ÄúIf the scriptures were authoritative. . . . ‚Äù

original: legs pa'i don ni dogs pa 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: legs pa'i don ni dogs pa 'byung ba'o //
translated: The good meaning is the arising of doubt.üîΩFrom which scripture does he derive that?

original: gang gi lung 'phyogs pa gang las de de lta bu de'i @164b mi sdug pa ste gsha' ma ma yin pa byed pa can gyi las yin la de las skyes pa yin par khas blangs pas de byed pa can las kyi sgo nas phyin ci log tu byed
analyzed: gang gi lung 'phyogs pa gang las de de lta bu de'i @164b mi sdug pa ste gsha' ma ma yin pa byed pa can gyi las yin la de las skyes pa yin par khas blangs pas de byed pa can las kyi sgo nas phyin ci log tu byed
translated: That is an action that is not good, that is, not correct, for him, and he accepts that it arises from that action. Therefore, from the perspective of action, he acts in a way that is contrary to that.

original: pa yang rtog pa dang mi ldan pa nyid la nges pa yin par bstan pa ni ci rung bar ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: pa yang rtog pa dang mi ldan pa nyid la nges pa yin par bstan pa ni ci rung bar ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is not tenable to teach that the absence of conceptualization is certainty.

original: gzha' ma nyid ni dngos su rig pa yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzha' ma nyid ni dngos su rig pa yin pa'o //
translated: The actual knowledge of a rainbow is

original: gzhan du ni 'di la dngos su'am rgyud pas kyang bag chags lhan cig byed pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: gzhan du ni 'di la dngos su'am rgyud pas kyang bag chags lhan cig byed pa nyid yin na /
translated: If it is a cause in another way, either directly or indirectly, then the latent impressions are co-operating causes.

original: de nyid gtso bor 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid gtso bor 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The point is that they are the primary cause.

original: bag chags stobs las byung ba zhes bya ba'o //üîΩsngar byung ba'i shes pa la brten nas phyis 'byung ba rjes su 'gro ba'i rjes su byed pa ni bag chags zhes brjod kyi lhan cig byung ba tsam las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bag chags stobs las byung ba zhes bya ba'o // sngar byung ba'i shes pa la brten nas phyis 'byung ba rjes su 'gro ba'i rjes su byed pa ni bag chags zhes brjod kyi lhan cig byung ba tsam las ni ma yin te /
translated: The latent impressions arise from the power of

original: phan mi 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan mi 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The latent impressions are said to arise in dependence on the prior consciousness and to follow after the subsequent consciousness. They are not merely co-arisen, because they do not benefit.

original: yod pa la ma gtogs pa ni byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa la ma gtogs pa ni byed pa ma yin te /
translated: They are not producers of what already exists.üîΩIf they were, it would follow that they are causes of that which does not exist.

original: de la yang de ma gtogs par rgyur thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni de ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la yang de ma gtogs par rgyur thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni de ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The point is that they are not.

original: zad pa min pa ni gnod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zad pa min pa ni gnod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which is not exhausted is not harmed.

original: skye dang 'jig pa mtshungs na yang //
analyzed: skye dang 'jig pa mtshungs na yang //
translated: Even though arising and destruction are similar,

original: phan tshun ltos pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: phan tshun ltos pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: because they are not mutually dependent,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin te //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin te //
translated: they are cause and effect.

original: de yi byed las mi phan phyir //
analyzed: de yi byed las mi phan phyir //
translated: Because their function is not helpful,

original: zhes bya bas bar ma chod par skyed par byed pa nyid mi rigs te gzugs kyis gzugs bzhin du snam bu la yang yin no snyam du sems pa sel ba ni rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rjes su byed pa can par du chod pa'i phyir ro
analyzed: zhes bya bas bar ma chod par skyed par byed pa nyid mi rigs te gzugs kyis gzugs bzhin du snam bu la yang yin no snyam du sems pa sel ba ni rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rjes su byed pa can par du chod pa'i phyir ro
translated: The idea that it is illogical that a cause generates its effect without interruption, just as form does with form, is eliminated by the statement, ‚ÄúBecause they are not mutually dependent.‚Äù

original: zhes dgongs pas so //üîΩde'i phyir / bum pa'i gzugs ni 'jig pa las //
analyzed: zhes dgongs pas so // de'i phyir / bum pa'i gzugs ni 'jig pa las //
translated: This is the intended meaning.üîΩTherefore,

original: dri la sogs pa skye bzhin pa //üîΩji ltar rgyur ni mi 'dod pa //
analyzed: dri la sogs pa skye bzhin pa // ji ltar rgyur ni mi 'dod pa //
translated: the arising of smell and so on from the destruction of the form of a vaseüîΩis not asserted to be a cause

original: ngo bo gzhan la 'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: ngo bo gzhan la 'ang de bzhin no //
translated: just as it is not for another entity.

original: zhes bya ba ni legs par smras pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni legs par smras pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not a good explanation.

original: bde la goms las bde 'byung ba //
analyzed: bde la goms las bde 'byung ba //
translated: Pleasure arises from habituation to pleasure,

original: dbang phyug bsnyen pas ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang phyug bsnyen pas ma yin no //
translated: not from propitiating ƒ™≈õvara.

original: zhes bstan pa ni legs pa'i thabs kyis te /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa ni legs pa'i thabs kyis te /
translated: This is taught by the method of the good,

original: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pas so //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pas so //
translated: by generosity, morality, and so on.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i rnam pa khas blangs pas don 'dzin pa yin no don zhig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i rnam pa khas blangs pas don 'dzin pa yin no don zhig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, since the aspect of consciousness is accepted, it is the apprehender of the object, because the object is destroyed.

original: de lta yin na khyod kyis rnam pa med pa la don 'dzin pa mi srid pa rnam pa dang 'brel par 'gyur ba ji ltar brjod ces zer ba la de'i bsam pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta yin na khyod kyis rnam pa med pa la don 'dzin pa mi srid pa rnam pa dang 'brel par 'gyur ba ji ltar brjod ces zer ba la de'i bsam pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If that is so, how can you say that the apprehension of the object by that which is devoid of aspect is impossible, and that it is related to the aspect?

original: shes pa don 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'i tshul yin la /
analyzed: shes pa don 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'i tshul yin la /
translated: Consciousness is the apprehender of the object is the ultimate mode.

original: rnam pa med na thams cad du 'dzin byed ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa med na thams cad du 'dzin byed ma yin te /
translated: If it is devoid of aspect, it is not the apprehender in all cases,

original: rnam pa med pa la 'brel pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrnam pa @165a * //
analyzed: rnam pa med pa la 'brel pa'i phyir ro // rnam pa @165a * //
translated: because it is related to the aspect.

original: dang bcas pa la yang don med pa yin la /
analyzed: dang bcas pa la yang don med pa yin la /
translated: If it has an aspect, it is meaningless.

original: shes pa don 'dzin par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni legs par byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa don 'dzin par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni legs par byas pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not correct to say that consciousness is the apprehender of the object.

original: tha snyad ces bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'am sgra la sogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: tha snyad ces bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'am sgra la sogs pa yang ngo //
translated: The term ‚Äúconventional‚Äù refers to conceptualization or sound, etc.

original: rnam par dbyer med ni thams cad rang rig pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par dbyer med ni thams cad rang rig pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúNon-differentiation‚Äù means that everything is mere self-awareness.

original: phyin ci log rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin te /
analyzed: phyin ci log rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúBy the inversions‚Äù means by the conceptualization of the inversions.

original: don ma yin pa'i rang gi snang ba la don du sgro 'dogs pas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don ma yin pa'i rang gi snang ba la don du sgro 'dogs pas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one engages in the appearance of what is not an object by superimposing the status of an object on it.

original: rtog pa med pa ni phyin ci log ma yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa med pa ni phyin ci log ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúNon-conceptual‚Äù means not inverted.

original: rang rig pa las 'khrul par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rig pa las 'khrul par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not reasonable that there be error in self-awareness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgra yin no //üîΩshes pa yin na rang gi'am gzhan gyi thun mong ma yin pa zhig na re zhig rang gi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgra yin no // shes pa yin na rang gi'am gzhan gyi thun mong ma yin pa zhig na re zhig rang gi ni ma yin te /
translated: For this very reason, there is the term ‚Äúlike.‚Äù

original: da med kyang gzhan la yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: da med kyang gzhan la yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is consciousness, it is either one‚Äôs own or another‚Äôs, or it is not common to either. It is not one‚Äôs own, because it exists for another even when it does not exist for oneself. This is demonstrated by the term ‚Äúanother.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not another‚Äôs,üîΩbecause it is not reasonable that another‚Äôs consciousness should appear to oneself.

original: de med kyang rang gis mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni 'di da ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de med kyang rang gis mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni 'di da ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúIf it is not seen by that, then it is seen by itself.‚Äù

original: gyur pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni med pa'o //
analyzed: gyur pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni med pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú It is not seen by that‚Äù means it does not exist.

original: gzhan gyis ji ltar zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa tsam gyi ngo bor thun mong yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ji ltar zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa tsam gyi ngo bor thun mong yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú How can it be seen by another?‚Äù means it is the same in being the nature of mere self-awareness.

original: de lta yin dang gzhan gyis mthong ba gang yin pa la sogs pa ni thun mong ma yin pa'i mtshungs pa dang cig shos kyi bag chags las byung ba yin la /
analyzed: de lta yin dang gzhan gyis mthong ba gang yin pa la sogs pa ni thun mong ma yin pa'i mtshungs pa dang cig shos kyi bag chags las byung ba yin la /
translated: If that were the case, then what is seen by another would arise from the imprints of the uncommon and the other.üîΩTherefore it says:

original: de phyir skyes nas 'jig pa la //
analyzed: de phyir skyes nas 'jig pa la //
translated: Since it arises and disintegrates,

original: skad cig ma yang rtsom pa med //
analyzed: skad cig ma yang rtsom pa med //
translated: it is momentary, and it does not arise again.

original: ces bya ba ni 'jig par mtshungs pa'i dus nyid kyis de'i rgyu nyid med pas gzhan du yod pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir mi rigs so //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni 'jig par mtshungs pa'i dus nyid kyis de'i rgyu nyid med pas gzhan du yod pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir mi rigs so //
translated: Since it is the same in disintegrating, it is not tenable that it is a cause because it does not exist at the time of the cause. It is a cause that exists at another time.

original: gang gi phyir dus mtshungs pa'i yod pa ni rang gi ngo bos cung zad kyang byed pa ma yin la 'byung ba 'ba' zhig ni med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir tshad ma'i rjes su 'brang ba rnams de tsam rgyu mtshan yin pa de'i 'bras bu nyid kha cig
analyzed: gang gi phyir dus mtshungs pa'i yod pa ni rang gi ngo bos cung zad kyang byed pa ma yin la 'byung ba 'ba' zhig ni med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir tshad ma'i rjes su 'brang ba rnams de tsam rgyu mtshan yin pa de'i 'bras bu nyid kha cig
translated: Because the existence of something simultaneous with itself does not cause the slightest thing, and because only the effect is the reason for the existence of the cause, since it does not occur without it.

original: tu go bar byed pa yin gyi thams cad du ni ma yin te tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tu go bar byed pa yin gyi thams cad du ni ma yin te tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Some people understand that the effect is the reason for the existence of the cause, but not all, because there is no valid cognition for that.

original: gzhan gyis mthong ba gang yin pa de ngas mthong ngo zhes bya ba la rjes su dpag par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba ni 'on te de yang ste gzhan yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan gyis mthong ba gang yin pa de ngas mthong ngo zhes bya ba la rjes su dpag par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba ni 'on te de yang ste gzhan yang ngo //
translated: If someone says, ‚ÄúWhatever is seen by another, I see that,‚Äù it would be inference.

original: bdag gis mthong ngo zhes bya ba de la gzhan gyis mthong ba gang yin pa de rjes su sbyar ro //
analyzed: bdag gis mthong ngo zhes bya ba de la gzhan gyis mthong ba gang yin pa de rjes su sbyar ro //
translated: In ‚ÄúI see that,‚Äù whatever is seen by another is applied.

original: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni mngon sum med na de mngon du 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni mngon sum med na de mngon du 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If that is so, because without direct perception there is no direct engagement,

original: de la med pa'i mngon sum yang /
analyzed: de la med pa'i mngon sum yang /
translated: direct perception of the absence of that

original: de yi 'bras bu la yod do //
analyzed: de yi 'bras bu la yod do //
translated: exists in its effect.

original: zhes zer ba ni 'bras bu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes zer ba ni 'bras bu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the result.

original: thal @165b ba ma yin pa'i phyir ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thal @165b ba ma yin pa'i phyir ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not a non-entity, because it is not non-existent.

original: spu lngar ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni snang ba'i dngos pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: spu lngar ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni snang ba'i dngos pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The five hairs and so on are the result of the entity of appearance.

original: gzhan ni gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni gzhan pa'o //
translated: The other is different.

original: mthong ba ni mngon sum gyis 'dres par 'gyur ba ste gcig nyid du de lta ma yin na gcig nyid du mngon sum gyis rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba ni mngon sum gyis 'dres par 'gyur ba ste gcig nyid du de lta ma yin na gcig nyid du mngon sum gyis rtogs pa'o //
translated: Seeing is the mixing of the direct perception, the understanding of oneness by direct perception, otherwise it would not be oneness.

original: ngo bo nyid ni dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo'o //
translated: The nature is the intrinsic nature of the entity.

original: mngon sum ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni yod bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni yod bzhin pa'o //
translated: Not direct perception means existing.

original: gzhan gyis mthong ba nyid ni snang ba'i rang bzhin yin pas snang ba bzhin du snang ba mi dmigs pa las ba ni rnam par rtag par bya ba'i bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis mthong ba nyid ni snang ba'i rang bzhin yin pas snang ba bzhin du snang ba mi dmigs pa las ba ni rnam par rtag par bya ba'i bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: The seeing of another is the nature of appearance, so like appearance, the non-apprehension of appearance is by the nature of the object of negation.

original: de med na nam zhes bya ba ni slar dri ba'o //
analyzed: de med na nam zhes bya ba ni slar dri ba'o //
translated: If that does not exist, then what? This is a counter-question.

original: snang ba mi dmigs pa la the tshom med par bstan pa ni de lta na ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba mi dmigs pa la the tshom med par bstan pa ni de lta na ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: To show that there is no doubt about the non-apprehension of appearance, it says If that is so, then...

original: yod do zhes bya ba ni sngar du ba tsam mthong ba na gzhan gyis mthong ba nyid la the tshom za ba yod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yod do zhes bya ba ni sngar du ba tsam mthong ba na gzhan gyis mthong ba nyid la the tshom za ba yod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word exists means that when one previously saw only smoke, one doubts whether another saw it.

original: ma mthong ba nyid bdag gis mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni tha snyad kho na yin no //
analyzed: ma mthong ba nyid bdag gis mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni tha snyad kho na yin no //
translated: The expression I see what is not seen is a mere convention.

original: lkog tu gyur pa la ni phyi rol la'o //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa la ni phyi rol la'o //
translated: The word elsewhere means outside.

original: gcig nyid la yang zhes bya ba ni phyi rol nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig nyid la yang zhes bya ba ni phyi rol nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word also means that there is no difference in the external.

original: ma yin no zhe na zhes bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo tsam la mthar thug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin no zhe na zhes bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo tsam la mthar thug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you say no, it is because the nature of the object is limited.

original: ji ltar zhe na zhes bya ba ni khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na zhes bya ba ni khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How? means because there is no difference.

original: gcig tu byas pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa yin gyi de'i bdag nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig tu byas pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa yin gyi de'i bdag nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: The expression made one means that it is a mere object of desire, not that it is of the nature of that.

original: de'i bdag nyid yin pa la skyon bstan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid yin pa la skyon bstan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The fault is not shown in the case of being of the nature of that.

original: shes yul zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes yul zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word object means object of knowledge.

original: snang 'dir zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtag par bya ba'i bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: snang 'dir zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtag par bya ba'i bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn this appearance‚Äù means by the nature of the object of perception.

original: de med na mngon par 'dod pa las gzhan du lkog tu gyur pa ni yul nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni snang ba spangs pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de med na mngon par 'dod pa las gzhan du lkog tu gyur pa ni yul nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni snang ba spangs pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it does not exist, then the hidden object that is other than the desired object is not an object, as has been explained. ‚ÄúBy abandoning the appearance‚Äù means

original: dag gi tshul ni rtog pa ste mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: dag gi tshul ni rtog pa ste mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe mode of the object‚Äù is the conception, the desired object.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that‚Äù means from the desired object.

original: ji lus ba'i phyir ni ji ltar nges pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji lus ba'i phyir ni ji ltar nges pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn order to obtain‚Äù means in order to attain certainty.

original: thob pa yid pa ni rang gi ngo bo snang ba'o //
analyzed: thob pa yid pa ni rang gi ngo bo snang ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe desired attainment‚Äù is the appearance of its own nature.

original: de ni phrad par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni phrad par bya ba'o //
translated: That is the contact.

original: yod par zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod par zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe existence‚Äù is the indication of the nature.

original: sngar ni de med pa na zhen pa tsam la'o //
analyzed: sngar ni de med pa na zhen pa tsam la'o //
translated: Previously, it was merely the attachment to its nonexistence.

original: thob pa yod pa zhes bya ba de bshad pa ni dngos yod par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thob pa yod pa zhes bya ba de bshad pa ni dngos yod par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of ‚Äúthe existence of the attainment‚Äù is ‚Äúthe existence of the entity.‚Äù

original: sngar zhes bshad pa ni 'byung ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sngar zhes bshad pa ni 'byung ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Previously, it was explained as ‚Äúthe arising.‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag pa yod na ni zhen pa yod na'o //üîΩrtogs pa nyid ni ngo bo'i snang ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yod na ni zhen pa yod na'o // rtogs pa nyid ni ngo bo'i snang ba'o //
translated: If there is inference, there is adherence.

original: sprin @166a * //
analyzed: sprin @166a * //
translated: Realization itself is the appearance of the essence.üîΩThe cloud

original: ldang ba las char 'bab par rjes su dpag par 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i yul can ma yin nam /
analyzed: ldang ba las char 'bab par rjes su dpag par 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i yul can ma yin nam /
translated: is not the object of inference of the occurrence of rain,

original: du bas me la ni ma yin no zhes zer ba la thams cad du zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: du bas me la ni ma yin no zhes zer ba la thams cad du zhes bya ba ste /
translated: but smoke is of fire.

original: de la yang mi slu ba ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba kho na la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la yang mi slu ba ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba kho na la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúalways‚Äù means that in that case, too, there is nondeception only with regard to what is occurring.

original: snga ma dang phyi mar gyur pa'i rgyun rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin gyi 'byung bar 'gyur ba kho na ma yin no zhes zer ba ni gnyi ga zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi mar gyur pa'i rgyun rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin gyi 'byung bar 'gyur ba kho na ma yin no zhes zer ba ni gnyi ga zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The past and future are the objects of inference of a continuum, not of what is occurring alone.üîΩWhat is the difference between what has occurred and what will occur?

original: byung bar gyur pa las 'byung bar 'gyur ba shin tu tha dad pa ji zhig yin zhes bstan pa ni rang bzhin gcig nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: byung bar gyur pa las 'byung bar 'gyur ba shin tu tha dad pa ji zhig yin zhes bstan pa ni rang bzhin gcig nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalone‚Äù shows that.

original: byung dang zhes bya ba ni byung ba'i ngang tshul can te da ltar ba'o //
analyzed: byung dang zhes bya ba ni byung ba'i ngang tshul can te da ltar ba'o //
translated: What has occurred is the present, which has the nature of what has occurred.

original: zhen pas gcig nyid ni mngon par 'dod pa tsam yin par bstan pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhen pas gcig nyid ni mngon par 'dod pa tsam yin par bstan pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that the one is asserted by attachment alone is ‚ÄúTherefore, . . .‚Äù

original: rgyu ni rdza mkhan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni rdza mkhan la sogs pa'o //
translated: The cause is the potter, etc.

original: de lta nyid du zhes bya ba ni bum pa dang rdza mkhan la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: de lta nyid du zhes bya ba ni bum pa dang rdza mkhan la sogs pa'am /
translated: ‚ÄúJust so‚Äù means just as the pot, the potter, etc.,

original: 'dus byas pa'i khyim la sogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: 'dus byas pa'i khyim la sogs pa yang ngo //
translated: or the house, etc., which are compounded.

original: de ltar mthong ba min na snga na yod par ro ;
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba min na snga na yod par ro ;
translated: If it is not seen in that way, it is not seen before.

original: ; rjes su dpag pa'i dus su yang gzhan gyis mthong ba nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: ; rjes su dpag pa'i dus su yang gzhan gyis mthong ba nyid ma yin nam /
translated: Even at the time of inference, is it not seen by another?üîΩHow could it arise?

original: de ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin zhes zer ba la de'i tshe'ang zhes bya ba ste snga rol du'o //üîΩci las she na de bzhin te zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin zhes zer ba la de'i tshe'ang zhes bya ba ste snga rol du'o // ci las she na de bzhin te zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAt that time‚Äù means before.

original: gzhan gyis mthong ba'i ngo bos yod do zhes bya ba la tshad ma med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan gyis mthong ba'i ngo bos yod do zhes bya ba la tshad ma med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: From what? ‚ÄúJust so,‚Äù i.e., by the nature of being seen by another, it exists. The meaning is that there is no valid cognition.

original: gzhan yang rang gi snang ba nyid kho na rig pa yin gyi gzhan gyi snang ba nyid ni ma yin par bstan pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: gzhan yang rang gi snang ba nyid kho na rig pa yin gyi gzhan gyi snang ba nyid ni ma yin par bstan pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o /
translated: Moreover, it is one‚Äôs own appearance that is cognized, not the appearance of another.

original: rtogs par 'gyur ba min pa zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis so //
analyzed: rtogs par 'gyur ba min pa zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis so //
translated: Moreover, it is not cognized by inference, i.e., by perception.

original: phyi rol snang ba nyid ni gzhan gyis mthong ba yin pa'i phyir dang / gzhan gyis mthong ba nyid kyang kho bo cag gis brjod pas gzhan gyis mthong ba yin pa'i phyir rang las ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: phyi rol snang ba nyid ni gzhan gyis mthong ba yin pa'i phyir dang / gzhan gyis mthong ba nyid kyang kho bo cag gis brjod pas gzhan gyis mthong ba yin pa'i phyir rang las ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The external appearance is seen by another, and what is seen by another is also said by us to be seen by another.

original: rjes su dpag pa yis shes na //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yis shes na //
translated: If it is known by inference,

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: then it is not from itself.

original: mngon sum gyis ma shes na'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ma shes na'o //
translated: If it is not known by perception,üîΩthen it is not from another.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi yang ngo //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the other.

original: ci las she na gzhan dang thun mong nyid yin na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ci las she na gzhan dang thun mong nyid yin na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: From what? If it is common to another,

original: gzhan gyis mthong ba nyid du shes pa yin na'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis mthong ba nyid du shes pa yin na'o //
translated: then it is known to be seen by another.

original: de ni yod ces bya ba ni phyi rol yin te /
analyzed: de ni yod ces bya ba ni phyi rol yin te /
translated: That exists, i.e., the external.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyi snang ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyi snang ba'o //
translated: It is the appearance of that nature.

original: de yod nyid na ni de'i bdag nyid snang ba'i phyi rol nyid kyi shes pa yod na ste /
analyzed: de yod nyid na ni de'i bdag nyid snang ba'i phyi rol nyid kyi shes pa yod na ste /
translated: If that exists, then the external object, which is the appearance of that nature, exists.

original: 'brel pa 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas gzhan gyi snang ba nyid shes @166b pa las phyi rol gyi bsgrub bya'i shes pa med na de dang 'brel pa'i mi shes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'brel pa 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas gzhan gyi snang ba nyid shes @166b pa las phyi rol gyi bsgrub bya'i shes pa med na de dang 'brel pa'i mi shes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If the cognition exists, then the cognition of the appearance of another is known through inference, which is preceded by the apprehension of the relation. If the object to be established, the external object, does not exist, then the relation with that is not known. This is the meaning.

original: mngon sum gyis bsgrub bya shes na de dang 'brel pa shes pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa yin par bstan pa ni nges na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis bsgrub bya shes na de dang 'brel pa shes pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa yin par bstan pa ni nges na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the object to be established is known through perception, then inference is taught because the relation with that is known. If it is known, then it is known through perception.

original: rjes su dpag pa tsam ni 'brel pa mi shes pa'i phyir phan tshun bsten par brjod do zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa tsam ni 'brel pa mi shes pa'i phyir phan tshun bsten par brjod do zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Inference is said to be mutually dependent because the relation is not known through mere inference. This is inference.

original: 'dam bu'i phung po gnyis lus dang sems kyang gzhan las yod pa grub pa ni phan tshun bsten pa yin gyi ma grub ba yod pa can ma yin par bstan pa ni phan tshun bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dam bu'i phung po gnyis lus dang sems kyang gzhan las yod pa grub pa ni phan tshun bsten pa yin gyi ma grub ba yod pa can ma yin par bstan pa ni phan tshun bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The two bundles of reeds are established as existing in mutual dependence, but not as existing in mutual dependence.

original: rang gi rgyud la sngon po mthong ba'i 'bras bu phyi rol gyi yin no zhes thog ma med pa'i bag chags las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas nges par byas nas gzhan du 'bras bu de de'i bskyed bya yin no zhes nges par byed cing gzung ba nyid
analyzed: rang gi rgyud la sngon po mthong ba'i 'bras bu phyi rol gyi yin no zhes thog ma med pa'i bag chags las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas nges par byas nas gzhan du 'bras bu de de'i bskyed bya yin no zhes nges par byed cing gzung ba nyid
translated: The effect of seeing blue in one‚Äôs own continuum is external, and having ascertained that by a conception that arises from beginningless latent potentialities, one ascertains elsewhere that the effect is the product of that.üîΩThe statement that it is the apprehender

original: rig par byed pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rig par byed pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: that is the knower is as follows.

original: de'i phyir thog ma med pa can gyi de lta bur gyur pa'i rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba ste rnam par rtog pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags las rjes su byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir thog ma med pa can gyi de lta bur gyur pa'i rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba ste rnam par rtog pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags las rjes su byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúinference that is like that in the beginningless cycle of existence,‚Äù because the conception arises from the latent potentialities of conception.

original: don dam par ni zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par ni zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the ultimate sense means that it is the direct experience.

original: myong ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa tsam gyi mthar thug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: myong ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa tsam gyi mthar thug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is experience because it is the ultimate of mere self-awareness.

original: yul rung can gyis mi shes pa ;
analyzed: yul rung can gyis mi shes pa ;
translated: It is not known by one who is not fit for the object.

original: ; rang gis shes phyir de shes yin //
analyzed: ; rang gis shes phyir de shes yin //
translated: It is known by itself, and so it is known.

original: zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid las thams cad ma 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid las thams cad ma 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because it does not go beyond the definition.

original: dbye ba med pa zhes bya ba ni nye ba'i khongs su gtogs pas rjes su 'gro ba rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbye ba med pa zhes bya ba ni nye ba'i khongs su gtogs pas rjes su 'gro ba rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is undivided because it is included in the proximate, and because it is the awareness of the universal.

original: ga las shes na zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa la yang gzung ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ga las shes na zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa la yang gzung ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is asked, How is it known? it is because even in error there is no abandonment of the conceptualization of the apprehended, etc.

original: 'khrul pa'i ngo bo phyi rol na med pa nyid sngags la sogs pas snang ba che ba la chung bar dang / chung ba la che bar yin la /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i ngo bo phyi rol na med pa nyid sngags la sogs pas snang ba che ba la chung bar dang / chung ba la che bar yin la /
translated: The nature of error is not external, and by the power of mantra, etc., the great appears as small, and the small appears as great.

original: de nyid ni phyi rol ma yin te de'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir dang / gzhan gyis ma mthong ba'i phyir dang / rnam par rnam pa ma gtogs par phyi rol snang ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid ni phyi rol ma yin te de'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir dang / gzhan gyis ma mthong ba'i phyir dang / rnam par rnam pa ma gtogs par phyi rol snang ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: That itself is not external, because it is not the cause of that, because it is not seen by others, and because external appearances do not exist apart from the aspects of consciousness.

original: gnyi ga zhes bya ba de dag tsam gyis bzung ba dang cig shos ma yin par bstan pa ni sngags dang rgyud la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga zhes bya ba de dag tsam gyis bzung ba dang cig shos ma yin par bstan pa ni sngags dang rgyud la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúboth of these‚Äù indicates that the object and the subject are not separate.

original: phyi rol snang ba la 'khrul pa nyid ni gnod par byed pa'am med par yang ma yin la /üîΩnyung ba la yang yin te 'phel ba las yul lhag @167a * //
analyzed: phyi rol snang ba la 'khrul pa nyid ni gnod par byed pa'am med par yang ma yin la / nyung ba la yang yin te 'phel ba las yul lhag @167a * //
translated: External appearances are not just erroneous, nor are they nonexistent.

original: pa nyid kyi phyir la /
analyzed: pa nyid kyi phyir la /
translated: They are not few, because they increase, and because there are more objects.üîΩAnd they are not many, because they decrease.

original: de bzhin du 'grib pa yin yang de lta bu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'grib pa yin yang de lta bu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are like that.

original: ma rtogs pa ni ma dpyad pa'o //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa ni ma dpyad pa'o //
translated: Non-understanding is non-examination.

original: gang gi rang bzhin ni phyi rol dang phyi rol ma yin pa yang ngo //
analyzed: gang gi rang bzhin ni phyi rol dang phyi rol ma yin pa yang ngo //
translated: Its nature is both external and not external.

original: de kho na bzhin du zhes bya ba ni rig par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du zhes bya ba ni rig par byed pa'o //
translated: Just as it is said, it is to be understood.

original: ma yin te rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par dpyad pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin te rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par dpyad pa'o //
translated: No, because ‚Äúinference‚Äù is an analysis.

original: nus pa zhes bya ba ni de'i snga rol du mngon sum la de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa zhes bya ba ni de'i snga rol du mngon sum la de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúCapable‚Äù means prior to that, because there is no direct perception.

original: mngon sum nyid ces bya ba ni dpyod na yang ngo //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid ces bya ba ni dpyod na yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúDirect perception‚Äù means even when analyzed.

original: thal ba ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni du ba la me dpog pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: thal ba ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni du ba la me dpog pa la yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúNot a consequence‚Äù means even when inferring fire from smoke.

original: mngon sum pa yod pa rnam pa dpyod pa'i nyid mngon sum yin gyi /
analyzed: mngon sum pa yod pa rnam pa dpyod pa'i nyid mngon sum yin gyi /
translated: ‚ÄúDirect perception exists‚Äù means the analysis of the aspect is direct perception.

original: du ba las me dpog pa la ni ma yin no zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: du ba las me dpog pa la ni ma yin no zhes zer ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúNot in inferring fire from smoke‚Äù means that.

original: de nyid mngon sum yin la rag mod ces bya ba ni rim pa bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid mngon sum yin la rag mod ces bya ba ni rim pa bzlog pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThat is direct perception, indeed‚Äù means the reverse order.

original: de rnam pa dpyod pa'i bdag nyid kyi bag chags yin te /
analyzed: de rnam pa dpyod pa'i bdag nyid kyi bag chags yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThat is the nature of the habitual tendency of the analysis of the aspect.

original: rnam par dpyod pa'i rim gyis 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par dpyod pa'i rim gyis 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it arises by the process of analysis.

original: don dam pa nyid ma yin pa ni phyi rol ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa nyid ma yin pa ni phyi rol ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot ultimate‚Äù means not external.

original: 'on te dpyod pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pas phyi rol rnam par gzhag par byed na de bzhin du phyi rol ma yin pa yang yin pa 'gal bar bstan pa ni bzlog pa la yang rjes su dpag pa ste /
analyzed: 'on te dpyod pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pas phyi rol rnam par gzhag par byed na de bzhin du phyi rol ma yin pa yang yin pa 'gal bar bstan pa ni bzlog pa la yang rjes su dpag pa ste /
translated: But if it is established as external by the conceptualization that has the nature of analysis, then it is shown that it is not external, and the inference is reversed.

original: rnam par rtog pa phyi rol mi dmigs pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa phyi rol mi dmigs pa las byung ba'o //
translated: Conceptualization arises from the non-apprehension of the external.

original: gnyi gar zhes bya ba ni sngar yod pa dang phyis med pa rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: gnyi gar zhes bya ba ni sngar yod pa dang phyis med pa rtogs pa yin te /
translated: ‚Äú Both‚Äù means that it is understood to exist previously and not to exist later.

original: skyes bu re re'i shes pa re re la thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu re re'i shes pa re re la thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because each consciousness of each person is not common.

original: shes pa bor nas de las gzhan rjes su rtogs par byed na /
analyzed: shes pa bor nas de las gzhan rjes su rtogs par byed na /
translated: If, having abandoned consciousness, one understands something else,

original: tha dad par 'gyur ba de'i phyir gzung ba nyid ni lkog tu gyur pa'i ngo bo las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad par 'gyur ba de'i phyir gzung ba nyid ni lkog tu gyur pa'i ngo bo las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: it would be different. Therefore, the object apprehended is not different from the hidden essence.

original: de'i phyir ni thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir ni thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that, it is not common.

original: de ltar ni bzlog pas yod pa ma yin pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de ltar ni bzlog pas yod pa ma yin pa nyid kyis so //
translated: In that case, it is not because of the reversal.

original: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni bzlog pas ma rtogs na yang ngo //
analyzed: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni bzlog pas ma rtogs na yang ngo //
translated: Even so, means even if it is not understood through reversal.

original: thun mong ba nyid du yod pa zhes bya ba rgol ba'o //
analyzed: thun mong ba nyid du yod pa zhes bya ba rgol ba'o //
translated: The opponent says, ‚ÄúIt exists in common.‚Äù

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni grub mtha' can gyis dris pa ste /
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni grub mtha' can gyis dris pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú But if‚Äù is the question of the one who holds a philosophical position.

original: ma rtogs so zhes bya ba ni bzlog pa yin la gzhan gyis bzlog pa ma rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma rtogs so zhes bya ba ni bzlog pa yin la gzhan gyis bzlog pa ma rtogs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú It is not understood‚Äù is the reversal, and the other does not understand the reversal.

original: rjes su dpag pa rtogs na bzlog pa la yang yin par bstan pa ni bzlog pa la yang zhes bya ba ste 'gal lo zhes bya ba'i don no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa rtogs na bzlog pa la yang yin par bstan pa ni bzlog pa la yang zhes bya ba ste 'gal lo zhes bya ba'i don no //
translated: If the inference is understood, the reversal is also shown to be so, and ‚Äúthe reversal‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúis contradictory.‚Äù

original: med do zhes bya ba ni thun mong ba nyid 'dzin pa'i rjes su dpag pas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med do zhes bya ba ni thun mong ba nyid 'dzin pa'i rjes su dpag pas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú It does not exist‚Äù is because the inference that apprehends commonality is undermined.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni rang dang gzhan las snang du rung ba gcig nyid kyis yul can rjes su dpag @167b pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'bras bu sbu ldang ba la sogs pa gcig bde ba bzhin du 'dra ba yin yang skabs dang bcas pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni rang dang gzhan las snang du rung ba gcig nyid kyis yul can rjes su dpag @167b pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro // 'bras bu sbu ldang ba la sogs pa gcig bde ba bzhin du 'dra ba yin yang skabs dang bcas pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: ‚Äú How?‚Äù is because the object of the single one that is suitable to appear from itself and from another is not an inference.üîΩ‚Äú Like the effect‚Äù is the similarity, and ‚Äúthe single one‚Äù is the statement of the context, which is the arising of the hairs and so on.

original: gcig nyid dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gcig nyid dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Like the effect‚Äù is the similarity, and ‚Äúthe single one‚Äù is the statement of the context, which is the arising of the hairs and so on.

original: de ltar bzlog pa'i rjes su dpag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar bzlog pa'i rjes su dpag pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not an inference that reverses that.

original: ma mthong ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni 'dir ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni 'dir ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because it has a non-perceived object.

original: de nyid dang gzhan nyid 'di la khyad par med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan nyid 'di la khyad par med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúhere‚Äù is that there is no difference between this and identity and difference.

original: de'i phyir na thun mong ba nyid la mngon sum mi 'jug pa'i phyir gzhan la de ltar thun mong ba nyid du rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir na thun mong ba nyid la mngon sum mi 'jug pa'i phyir gzhan la de ltar thun mong ba nyid du rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, because direct perception does not engage in commonality, it is not understood as common in other cases.

original: gzhan la ni de ltar nges pa yin zhes bya ba ni grub mtha'i nye bar bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la ni de ltar nges pa yin zhes bya ba ni grub mtha'i nye bar bsdu ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIn other cases, it is ascertained in that way‚Äù is the conclusion of the treatise.
