original: gzhan gyis mngon sum ni thun mong ba nyid la ma yin yang ji ltar de med kyang gzhan gyi de yin zhes rgol ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis mngon sum ni thun mong ba nyid la ma yin yang ji ltar de med kyang gzhan gyi de yin zhes rgol ba'o //
translated: Even though direct perception is not common, how can it be the other‚Äôs when it does not exist? This is the objection.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni mngon sum med kyang rjes su dpag pa de lta bu yin snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni mngon sum med kyang rjes su dpag pa de lta bu yin snyam du sems pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúBut‚Äù means that even without direct perception, one thinks that inference is like that.

original: rjes su dpag pa thun mong ba nyid la yang ngo zhes bstan pa ni bzlog pa la yang zhes bya ba ste thun mong nyid la'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa thun mong ba nyid la yang ngo zhes bstan pa ni bzlog pa la yang zhes bya ba ste thun mong nyid la'o //
translated: The reply to the objection that the commonness of the inference is also so is stated: ‚ÄúEven in the case of the commonness.‚Äù

original: med do zhes bya ba ni de med pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med do zhes bya ba ni de med pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no‚Äù means that there is no contradiction in that.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHow?‚Äù is the question of the opponent.

original: 'gal ba nyid la lan 'debs pa ni gcig nyid dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba nyid la lan 'debs pa ni gcig nyid dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply to the contradiction is ‚ÄúThe oneness.‚Äù

original: de lta yin na thun mong ba nyid du rjes su dpag pa ji ltar 'jig rten pa yin zhes zer ba la 'dra ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta yin na thun mong ba nyid du rjes su dpag pa ji ltar 'jig rten pa yin zhes zer ba la 'dra ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If that is so, how can the inference of commonness be mundane? The reply is ‚ÄúThe similarity.‚Äù

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i don nyid ni mngon sum gyi yin te khyod kyis kyang 'di mthong ngam ci zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad las shes par sla ba yin par bstan pa ni 'dir ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i don nyid ni mngon sum gyi yin te khyod kyis kyang 'di mthong ngam ci zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad las shes par sla ba yin par bstan pa ni 'dir ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The uncommon meaning is that of direct perception. It is easy to understand that it is taught by the convention ‚ÄúDo you see this?‚Äù and so on. This is stated in ‚ÄúHere, however.‚Äù

original: 'di yang zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i bdag nyid kho na thun mong ba nyid du brtags pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i bdag nyid kho na thun mong ba nyid du brtags pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThis also‚Äù means that the commonness is imagined to be only the nature of cognition, not anything else.

original: de nyid bstan pa ni de dag ma bslad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa ni de dag ma bslad ces bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching of that is ‚Äúthey are not adulterated. ‚Äù

original: dper na zhes bya ba ni thun mong pa nyid du brtags pa'o //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba ni thun mong pa nyid du brtags pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú For example‚Äù is a common example.

original: 'di dag ni sngags la sogs pa bslad pas mthong ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni sngags la sogs pa bslad pas mthong ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: These are for those who see through the adulteration of mantras, etc.

original: chung ngu'ang chen por zhes bya ba'i 'ang gi sgra las chen po 'ang chung ngur ji ltar mthong ba thun mong ba nyid kyis de bzhin du mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: chung ngu'ang chen por zhes bya ba'i 'ang gi sgra las chen po 'ang chung ngur ji ltar mthong ba thun mong ba nyid kyis de bzhin du mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: ‚Äú Even the small as large‚Äù is a common example, because even the large is seen as small, just as it is seen.

original: gzung ba'i rnam pa las gzhan pa gzung ba ma yin gyi gzung ba dang gzung ba ma yin pa'i rnam pa yang ma yin par bstan pa ni de bzhin du 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam pa las gzhan pa gzung ba ma yin gyi gzung ba dang gzung ba ma yin pa'i rnam pa yang ma yin par bstan pa ni de bzhin du 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú In the same way‚Äù teaches that the aspect of the apprehended is neither other than nor the same as the apprehended.

original: de'i phyir thun mong ba de las gzhan du thun mong ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir thun mong ba de las gzhan du thun mong ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not common, since it is other than that commonality.

original: de ste thun mong ba ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de ste thun mong ba ma mthong ba'o //
translated: If it is not seen as common, it is not seen.

original: rang rig pa @168a * //
analyzed: rang rig pa @168a * //
translated: Self-awareness

original: tsam rig pa ma yin nam rtags la sogs pa med pa ni rjes su dpag pa ma yin no zhes zer ba la gzhan gyis zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: tsam rig pa ma yin nam rtags la sogs pa med pa ni rjes su dpag pa ma yin no zhes zer ba la gzhan gyis zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To this, the response is ‚ÄúOthers say . . .‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag pa ni mi dmigs pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni mi dmigs pa las byung ba'o //
translated: Inference arises from non-apprehension.

original: gzhan gyis khas blangs pa'i rtags ni rtogs pas sgro btags pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gzhan gyis khas blangs pa'i rtags ni rtogs pas sgro btags pa ma yin nam /
translated: The reason accepted by others is not something imagined by thought?üîΩHow can it be a proof for anyone?

original: ji ltar 'ga'i yang sgrub byed yin zhes zer ba la yang na zhes bya ba ste rtog pas byas pa nyid ni mi slu ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos su ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar 'ga'i yang sgrub byed yin zhes zer ba la yang na zhes bya ba ste rtog pas byas pa nyid ni mi slu ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos su ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The response is ‚ÄúOr else . . . ‚Äù The point is that what is fabricated by thought is not a means of valid cognition because it is deceptive.

original: gang zhig ni rig pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig ni rig pa'o //
translated: What is it? It is awareness.

original: ji ltar ni tha mi dad pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar ni tha mi dad pa'o //
translated: How is it non-different?

original: gzhan ni phyi rol lo //
analyzed: gzhan ni phyi rol lo //
translated: The other is external.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni de'i ngo bo'i rnam par 'jog par byed par tha dad par mthong bar byed pa ma yin nam zhes zer ba la rjes su dpag pa yang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni de'i ngo bo'i rnam par 'jog par byed par tha dad par mthong bar byed pa ma yin nam zhes zer ba la rjes su dpag pa yang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Is not inference posited as having the nature of that? It is seen to be different.

original: gzhan la tha mi dad par rnam par 'jog par byed na rang nyid la yang mtshan nyid mtshungs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan la tha mi dad par rnam par 'jog par byed na rang nyid la yang mtshan nyid mtshungs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If you posit it as not different from the other, then it is the same as the definition.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa'i rjes su dpag pa bzhin du 'di yang mngon par 'dod pa'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa'i rjes su dpag pa bzhin du 'di yang mngon par 'dod pa'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: ‚Äú If‚Äù means that, like non-apprehension, this is also a special case of what is accepted.

original: mngon par 'dod pa yang rang gi rig pa tsam yin par bstan pa ni de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa yang rang gi rig pa tsam yin par bstan pa ni de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù indicates that what is accepted is only one‚Äôs own awareness.

original: mngon par 'dod pa tsam gyi bag chags las byung ba las tshad ma dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ni thal ches pa yin no zhes zer ba ni 'o na ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa tsam gyi bag chags las byung ba las tshad ma dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ni thal ches pa yin no zhes zer ba ni 'o na ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that the positing of valid knowledge, result, etc. is too much of an overextension arising from the habit of mere acceptance is ‚ÄúHow then?‚Äù

original: mthong ba'i byed pa dang cig shos kyi rjes su 'brangs pa las rnam par dbye ba bstan pa ni gzung ba 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i byed pa dang cig shos kyi rjes su 'brangs pa las rnam par dbye ba bstan pa ni gzung ba 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the distinction between the function of seeing and the other is ‚Äúgrasping the grasped.‚Äù

original: ji ltar rjes su snang bzhin pa ni mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'i rnam par rtog pa las ma 'das pas so //
analyzed: ji ltar rjes su snang bzhin pa ni mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'i rnam par rtog pa las ma 'das pas so //
translated: Since it is not beyond the conceptual thought that follows after what is seen, it is not the case that the object is not seen.

original: gzung ba dang rig pa rnam par rig pa ni gzhal bya la sogs pa'i bdag nyid rnams so //
analyzed: gzung ba dang rig pa rnam par rig pa ni gzhal bya la sogs pa'i bdag nyid rnams so //
translated: The cognition of the object and the cognition of the apprehender are the entities of the object of comprehension, etc.

original: gnas pa ni dbye bas gzhag pa ste rnam par rtog pas bstan pa'i gzung ba la sogs pa la gzhal bya la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang de dang de las log pa'i phyir thal ches pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa ni dbye bas gzhag pa ste rnam par rtog pas bstan pa'i gzung ba la sogs pa la gzhal bya la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang de dang de las log pa'i phyir thal ches pa ma yin no //
translated: The establishment of the object of comprehension, etc., by way of exclusion is not an overextension, because the conceptual thought of the object of comprehension, etc., in regard to the object, etc., indicated by conceptual thought is the exclusion of that and that.

original: ldog pa'i dbye ba bstan pa ni de nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: ldog pa'i dbye ba bstan pa ni de nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: The teaching of the division of exclusion is ‚Äúthat itself.‚Äù

original: sngon po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'o //
translated: Blue, etc.

original: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni 'dzin byed gzhan la'o //
analyzed: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni 'dzin byed gzhan la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn another‚Äù means in another apprehender.

original: tha snyad du zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa las so //
analyzed: tha snyad du zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa las so //
translated: ‚ÄúConventionally‚Äù means from the point of view of what is accepted.

original: yod pa ma yin pa ste med pa thob pa'i phyir yod pa ma yin pa gang gi bdag nyid yin pa de la yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa ste med pa thob pa'i phyir yod pa ma yin pa gang gi bdag nyid yin pa de la yod pa yin gyi /
translated: That which is not existent is the nonexistence that is attained. That which has the nature of that is existent.

original: yod pa la ni ma yin te rang nyid kyis yod @168b pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa la ni ma yin te rang nyid kyis yod @168b pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not in regard to what exists, because it exists by itself.

original: yod pa ma yin pa 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni skad kyi byings kyi don du ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni skad kyi byings kyi don du ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The expression ‚Äúapprehension of what does not exist‚Äù is not a nominal derivation.

original: thun mong ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i thun mong pa'i tshad ma'o //
analyzed: thun mong ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i thun mong pa'i tshad ma'o //
translated: ‚ÄúCommon‚Äù and so on means a common means of valid knowledge.

original: lhag ma zhes bya ba ni med pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma zhes bya ba ni med pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe rest‚Äù means not nonexistent.

original: 'di bdag gis mthong bar gyur to zhes 'dzin pa sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa'i sems pa can ni bdag ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'di bdag gis mthong bar gyur to zhes 'dzin pa sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa'i sems pa can ni bdag ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it the self that has the thought ‚ÄúI saw this before‚Äù when it apprehends what it saw before?

original: de'i dbang po la sogs pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba ni 'di shes pa'i phyir shes pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i dbang po la sogs pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba ni 'di shes pa'i phyir shes pa yin te /
translated: The transformation of its sense faculties and so on is knowledge because it knows that.

original: des byas pa yang yul nye bar gzhag pa dang / nyams su myong dang rtogs pa zhes bya ba yang ngo //
analyzed: des byas pa yang yul nye bar gzhag pa dang / nyams su myong dang rtogs pa zhes bya ba yang ngo //
translated: The object that it creates is called ‚Äúthe object that is present,‚Äù ‚Äúthe object that is experienced,‚Äù and ‚Äúthe object that is realized.‚Äù

original: yul yang phyi rol gyi dngos po 'dzin pa'i shes pas rtogs pa'i bdag nyid gang yin pa 'di'i yul yang yin pa ma rig pa'i dbang gis nges pa yin no zhes zer ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul yang phyi rol gyi dngos po 'dzin pa'i shes pas rtogs pa'i bdag nyid gang yin pa 'di'i yul yang yin pa ma rig pa'i dbang gis nges pa yin no zhes zer ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The object is also the object of that which is the nature of the cognition apprehending external things, and is ascertained by the power of ignorance.

original: shes pa nyid las log pas de ltar tha snyad 'dogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes pa nyid las log pas de ltar tha snyad 'dogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is what is said. It is not that the convention is made in that way by turning away from cognition itself.

original: shes pa nyid sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba yin yang de ma yin pa las log pas gcig tu zhen pa yin te /
analyzed: shes pa nyid sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba yin yang de ma yin pa las log pas gcig tu zhen pa yin te /
translated: Even though cognition itself is divided into the aspects of blue, etc., it is conceived as one by turning away from what is not that.

original: mngon sum gyi yul yin pa'i phyir gzhan ma yin par bstan pa ni de lta min na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi yul yin pa'i phyir gzhan ma yin par bstan pa ni de lta min na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The teaching that the object of direct perception is not different is ‚ÄúIf it were not so. . . .‚Äù

original: gzhan gyis yang bdag la tha dad pa ni brtags pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis yang bdag la tha dad pa ni brtags pa kho na yin te /
translated: The difference from another is imagined by another.

original: gzhan du na 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan du na 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Otherwise, because of contradiction, it would not be so. This is the meaning.

original: 'gal ba bstan pa ni gal te gcig yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba bstan pa ni gal te gcig yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching of the contradiction is ‚ÄúIf it were one. . . .‚Äù

original: snang ba ni mngon sum mo //
analyzed: snang ba ni mngon sum mo //
translated: Appearance is direct perception.

original: sna tshogs par snang ba gcig nyid yin na sngon po la sogs pa'i yul la thal ches par bstan pa ni gzhan la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs par snang ba gcig nyid yin na sngon po la sogs pa'i yul la thal ches par bstan pa ni gzhan la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the variety of appearances were one, it would follow, absurdly, that the object, such as the blue, would be one.

original: sngon po la sogs pa yang rnam par dbye ba dang ldan pa ma yin nam zhes zer ba la tha dad med pa ni gcig nyid do //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa yang rnam par dbye ba dang ldan pa ma yin nam zhes zer ba la tha dad med pa ni gcig nyid do //
translated: The opponent may say, But are not blue and so on also endowed with divisions? To this we reply, If they are not different, they are one.

original: gzhan gyi tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin mthong ba med pa'i phyir tha mi dad par nyams su ma myong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin mthong ba med pa'i phyir tha mi dad par nyams su ma myong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since the nature of the other is not seen to be undifferentiated, it is not experienced as undifferentiated. This is what is meant by the phrase because they are not experienced as undifferentiated.

original: shes pa tshul la ni sngon po la sogs pa yang shes pa las tha mi dad pa nyams su myong ba'i phyir de dang rjes su mthun par nges pa yin par bstan pa ni blos dngos tha dad med ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa tshul la ni sngon po la sogs pa yang shes pa las tha mi dad pa nyams su myong ba'i phyir de dang rjes su mthun par nges pa yin par bstan pa ni blos dngos tha dad med ces bya ba'o //
translated: In the case of consciousness, since blue and so on are experienced as undifferentiated from consciousness, they are ascertained to be in accordance with that. This is taught by the passage that begins The mind does not experience the object as different from itself.

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni rgol ba po'i'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni rgol ba po'i'o //
translated: The opponent's position is referred to by the phrase the other.

original: bshad par bya bar nye bar blangs pa'am /
analyzed: bshad par bya bar nye bar blangs pa'am /
translated: The phrase we will explain is a promise to explain.

original: gzhan yang sngon po la sogs pa'i tha mi dad pa dgag par bya ba la tha dad pa'i ngo bo mthong ba'i phyir 'gal ba dmigs pa yin pa'i bshad pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang sngon po la sogs pa'i tha mi dad pa dgag par bya ba la tha dad pa'i ngo bo mthong ba'i phyir 'gal ba dmigs pa yin pa'i bshad pa ni /
translated: Moreover, the explanation that the observation of contradiction is because of seeing a different nature in the negation of non-difference of blue, etc.,

original: de lta na ni 'o na rang bzhin tha dad par snang bas na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na rang bzhin tha dad par snang bas na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is like the statement, ‚Äúbecause of the appearance of different natures.‚Äù

original: yod pa'i rang bzhin tha dad par @169a * //
analyzed: yod pa'i rang bzhin tha dad par @169a * //
translated: If one asserts that there is a different nature,

original: zhes 'dod pa la ni rang bzhin mi dmigs par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes 'dod pa la ni rang bzhin mi dmigs par bshad pa'o //
translated: the non-observation of nature is explained.

original: thams cad bden pa nyid do zhes bshad pa ni gsal ba nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad bden pa nyid do zhes bshad pa ni gsal ba nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The statement, ‚Äúall are real,‚Äù is like the statement, ‚Äúthe nature of manifestation.‚Äù

original: bdag nyid gzhan no zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa yin na'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid gzhan no zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa yin na'o //
translated: The statement, ‚Äúthe self is different,‚Äù is like the statement, ‚Äúthe self is different.‚Äù

original: bdag nyid kho na yin par bstan pa ni gsal ba'i rang bzhin nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kho na yin par bstan pa ni gsal ba'i rang bzhin nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The statement, ‚Äúthe self is just that,‚Äù is like the statement, ‚Äúthe nature of manifestation.‚Äù

original: mang po nyid ni bdag rnams kyi ste sems pa can gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mang po nyid ni bdag rnams kyi ste sems pa can gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement, ‚Äúmany selves,‚Äù is like the statement, ‚Äúone sentient being.‚Äù

original: stong bar zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa'i ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: stong bar zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa'i ngo bo yin te /
translated: The statement, ‚Äúempty,‚Äù is like the statement, ‚Äúdifferent natures.‚Äù

original: dngos dmigs pa'i phyir gcig nyid ma yin te ngo shes pa ni ldog pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos dmigs pa'i phyir gcig nyid ma yin te ngo shes pa ni ldog pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not the same as the object of perception, because recognition has a different object.

original: yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di thams cad bdag kho na yin pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di thams cad bdag kho na yin pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú It does not exist‚Äù means that all of this is the self.

original: 'khrul pa med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgol ba yin te /
analyzed: 'khrul pa med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgol ba yin te /
translated: ‚Äú If there is no error‚Äù and so on is the objection.

original: bdag tha mi dad pa'i phyir dang de nyid ma yin pa snang ba nyid las snang ba yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhung lugs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tha mi dad pa'i phyir dang de nyid ma yin pa snang ba nyid las snang ba yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhung lugs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú Because the self is not different and because it appears as if it were not that‚Äù is the theory.

original: med pa nyid kyi phyir gnod bya nyid mi 'grub par bstan pa ni 'di ni 'khrul pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: med pa nyid kyi phyir gnod bya nyid mi 'grub par bstan pa ni 'di ni 'khrul pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú This is error‚Äù teaches that the object of refutation is not established because it does not exist.

original: med par ma nges pa las kyang sngon po la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi snang ba ldog pa'i phyir rnal 'byor pa 'jug par mi 'gyur bar bstan pa ni 'khrul par nges pa la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: med par ma nges pa las kyang sngon po la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi snang ba ldog pa'i phyir rnal 'byor pa 'jug par mi 'gyur bar bstan pa ni 'khrul par nges pa la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú If error is ascertained‚Äù teaches that the yogi does not engage because the appearance of the particular, such as blue, is stopped, even though it is not ascertained as nonexistent.

original: de'i phyir 'jug pa'i shes pa bzhin bdag bzhin du dngos po thams cad kyang gnyi ga'i ngo bo ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jug pa'i shes pa bzhin bdag bzhin du dngos po thams cad kyang gnyi ga'i ngo bo ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, like the engaged consciousness, all things are not of the nature of both, like the self,üîΩbecause of contradiction.

original: 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni gang gis dngos po zhes bya ba ste gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyis te /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni gang gis dngos po zhes bya ba ste gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyis te /
translated: The explanation of this is: ‚ÄúBy what?‚Äù‚Äîthat is, by the nature of both,

original: sngon po dang sngon po ma yin pa yod pa dang med pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: sngon po dang sngon po ma yin pa yod pa dang med pa la sogs pas so //
translated: by the existence and nonexistence of blue and non-blue, and so on.

original: gcig dang du ma'i zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma'i zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne and many‚Äù is an illustration.

original: rang bzhin ni gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNature‚Äù means the nature of both.

original: blo ni dngos po thams cad las //
analyzed: blo ni dngos po thams cad las //
translated: The mind is the nature of all things.

original: ldog dang rjes su 'gro'i bdag nyid las //
analyzed: ldog dang rjes su 'gro'i bdag nyid las //
translated: It is the nature of reversal and of following.

original: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid skyed pa na //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid skyed pa na //
translated: When it generates the nature of both,

original: de med na ni mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de med na ni mi 'grub bo //
translated: it is not established if that does not exist.

original: zhes bya ba bsal ba yin gyi rig pa'i bdag nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba bsal ba yin gyi rig pa'i bdag nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: This is the refutation, but it is not the nature of awareness.

original: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid 'gal ba kho na yin par bstan pa ni gcig ni yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid 'gal ba kho na yin par bstan pa ni gcig ni yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation that the nature of both is contradictory is: ‚ÄúOne does not exist.‚Äù

original: rig pa'i bdag nyid kyis gcig nyid yin na gnyi ga'i bdag nyid du 'gal ba nyid du bstan pa ni gcig ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i bdag nyid kyis gcig nyid yin na gnyi ga'i bdag nyid du 'gal ba nyid du bstan pa ni gcig ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is the same in terms of the nature of awareness, it is contradictory to be the nature of both. This is taught by ‚Äúone is . . .‚Äù

original: rig pa'i bdag nyid kyis du ma nyid du mngon par 'dod pa la gcig nyid bstan pa ni myong ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i bdag nyid kyis du ma nyid du mngon par 'dod pa la gcig nyid bstan pa ni myong ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is asserted to be many in terms of the nature of awareness, it is taught to be one. This is taught by ‚Äúnot experienced . . .‚Äù

original: rang gi ngo bo'i mthar thug pa la yang gcig nyid yin te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo'i mthar thug pa la yang gcig nyid yin te /
translated: It is also one in terms of the final nature.

original: mthar thug pa ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩtha dad par ma rtogs pa'i phyir @169b rtogs pa'i mthar thug pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mthar thug pa ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro // tha dad par ma rtogs pa'i phyir @169b rtogs pa'i mthar thug pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: This is because the final nature is not realized.

original: rang rig pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching that it is not the final nature because of not realizing difference is taught by ‚Äúself-awareness . . .‚Äù

original: de'i nang du zhes bya ba ni rim pa gcig rtogs pa na tha dad pa nyid rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i nang du zhes bya ba ni rim pa gcig rtogs pa na tha dad pa nyid rtogs pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúIn that‚Äù means that when one stage is realized, difference is realized.

original: rtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it follows realization‚Äù is the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: sna tshogs pa'i rnam pa'i phyi rol gyi phye ma leb khra bo la sogs pa sngon po la sogs pa phyi rol du ma yin la /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i rnam pa'i phyi rol gyi phye ma leb khra bo la sogs pa sngon po la sogs pa phyi rol du ma yin la /
translated: The external variegated butterfly, etc., are not external blue, etc., of various aspects.

original: rig pa ni gcig gi rjes su 'gro ba nyams su myong ba'i phyir ma bkag pa yin la /
analyzed: rig pa ni gcig gi rjes su 'gro ba nyams su myong ba'i phyir ma bkag pa yin la /
translated: But the cognition is not refuted because it is experienced as following after the one.

original: bsgoms pa las byung ba nyid ni ci'i phyir mi bden zhes zer ba la bzlog par nus pa'i phyir na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba nyid ni ci'i phyir mi bden zhes zer ba la bzlog par nus pa'i phyir na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Why is it not true that it arises from meditation? It is because it can be refuted.

original: bzlog par nus pa ni mi bden pa yin te /
analyzed: bzlog par nus pa ni mi bden pa yin te /
translated: What can be refuted is not true.

original: rang gi rgyu las byung ba'i phyi rol ni bsgoms pas bzlog par nus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu las byung ba'i phyi rol ni bsgoms pas bzlog par nus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The external, which arises from its own cause, cannot be refuted by meditation. This is the meaning.

original: dbye ba med par rig pa ni dbye ba dang ldan pa 'khrul pas rtogs pa yin no zhes bstan pa ma yin nam //
analyzed: dbye ba med par rig pa ni dbye ba dang ldan pa 'khrul pas rtogs pa yin no zhes bstan pa ma yin nam //
translated: Has it not been taught that cognition without differentiation is understood through error, which has differentiation?

original: dbye ba dang ldan pa med na yang gtso bo'i rjes su byed pa can ni 'khrul pa ma yin no zhes zer ba ni chos mthun pa nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: dbye ba dang ldan pa med na yang gtso bo'i rjes su byed pa can ni 'khrul pa ma yin no zhes zer ba ni chos mthun pa nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: Even though there is no differentiation, it is not error that follows after the principal. This is what is said. The similarity is called ‚Äúsameness of attributes.‚Äù

original: rnam par dbye ba dang ldan pa ni dngul gyi bzhin du nya phyis la dngul du 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba dang ldan pa ni dngul gyi bzhin du nya phyis la dngul du 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs position is that the possessor of the division is like silver, and the mother-of-pearl is mistaken for silver.

original: nang gis bslad pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags te /
analyzed: nang gis bslad pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags te /
translated: The internal contamination is the latent impressions of conceptualization.

original: yul la sogs pa la yod pa'i 'dra ba nyid la sogs pa la log pa'o //
analyzed: yul la sogs pa la yod pa'i 'dra ba nyid la sogs pa la log pa'o //
translated: It is the error in the similarity, etc., that exists in the object, etc.

original: nang gis zhes bya ba rnam par rtog par bya ba'i gzung ba la sogs pa yin la /
analyzed: nang gis zhes bya ba rnam par rtog par bya ba'i gzung ba la sogs pa yin la /
translated: The internal is the apprehended object, etc., that are to be conceptualized.

original: rnam par rtog pa yang bag chags las byung ba yin par bstan pa ni gang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yang bag chags las byung ba yin par bstan pa ni gang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching that conceptualization also arises from latent impressions is ‚Äúthat.‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par dbye ba ma mthong na ji ltar de'i bag chags sad pa yin zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par dbye ba ma mthong na ji ltar de'i bag chags sad pa yin zhes zer ba la /
translated: If the division of conceptualization is not seen, how is the awakening of its latent impressions?

original: de ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The response is ‚Äúthat.‚Äù

original: de'i mthong ba ni 'khrul pa yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i mthong ba ni 'khrul pa yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The idea is that its seeing is an error.

original: 'on te de lnga ma yin par mthong na ji ltar 'khrul pa ma yin zhes sbyar pas chos mthun pa nyid mthong ba las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on te de lnga ma yin par mthong na ji ltar 'khrul pa ma yin zhes sbyar pas chos mthun pa nyid mthong ba las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: But if one sees that it is not those five, how can it be non-erroneous? Thus, it is the meaning of ‚Äúseeing the similarity itself.‚Äù

original: ma yin te 'di ni 'khrul pa brgyud pa zhes bya ba ni lan yin no //
analyzed: ma yin te 'di ni 'khrul pa brgyud pa zhes bya ba ni lan yin no //
translated: No, because this is called ‚Äúthe continuity of error.‚Äù This is the reply.

original: brtags pa ni tshad ma dang cig shos kyi zhen pa'o //
analyzed: brtags pa ni tshad ma dang cig shos kyi zhen pa'o //
translated: Imagination is the adherence of valid cognition and its opposite.

original: mthong ba'i rjes su 'brangs pa'i rtogs pas gzhal bya la sogs pa la gzung ba la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa mi rigs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: mthong ba'i rjes su 'brangs pa'i rtogs pas gzhal bya la sogs pa la gzung ba la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa mi rigs pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it unreasonable to posit the object of comprehension, etc. by the understanding that follows seeing?

original: mthong ba la ni dbye ba thams cad nub pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba ni ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //üîΩrang gi bdag nyid ces bya ba ni dbye ba nub pas rgyu mtshan med pa'i rnam @170a * //
analyzed: mthong ba la ni dbye ba thams cad nub pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba ni ji ltar zhes bya ba'o // rang gi bdag nyid ces bya ba ni dbye ba nub pas rgyu mtshan med pa'i rnam @170a * //
translated: Because all distinctions disappear in seeing. This is the question.

original: par gzhag pa nges pas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: par gzhag pa nges pas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One‚Äôs own nature means that it is unreasonable to posit without a reason the distinction that has disappeared. This is the meaning.

original: de la ni 'khrul pa la ste ji ltar mthong ba'i rnam par gzhag pa ste ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan la ldog par byed pa'i ngo bo tha mi dad pa ni yongs su gcod pa yin te /
analyzed: de la ni 'khrul pa la ste ji ltar mthong ba'i rnam par gzhag pa ste ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan la ldog par byed pa'i ngo bo tha mi dad pa ni yongs su gcod pa yin te /
translated: In that case, the ascertainment is the non-difference of the nature of the cause of the reversal from the reason for the reversal, i.e., from the appearance in error, i.e., from the way in which it is perceived.

original: 'dis ston po la sogs pa'i blo yod pa de'i bdag nyid kyis yongs su gcod pas so //
analyzed: 'dis ston po la sogs pa'i blo yod pa de'i bdag nyid kyis yongs su gcod pas so //
translated: Because this ascertains the existence of the cognition of the teacher, etc., by means of its own nature.

original: gzhan la ma ltos pa'i 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam pa tshad ma yin te byed pa po med pa'i phyir dang / don gyis go ba nyams pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan la ma ltos pa'i 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam pa tshad ma yin te byed pa po med pa'i phyir dang / don gyis go ba nyams pa'i phyir te /
translated: The aspect of the apprehender, which does not depend on another, is valid knowledge, because there is no agent, and because the understanding of the meaning is impaired.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de'i sgrub byed yin par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de'i sgrub byed yin par 'dod pa'o //
translated: For that very reason, it is accepted as the proof of that.

original: de'i ni yongs su gcod pa'i bdag nyid rig pa'o //
analyzed: de'i ni yongs su gcod pa'i bdag nyid rig pa'o //
translated: The nature of that ascertainment is awareness.

original: ci las she na de'i bdag nyid phyir te rig pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ci las she na de'i bdag nyid phyir te rig pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: From what? From the fact that it is of the nature of that, i.e., of awareness.

original: de ltar rab tu rtogs par byed pa'i tshig las de'i yul can gyi gzhal bya shugs kyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rab tu rtogs par byed pa'i tshig las de'i yul can gyi gzhal bya shugs kyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, from the words that make it understood, the object of that cognition is indirectly indicated.

original: de bstan pa ni de nyid bsgrub bya zhes bya ba ste de'i yul nyid kyis rig pa dang / nges pa dag 'byung ba'i phyir de nyid sgrub byed yin te de yod na gzhan med kyang rig pa'i phyir dang / rig pa'i bdag nyid de las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bstan pa ni de nyid bsgrub bya zhes bya ba ste de'i yul nyid kyis rig pa dang / nges pa dag 'byung ba'i phyir de nyid sgrub byed yin te de yod na gzhan med kyang rig pa'i phyir dang / rig pa'i bdag nyid de las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is taught in the line ‚ÄúThat is the probandum,‚Äù because the object of that is the source of awareness and ascertainment. That is the proof, because when it exists, there is awareness even without another, and because the nature of awareness is not different from that.

original: rig pa'i bdag nyid dang 'gal ba'i phyir rang la rig pa ma yin pa ma yin nam 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: rig pa'i bdag nyid dang 'gal ba'i phyir rang la rig pa ma yin pa ma yin nam 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it the case that it is not awareness of itself because it is contradictory to the nature of awareness? What then?

original: gzhan la'o zhes zer ba la de la ni bsgrub par bya ba'i rang gi rig pa'i bdag nyid la tshad ma ni 'dod chags la sogs pa rig par mthong ba de la 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: gzhan la'o zhes zer ba la de la ni bsgrub par bya ba'i rang gi rig pa'i bdag nyid la tshad ma ni 'dod chags la sogs pa rig par mthong ba de la 'gal ba med de /
translated: It is of another. In that case, the proof of the nature of awareness of the probandum is not contradictory to the perception of the awareness of attachment and so on.

original: rig pa las gzhan pas rig na bde ba ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa bsgrub pa'i gnas phyir ro //
analyzed: rig pa las gzhan pas rig na bde ba ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa bsgrub pa'i gnas phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the basis of the proof that if awareness is aware of another, it follows that it is not bliss and so on.

original: rig pa'i don byed pa ni gzhan du yang ma yin la /
analyzed: rig pa'i don byed pa ni gzhan du yang ma yin la /
translated: The function of awareness is not in another.

original: bde ba ni gzhan yang ma yin la de bzhin du sngon po la yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba ni gzhan yang ma yin la de bzhin du sngon po la yang ma yin te /
translated: Pleasure is not something else, and likewise, blue is not something else.

original: kha bsgyur ba la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir zhes zer ba la 'di ni kun la zhes ngon po la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kha bsgyur ba la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir zhes zer ba la 'di ni kun la zhes ngon po la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because of the existence of transformation, etc.

original: ma yin te rang gi ngo bo yang rig pa'i bdag nyid kyi don byed pa gnyis yin la /
analyzed: ma yin te rang gi ngo bo yang rig pa'i bdag nyid kyi don byed pa gnyis yin la /
translated: This is not so. The essence of both is the performance of an action that has the nature of awareness.

original: bde ba la sos pa la ni rig pa kho na yin gyi de dag tsam gyi khyad par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba la sos pa la ni rig pa kho na yin gyi de dag tsam gyi khyad par ni ma yin te /
translated: In the case of pleasure, etc., it is only awareness, and not a difference in those.

original: rig pa las tha mi dad par nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rig pa las tha mi dad par nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because of the experience that is not different from awareness. This is the meaning.

original: ji ltar bde ba la sogs pa ji ltar rang rig pa yin par mi 'gal ba yin zhes zer ba la bde ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ji ltar bde ba la sogs pa ji ltar rang rig pa yin par mi 'gal ba yin zhes zer ba la bde ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: How is it that pleasure, etc., are not contradictory to being reflexive awareness?

original: goms pa'i stobs las zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: goms pa'i stobs las zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: The power of habituation is the proof of reflexive awareness.

original: tha dad pa med pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa nyams @170b su ma myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa nyams @170b su ma myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the non-existence of difference‚Äù means because of the non-experience of difference.

original: de'i phyir tha dad pa'i tshig ni rmongs pa yin par bstan pa ni rnam pa bzhir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir tha dad pa'i tshig ni rmongs pa yin par bstan pa ni rnam pa bzhir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the statement of difference is taught to be delusion, ‚Äúin four ways.‚Äù

original: tha dad pa kho na'o zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa nyid 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir dbyibs ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa kho na'o zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa nyid 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir dbyibs ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is only different‚Äù means that it is not shape because it apprehends only pleasure, etc.

original: sngon po'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ni dbyibs dang bcas pa dang cig shos zhes bya ba'i khyad par yin gyi gzung ba dang cig shos ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sngon po'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ni dbyibs dang bcas pa dang cig shos zhes bya ba'i khyad par yin gyi gzung ba dang cig shos ni ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe aspect of blue‚Äù is a distinction of ‚Äúwith shape‚Äù and ‚Äúwithout shape,‚Äù but not a distinction of ‚Äúapprehended‚Äù and ‚Äúnot apprehended.‚Äù

original: las dang byed ba po nyid du ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las dang byed ba po nyid du ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the activity and the agent are not understood.

original: mi slu ba dang cig shos dag gis tshad ma dang cig shos nyid du las dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo 'thad pa'i phyir shes pa tsam la yang dge ba dan cig shos rnam par dbye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mi slu ba dang cig shos dag gis tshad ma dang cig shos nyid du las dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo 'thad pa'i phyir shes pa tsam la yang dge ba dan cig shos rnam par dbye ba ma yin no //
translated: Because the nature of the effect and the cause is established by the non-deceptive and the deceptive as valid knowledge and invalid knowledge, the distinction of virtue and non-virtue is not made in mere consciousness.

original: rnam pa med pa la ni rnam par dbye ba rang nyid grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa med pa la ni rnam par dbye ba rang nyid grub pa ma yin te /
translated: But if it is devoid of aspects, the division itself is not established.

original: sngon po la sogs pa ni bde ba la sogs pa bzhan du cho mi mthun pa nyid kyis rang nyid rig pa ji ltar yin /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa ni bde ba la sogs pa bzhan du cho mi mthun pa nyid kyis rang nyid rig pa ji ltar yin /
translated: How can blue, etc. be self-cognizant, since they are dissimilar to pleasure, etc.?

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid bzhin du bde ba dang sngon po la sogs pa dag la khyad par med de las dang cig shos kyi ngo bos gnyi ga ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni de la'ang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid bzhin du bde ba dang sngon po la sogs pa dag la khyad par med de las dang cig shos kyi ngo bos gnyi ga ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni de la'ang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: There is no difference between pleasure, etc. and blue, etc., just as in the case of the nature of pleasure, etc., because both are not in the nature of action and its result. This is indicated by ‚Äúthat‚Äù .

original: nyams myong bdag nyid phyir ni nyams su myong ba gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams myong bdag nyid phyir ni nyams su myong ba gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is of the nature of experience, it does not depend on another experience.

original: gzhan gyis nyams su myong na de'i nyams su myong ba mi rigs pa'i phyir rung ba nyid ni gzhan la ma ltos pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis nyams su myong na de'i nyams su myong ba mi rigs pa'i phyir rung ba nyid ni gzhan la ma ltos pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: Because it is not reasonable that another experience is that experience, the suitability is the nature of not depending on another.

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang / snang bzhin pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang / snang bzhin pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a hidden nature and because it is manifest.

original: de bstan pa ni sngon po la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bstan pa ni sngon po la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching of that is ‚Äúblue, etc.‚Äù

original: ma yin te rang gi ngo bos zhes bya ba ni skyed par byed pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa snang ba ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma yin te rang gi ngo bos zhes bya ba ni skyed par byed pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa snang ba ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not so, because of its own nature. The meaning is that the eye, etc. are not illumination because they produce.

original: skyed par byed pa yang 'ba' zhig ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa yang 'ba' zhig ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: It is taught that they are not only producers.

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúbecause‚Äù is that.

original: ma zhugs kyang zhes bya ba ni rmi lam la sogs pa la ltos pa med pa'o //
analyzed: ma zhugs kyang zhes bya ba ni rmi lam la sogs pa la ltos pa med pa'o //
translated: Even though it has not entered, in dreams, etc. it is independent.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni sad pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni sad pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: Thus, in the state of waking.

original: gzhan nyid du zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: gzhan nyid du zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa nyid kyis so //
translated: In another way, by way of what is desired and not desired.

original: mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba bshad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba bshad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of ‚Äúeye, etc.‚Äù is ‚Äúif.‚Äù

original: mngon du phyogs par byed pa dang snang ba dag la dbye ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon du phyogs par byed pa dang snang ba dag la dbye ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is a distinction between the one that makes manifest and the one that illuminates.

original: de goms pa dang cig shos dag gis mi gal ba na 'dogs pa'i phyir 'di'i dbye ba yin no snyam du sems pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de goms pa dang cig shos dag gis mi gal ba na 'dogs pa'i phyir 'di'i dbye ba yin no snyam du sems pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If one thinks that the distinction is due to the fact that the other is not important when one is accustomed to that, then the response is ‚ÄúBut if that is so . . . ‚Äù

original: de lta na goms pa nyid gtso bo yin la /
analyzed: de lta na goms pa nyid gtso bo yin la /
translated: Thus, the fact of being accustomed is primary,

original: mig ni rjes su 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir gzugs 'dzin @171a * //
analyzed: mig ni rjes su 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir gzugs 'dzin @171a * //
translated: and the eye is secondary. Therefore, even though the eye is the determiner of the apprehension of form,

original: pa la nges par byed pa yin yang de la nges pa dang ma nges pa 'dzin pa'i shes pa skyed par byed pa ni bag chags kyi rnam par dbye ba las yin te /
analyzed: pa la nges par byed pa yin yang de la nges pa dang ma nges pa 'dzin pa'i shes pa skyed par byed pa ni bag chags kyi rnam par dbye ba las yin te /
translated: the production of a consciousness that apprehends with certainty or without certainty is due to the distinction of the latent impressions.

original: bde ba dang cig shos bstan pa ni gal te mig sogs zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bde ba dang cig shos bstan pa ni gal te mig sogs zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The statement ‚Äúpleasure and the other‚Äù is for the purpose of showing that if the eye, etc.,

original: mig las byung ba gzugs mngon du byed pa gzhan las ji ltar yin zhes bya ba bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: mig las byung ba gzugs mngon du byed pa gzhan las ji ltar yin zhes bya ba bsal ba yin no //
translated: are the determiners of the apprehension of form, then how is it that the eye is the determiner of the apprehension of form that arises from the other, i.e., the eye?

original: gzhan du gyur pa la rang gi ngo bo med pas snang ba la khyad par med na /
analyzed: gzhan du gyur pa la rang gi ngo bo med pas snang ba la khyad par med na /
translated: If there is no difference in the appearance because there is no intrinsic reality in the transformation,üîΩthen how is there a difference in the apprehension of the intrinsic reality of things?

original: dngos po'i ngo bo med pa ji ltar yin zhes zer ba la ma yin te phan tshun zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo med pa ji ltar yin zhes zer ba la ma yin te phan tshun zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The response is ‚ÄúNo, because of the mutual . . . ‚Äù

original: mi slu ba yang snang ba nyid yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi slu ba yang snang ba nyid yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is also non-deceptive in appearance.

original: 'khrul na zhes bya ba ni phyi rol na thams cad du med pa yin /
analyzed: 'khrul na zhes bya ba ni phyi rol na thams cad du med pa yin /
translated: If it is mistaken, it is completely non-existent externally.

original: yul dang dus su gzhan pa'i bdag nyid 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni yid bstan pa ga las yin zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yul dang dus su gzhan pa'i bdag nyid 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni yid bstan pa ga las yin zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is taught that it is mistaken because it has a different nature in terms of object and time. From where is the mind taught?

original: don la mi slu ba yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don la mi slu ba yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is also no non-deceptive object.

original: rang gi ngo bo las gzhan rig na yul la sogs pa gzhan du yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo las gzhan rig na yul la sogs pa gzhan du yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If it cognizes something different from its own nature, it would also be different in terms of object and so on.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni des na snang ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni des na snang ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But it is not different. This is taught by therefore it is appearance.

original: snang bzhin du ni phyi rol gyi don gyi'o //
analyzed: snang bzhin du ni phyi rol gyi don gyi'o //
translated: It is appearance as external objects.

original: shes pa thams cad phyi rol nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: shes pa thams cad phyi rol nyid ma yin nam /
translated: Aren't all consciousnesses external?

original: dbye ba na gnod par byed pa med pa'i shes pa las yin no zhes zer ba gnod bya zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbye ba na gnod par byed pa med pa'i shes pa las yin no zhes zer ba gnod bya zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When divided, it is from consciousness without an object of harm. This is taught by the object of harm.

original: de'i gnod bya ni phyi rol gyis byas pa'i 'dra ba nyid dam phyi rol gyi bdag nyid kyis sgro btags pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de'i gnod bya ni phyi rol gyis byas pa'i 'dra ba nyid dam phyi rol gyi bdag nyid kyis sgro btags pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The object of its error is the mere likeness produced by the external or the nature superimposed by the external.

original: de la'ang nyams myong bdag nyid phyir //
analyzed: de la'ang nyams myong bdag nyid phyir //
translated: And also because of the experience of that,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam pa dang bcas pa'i rigs pa dang don rig pa la yang de'i rig pa yin na de'i lan ni rnam par rig pa tsam gyi tshul yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam pa dang bcas pa'i rigs pa dang don rig pa la yang de'i rig pa yin na de'i lan ni rnam par rig pa tsam gyi tshul yin te /
translated: and so on. If the cognition of an object with a form is the cognition of that, the reply is the system of vij√±aptimƒÅtra.

original: phyi rol yod na de'i rig pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi rol yod na de'i rig pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the external exists, it is just the cognition of that.

original: de nyid rnam pa'i rigs pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni gal te shes pa rnam pa dang ba cas pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid rnam pa'i rigs pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni gal te shes pa rnam pa dang ba cas pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If you think that is the reasoning of the form, if the cognition has a form, then it is not tenable that it is the cognition of that.

original: thams cad kho na zhes bya ba ni shugs nyid kyis so //
analyzed: thams cad kho na zhes bya ba ni shugs nyid kyis so //
translated: Everything is just by implication.

original: nye bar gzhag pas bsgyur phyir na //
analyzed: nye bar gzhag pas bsgyur phyir na //
translated: Because of the transformation by the proximate cause,

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam pa dang ba cas pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam pa dang ba cas pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: the proximate cause is the transformation of the form of the cognition.

original: mig la sogs pa'i snang ba nye ba las yul ma yin yang dri la sogs pa mig la sogs pa la snang bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ba la ji srid pa zhes snos so //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i snang ba nye ba las yul ma yin yang dri la sogs pa mig la sogs pa la snang bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ba la ji srid pa zhes snos so //
translated: Although the object is not due to the proximity of the appearances of the eye, etc., the odor, etc. do appear to the eye, etc.

original: nye ba las smang ba ma yin te 'on kyang mig la sogs pa'i bskyed bya snang ba khyad par can yin par bstan pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nye ba las smang ba ma yin te 'on kyang mig la sogs pa'i bskyed bya snang ba khyad par can yin par bstan pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not due to proximity that there is appearance, but rather the appearance is a special product of the eye, etc.

original: der shar ba zhes bya ba ni mig 'bras @171b la shar ba ste snang ba'o //
analyzed: der shar ba zhes bya ba ni mig 'bras @171b la shar ba ste snang ba'o //
translated: That which arises there is the appearance in the eyeball.

original: chen po ma yin par ni rags par ma yin pa ste mig 'bras tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chen po ma yin par ni rags par ma yin pa ste mig 'bras tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Not large means not gross, because it is the size of the eyeball.

original: ci 'dra zhes bya ba ni sngon po'am ser po ste /
analyzed: ci 'dra zhes bya ba ni sngon po'am ser po ste /
translated: What kind means blue or yellow, etc.

original: gsal bar byed pa'i rnam pa bsgribs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa'i rnam pa bsgribs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it obscures the form of the illuminator.

original: 'di nyid bstan pa ni mdog kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid bstan pa ni mdog kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is being taught: the color, etc.

original: zhugs pa ni 'od zer rnams so //
analyzed: zhugs pa ni 'od zer rnams so //
translated: The rays are the light rays.

original: rgyab dang mdun ji snyeng pa'i yul gyi tshad kyis chen po la sogs ba rnams te /
analyzed: rgyab dang mdun ji snyeng pa'i yul gyi tshad kyis chen po la sogs ba rnams te /
translated: The large, etc. are the size of the object, whether it is far or near.

original: chen po dang chung ngu la sogs pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: chen po dang chung ngu la sogs pa rnams la'o //
translated: in the large, the small, and so on.

original: khyad par can ni sngar mi gsal ba las gsal ba dang / mig gi snang ba'i dang 'brel pa yin na /
analyzed: khyad par can ni sngar mi gsal ba las gsal ba dang / mig gi snang ba'i dang 'brel pa yin na /
translated: The special is that which is clear when it is in contact with the light of the eye,

original: rig pa'i bdag nyid yin la sngar rig pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa dang / de'i bskyed bya'i khyad par med na sngar mi gsal ba 'am mi rig pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i bdag nyid yin la sngar rig pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa dang / de'i bskyed bya'i khyad par med na sngar mi gsal ba 'am mi rig pa'o //
translated: but which is not clear when it is not in contact with the light of the eye, and which is not different from the object that is produced from it.

original: khyad par gzhan yin na ni thug pa med par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par gzhan yin na ni thug pa med par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the special is different from that, there is an infinite regress. This is shown in the line ‚ÄúIf it is different from that, there is an infinite regress.‚Äù

original: 'od zer las rig pa yin na thams cad de'i ngo bo yin la /
analyzed: 'od zer las rig pa yin na thams cad de'i ngo bo yin la /
translated: If the object is known from the light, then everything is of the nature of light.

original: 'od zer 'grub pa la tshad ma med par bstan pa ni 'on te rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'od zer 'grub pa la tshad ma med par bstan pa ni 'on te rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The demonstration that there is no evidence for the establishment of light is stated in the line ‚ÄúIf the light is by nature unilluminated.‚Äù

original: kun gyi rnam par zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par ro //
analyzed: kun gyi rnam par zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe form of all‚Äù is the form of the eye and so on.

original: don gnas ni nye ba na'o //
analyzed: don gnas ni nye ba na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe object is present‚Äù means that it is near.

original: skyes tsam zhes bya ba ni ldog pa dang bral ba'i rjes su 'gro ba tsam las so //
analyzed: skyes tsam zhes bya ba ni ldog pa dang bral ba'i rjes su 'gro ba tsam las so //
translated: ‚ÄúMerely arisen‚Äù means merely following from the absence of cessation.

original: gang las zhes bya ba ni ldog pa dang bcas pa'i rjes su 'gro ba las so //
analyzed: gang las zhes bya ba ni ldog pa dang bcas pa'i rjes su 'gro ba las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom which‚Äù means from the pervasion.

original: nye ba gang las shes pa don nyid kyi rjes su byed pa des de nyid rjes su 'dzin par 'gyur na rnam pa'i rtog pa la dgos pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nye ba gang las shes pa don nyid kyi rjes su byed pa des de nyid rjes su 'dzin par 'gyur na rnam pa'i rtog pa la dgos pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since the object itself is the basis of the cognition, the cognition is said to ‚Äúfollow‚Äù the object. If the cognition were to follow the aspect, there would be no purpose in the cognition.

original: skye ba la nye ba nyid ni dbang po las 'das pa yin yang rig pa la ni shes na ste /
analyzed: skye ba la nye ba nyid ni dbang po las 'das pa yin yang rig pa la ni shes na ste /
translated: Even though the arising of the cognition is beyond the senses, it is known through awareness.

original: de rig pa nyid ni de lta bu'i don gyis rig pa'i phyir dang / rang nyid mngon sum bas gzhan la mi 'jug pa'i phyir dang / 'jug na yang de'i ngo bor thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dbang po yang nges par byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de rig pa nyid ni de lta bu'i don gyis rig pa'i phyir dang / rang nyid mngon sum bas gzhan la mi 'jug pa'i phyir dang / 'jug na yang de'i ngo bor thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dbang po yang nges par byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: Since awareness is of that kind of object, and since it is itself manifest, it does not engage other objects, and if it did engage other objects, it would follow that it would have the nature of those objects. Therefore, the senses are also determined.

original: dbang po tsam las nges pa yin na de'i yul yang de nyid las yin pa'i phyir don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po tsam las nges pa yin na de'i yul yang de nyid las yin pa'i phyir don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the determination were from the senses alone, then the object would be the same as the senses, and there would be no object.

original: don las skye bzhin pa ni dbang po la nges pa can yin no zhes bya ba yang yid kyi la thu tsam yin te /
analyzed: don las skye bzhin pa ni dbang po la nges pa can yin no zhes bya ba yang yid kyi la thu tsam yin te /
translated: The statement ‚Äúthat which is in the process of arising from the object is restricted to the sense faculty‚Äù is also mere idle speculation.

original: de las skye ba nyid de'i bdag nyid ma yin pas ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las skye ba nyid de'i bdag nyid ma yin pas ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which is in the process of arising is not of the nature of that , it is not restricted to it.

original: dbang po yod kyang de med na rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po yod kyang de med na rig pa ma yin no //
translated: Even when the sense faculty exists, if that does not exist, there is no cognition.

original: de lta yen na dbang po'i sgo nas de'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par sgro btags pa ni rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pas rtogs par bya ba @172a * //
analyzed: de lta yen na dbang po'i sgo nas de'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par sgro btags pa ni rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pas rtogs par bya ba @172a * //
translated: If that were so, then the superimposition of the nature of that on the sense faculty would be understood through concomitance, etc.,

original: yin gyi 'ba' zhig ni ma yin par bstan pa ni yul rnams las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yin gyi 'ba' zhig ni ma yin par bstan pa ni yul rnams las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: but not by itself. The statement ‚Äúfrom the objects‚Äù teaches this.

original: rnam 'ga' zhes bya ba ni skye ba la nges par brtags pa ma byas kyang skyon med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam 'ga' zhes bya ba ni skye ba la nges par brtags pa ma byas kyang skyon med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúIn some way‚Äù means that even if the restriction to arising is not considered, there is no fault. This is the meaning.

original: yul dang 'dra ba'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: yul dang 'dra ba'i rnam pa ste /
translated: The form that is like the object

original: 'dra ba nyid dam de nyid du sgro btags pa yang rung pa gang gi yin pa shes pa ste /
analyzed: 'dra ba nyid dam de nyid du sgro btags pa yang rung pa gang gi yin pa shes pa ste /
translated: is the cognition that is like that or is the superimposition of that.

original: dbang po las yul 'dzin pa la so sor nges pa yin te /
analyzed: dbang po las yul 'dzin pa la so sor nges pa yin te /
translated: The sense faculty is restricted to the apprehension of the object.

original: nges pa'i rnam pa skyed par byed pas phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i rnam pa skyed par byed pas phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: because it is helpful in producing the aspect of certainty.

original: gang kho na las zhes bya ba ni gang dang gang kho na las so //
analyzed: gang kho na las zhes bya ba ni gang dang gang kho na las so //
translated: From just what? From just what?

original: skyed par byed pa nyid du khyad par med kyang cung zad nyid ni 'dra ba nyid kyis skyed par byed pa'am /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa nyid du khyad par med kyang cung zad nyid ni 'dra ba nyid kyis skyed par byed pa'am /
translated: Although there is no difference in being a producer, something is a producer by similarity,

original: de nyid du sgro btags pa'i yul yin par bstan pa ni dper na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid du sgro btags pa'i yul yin par bstan pa ni dper na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: or it is the object of reification as that.

original: rig pa'i sngon po ni rig pa las tha mi dad par phyi rol gyis byas pa ni phas byas pa'i bu'i ngo bo bzhin du mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rig pa'i sngon po ni rig pa las tha mi dad par phyi rol gyis byas pa ni phas byas pa'i bu'i ngo bo bzhin du mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: For example, the blue of cognition is seen as not different from cognition, as the nature of a son produced by another.üîΩOf one,

original: gcig gi zhes bya ba ni byed pa po yin yang de las gzhan pa rnam pa'i byed pa po ma yin par shes par bya ba'i ched du'o //
analyzed: gcig gi zhes bya ba ni byed pa po yin yang de las gzhan pa rnam pa'i byed pa po ma yin par shes par bya ba'i ched du'o //
translated: in order to make known that although it is an agent, it is not the agent of the aspect other than that.

original: de bstan pa ni de las byung ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bstan pa ni de las byung ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is taught by ‚Äúarising from that.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du don nyid las don gyi rnam pa mthong ngo zhes bstan pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du don nyid las don gyi rnam pa mthong ngo zhes bstan pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Likewise, the statement ‚Äúone sees the aspect of the object from the object itself‚Äù is explained by the words ‚Äúfor that reason.‚Äù

original: don nyid rnam pa byed pa yin te /
analyzed: don nyid rnam pa byed pa yin te /
translated: The object itself is the agent of the aspect,

original: de'i rnam pa mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because one sees its aspect.

original: don nyid rnam pa'i khyad par skyed par byed pas yul 'dzin pa la nges par byed pa yin gyi dbang po ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni thag ring zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don nyid rnam pa'i khyad par skyed par byed pas yul 'dzin pa la nges par byed pa yin gyi dbang po ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni thag ring zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The object itself is the agent of the aspect, because it is the cause of the arising of the particular aspect. It is the cause of the ascertainment of the apprehension of the object, but not the sense faculty. This is demonstrated by the words ‚Äúat a distance.‚Äù

original: rnam pa'i byed pa po nyid ni gzung ba nyid na la yang lag gi gtso bo yin na //
analyzed: rnam pa'i byed pa po nyid ni gzung ba nyid na la yang lag gi gtso bo yin na //
translated: When the object is grasped, the sense faculty is not the agent of the aspect, because it is not the cause of the arising of the particular aspect.

original: byab pa thal ches pa'i rgyu nyid kyis ci zhig bya zhes bstan pa ni de las gzhan dang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: byab pa thal ches pa'i rgyu nyid kyis ci zhig bya zhes bstan pa ni de las gzhan dang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: What is the use of the cause of the excessive extension? This is demonstrated by the words ‚Äúfrom that, other than that.‚Äù

original: de'i rgyu nyid du ni shes pa'i rgyu nyid du'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu nyid du ni shes pa'i rgyu nyid du'o //
translated: From that means from the cause of that.

original: mtshungs pa ni de las gzhan pa dbang po la sogs pa rnams dang ngo //
analyzed: mtshungs pa ni de las gzhan pa dbang po la sogs pa rnams dang ngo //
translated: Similar means similar to that, to the other sense faculties, etc.

original: yul dag la ni mtshungs pa la'o //
analyzed: yul dag la ni mtshungs pa la'o //
translated: With regard to the objects,

original: de'i chas ni rnam pa byed pa nyid gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i chas ni rnam pa byed pa nyid gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The form of the object is the principal factor in the production of the cognition.

original: de nyid ni ma yin te smig rgyu dkar po la sogs pa la yang chu'i rnam pa ser po can la rang gi rnam par sgro btags pas rgyu ma yin pas yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ni ma yin te smig rgyu dkar po la sogs pa la yang chu'i rnam pa ser po can la rang gi rnam par sgro btags pas rgyu ma yin pas yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not so, because even in regard to a white mirage, etc., the form of water is not the object, since it is not the cause of the cognition, because it is superimposed upon the cognition as its own form.

original: yul nges pa can nyid kyang skyon rnams kyi de nye ba yod pas nus pa mngon par gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul nges pa can nyid kyang skyon rnams kyi de nye ba yod pas nus pa mngon par gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The restriction of the object is due to the manifestation of the capacity of the object, because of the proximity of the defects.

original: de med par zhes bya ba ni rang gi rnam par sgro 'dogs par byed pa nyid med na de yul nyid ma yin @172b no ;üîΩ/ rgyu nyid kyis rang gi rnam par sgro 'dogs par byed pa nyid brjod par 'dod pa nyid du bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de med par zhes bya ba ni rang gi rnam par sgro 'dogs par byed pa nyid med na de yul nyid ma yin @172b no ; / rgyu nyid kyis rang gi rnam par sgro 'dogs par byed pa nyid brjod par 'dod pa nyid du bstan pa ni /
translated: In the absence of that, i.e., in the absence of the superimposition of its own form, it is not the object.üîΩThe author states that the superimposition of its own form is the cause, in order to show that it is the cause.

original: rgyu nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: By the word ‚Äúcause‚Äù he means the cause of the superimposition of its own form.

original: de'i rnam pa ni bdag nyid kyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa ni bdag nyid kyi rnam pa'o //
translated: Its form is the form of the object.

original: gnyi ga'i rgyu nyid dang bdag gi rnam par sgro 'dogs par byed pa nyid kyang ngo //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i rgyu nyid dang bdag gi rnam par sgro 'dogs par byed pa nyid kyang ngo //
translated: The cause of both is the cause of the superimposition of its own form.

original: de lta ma yin yang zhes bya ba ni myong ba nyid ma yin na'o//
analyzed: de lta ma yin yang zhes bya ba ni myong ba nyid ma yin na'o//
translated: If it were not so, i.e., if it were not the experience itself,

original: ma rtogs pa'am gzhan rtogs pa tsam yin na yul rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhes zer ba la rtogs pa dang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa'am gzhan rtogs pa tsam yin na yul rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhes zer ba la rtogs pa dang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: then, if it were merely the non-apprehension or the apprehension of something else, would there be the apprehension of the object?

original: yul mi rigs par bstan pa ni gal te zhes bya ba ste sngon po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yul mi rigs par bstan pa ni gal te zhes bya ba ste sngon po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The impossibility of the object is demonstrated: if, i.e., the object were to exist,

original: don med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de la ste dbang po la sogs pa la brten pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: don med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de la ste dbang po la sogs pa la brten pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it would be purposeless, i.e., because it would be the nature of that, i.e., of the sense faculty, etc.,

original: gzhan du na de mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na de mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: otherwise, it would be impossible.

original: mi nus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rtogs par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi nus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rtogs par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible, i.e., because there is no valid cognition which would apprehend it.

original: de bstan pa ni ma rtogs pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bstan pa ni ma rtogs pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is demonstrated: the non-apprehension, i.e., the non-apprehension of the object.

original: rtogs bzhin pa la ni de'i ngo bo nyid kho na rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir gzhan lhag ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs bzhin pa la ni de'i ngo bo nyid kho na rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir gzhan lhag ma yin no //
translated: In the case of the apprehension in process, it is only the nature of that which is being apprehended, therefore, the remainder is something else.

original: de bstan pa ni rtogs so zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bstan pa ni rtogs so zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is demonstrated: if one says, it is apprehended.

original: rtogs bzhin pa nyid 'bras bu yin pas byed pa rtogs par byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rtogs bzhin pa nyid 'bras bu yin pas byed pa rtogs par byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: Since the very realization of the object is the effect, is not the agent the realization of the object?

original: de yang bdag gi 'gyur ba'i blo'am dbang po la sogs pa'i byed pa'ang rung zhes zer ba la bya ba gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang bdag gi 'gyur ba'i blo'am dbang po la sogs pa'i byed pa'ang rung zhes zer ba la bya ba gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: And that is also the activity of the self, or the activity of the intellect, sense faculty, etc.

original: bstan to zhes bya ba ni dbang po la sogs pa nyid las de lta bu'i ngo bo skyed pa las rtogs par byed pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba bstan zin pa ni de med na ni de mi 'byung zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: bstan to zhes bya ba ni dbang po la sogs pa nyid las de lta bu'i ngo bo skyed pa las rtogs par byed pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba bstan zin pa ni de med na ni de mi 'byung zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúIt has been explained‚Äù means that it has been explained that the sense faculty, etc. themselves are not the agent, because they generate that kind of effect. ‚ÄúIf that does not exist, this does not occur‚Äù and so on.

original: yul shes de'i shes pa'i zhes bya ba ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i gzhung ngo //
analyzed: yul shes de'i shes pa'i zhes bya ba ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i gzhung ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúThe object, the consciousness of that‚Äù is the system of Master Dignaga.

original: don gyi rang gi snang ba ni don snang ba dang rang snang ba zhes bya pas tshul gnyis nyid ces bya ba bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: don gyi rang gi snang ba ni don snang ba dang rang snang ba zhes bya pas tshul gnyis nyid ces bya ba bshad pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe appearance of the object itself‚Äù is the appearance of the object and the appearance of itself. Thus, the two modes are explained.

original: yul shes pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag las so //
analyzed: yul shes pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag las so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe consciousness of the object‚Äù is from the Abhidharma.

original: 'og ma dag ni zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid do //
analyzed: 'og ma dag ni zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúThe latter‚Äù is this very text.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de lta ma yin te /üîΩgal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de lta ma yin te / gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: If it were not so, etc.

original: re zhig 'di ltar rnam pa rnams //üîΩspros dang ldan par mthong ba min //
analyzed: re zhig 'di ltar rnam pa rnams // spros dang ldan par mthong ba min //
translated: If it were not so, i.e., if the cognition were not of the form of the object, then, etc.

original: zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid yin te /
translated: First, the reason is not established:üîΩ‚ÄúThe aspects are not seen to be associated with conceptual proliferation.‚Äù

original: 'di bum pa'o zhes bya ba las bum pa'i rnam pa ma rtogs par shes pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir mi rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di bum pa'o zhes bya ba las bum pa'i rnam pa ma rtogs par shes pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir mi rigs pa yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable to say that the cognition ‚ÄúThis is a pot‚Äù is non-conceptual, because the aspect of the pot is not cognized.

original: bum pa'i rnam pa 'di nyams su myong bas myong ba ma yin na bum pa nyams @173a * //üîΩsu myong bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: bum pa'i rnam pa 'di nyams su myong bas myong ba ma yin na bum pa nyams @173a * // su myong bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: If the experience of this aspect of the pot is not experienced, the pot is not experienced.

original: rnam pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis khyad par med pa na bum pa'i shes pa de'i shes pa'i dbya ba las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis khyad par med pa na bum pa'i shes pa de'i shes pa'i dbya ba las ni ma yin no //
translated: And if there is no difference due to having an aspect, the cognition of the pot is not from the cognition of the pot itself.

original: rnam pa med pa nyid yin yang rang nyid kho na yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa med pa nyid yin yang rang nyid kho na yin te /
translated: Even if it were without an aspect, it would be itself.

original: rnam pa med pa nyid du mtshungs pa yin yang ji ltar rnam pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi dbye ba'i nges pa rang bzhin can yin pa de bzhin du shes pa rnams ci'i phyir ma 'grub ce na /
analyzed: rnam pa med pa nyid du mtshungs pa yin yang ji ltar rnam pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi dbye ba'i nges pa rang bzhin can yin pa de bzhin du shes pa rnams ci'i phyir ma 'grub ce na /
translated: Although they are equal in being without aspects, why is it not established that cognitions are differentiated in the same way that those with aspects are differentiated by their intrinsic natures?

original: shes pa dang ma shes pa nyid kyis tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa dang ma shes pa nyid kyis tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are differentiated by being known and not being known.

original: bum pa dang de'i shes pa la sogs pa'i yul tha dad pa las des ma rig na shes pa tha dad pa yang ma yin la rig na yang tshul gnyis nyid yin no //
analyzed: bum pa dang de'i shes pa la sogs pa'i yul tha dad pa las des ma rig na shes pa tha dad pa yang ma yin la rig na yang tshul gnyis nyid yin no //
translated: If the object, such as a pot, and its cognition are different, then if the object is not known, the cognition is not known. If the object is known, then there are two modes.üîΩTherefore:

original: de'i phyir / yul du tha snyad 'dogs pa ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir / yul du tha snyad 'dogs pa ni //
translated: The designation of an object

original: shes la nges rtogs med na min //
analyzed: shes la nges rtogs med na min //
translated: does not occur without the ascertainment of a cognition.

original: de phyir shes bdag nyid gcig la //
analyzed: de phyir shes bdag nyid gcig la //
translated: Therefore, in a single cognition,

original: gzung bya tha dad rgyu mtshan ni //
analyzed: gzung bya tha dad rgyu mtshan ni //
translated: the cause of the differentiation of the apprehended

original: rig pa'i dbye ba 'grub 'di la //
analyzed: rig pa'i dbye ba 'grub 'di la //
translated: is established as the differentiation of the cognized.

original: rnam gzhan nged la ci zhig dgos //
analyzed: rnam gzhan nged la ci zhig dgos //
translated: What other mode do we need?

original: zhes bya ba'i don ni bden pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don ni bden pa ma yin no //
translated: The meaning of that is not true.

original: phyis kyi dus su dran pa las //
analyzed: phyis kyi dus su dran pa las //
translated: Because of memory at a later time,

original: 'di ni nges pa med ma yin //
analyzed: 'di ni nges pa med ma yin //
translated: this is not indeterminate.

original: zhes bya ba bshad pa ni ci 'dra zhig ces bya ba ni dran pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba bshad pa ni ci 'dra zhig ces bya ba ni dran pa ste /
translated: The explanation of this is: What is it like?

original: mngon sum gyis rtogs pa la lhag par mos pa ni /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis rtogs pa la lhag par mos pa ni /
translated: Faith in the realization of direct perception

original: rjes su dpag pa ma yin pa las yin gyi rjes su dpag pa las byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
